original: zhes pa rked pa stag gi pags pas g-yogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa rked pa stag gi pags pas g-yogs pa ste /
translated: The waist is covered with tiger skin.🔽

original: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can zhes pa'i don to //🔽rol zhon pa gzi brjid 'bar //
analyzed: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can zhes pa'i don to // rol zhon pa gzi brjid 'bar //
translated: The meaning of “wearing a tiger-skin skirt” is that the waist is covered with a tiger skin.🔽“Blazing with the splendor of a dancing posture” means that the two feet are in the dancing posture.

original: phyag gnyis gyen du dbu skyes ser //
analyzed: phyag gnyis gyen du dbu skyes ser //
translated: “The two hands are yellow, with hair standing upward” means that the two hands are yellow and have hair standing upward.

original: zhes pa'o // yang na thams cad rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // yang na thams cad rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Alternatively, everything is Vajradhara.

original: aa bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: aa bdag med ma ste /
translated: “A” is Nairātmya.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med pa sarba'o //🔽ae wam rnam pa zhes pa /
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pa sarba'o // ae wam rnam pa zhes pa /
translated: “Sarva” is the inseparability of the two.

original: ae wam ni /
analyzed: ae wam ni /
translated: “The form of evam” means that evam

original: ae yig cha byad bzang po gang //
analyzed: ae yig cha byad bzang po gang //
translated: is the letter “e,” which is a beautiful form,

original: dbus su wam yig gis brgyan pa //
analyzed: dbus su wam yig gis brgyan pa //
translated: adorned in the middle with the letter “vam.”

original: bde ba thams cad kyi ni gnas //🔽sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog / ces pa'i gsung las stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa /
analyzed: bde ba thams cad kyi ni gnas // sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog / ces pa'i gsung las stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa /
translated: It is the abode of all bliss,🔽the jeweled casket of the buddhas.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin ni ae wam ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin ni ae wam ste /
translated: The nature of bodhicitta, which is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, is evam.

original: gang gi rnam pa dang tshul de gnyis ka dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi rnam pa dang tshul de gnyis ka dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “Vajradhara” is the inseparability of those two forms and modes.

original: bshad ces pa khams byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: bshad ces pa khams byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: “Explained” means the bodhicitta element.

original: ya rlung gsung ngo //
analyzed: ya rlung gsung ngo //
translated: “Ya” is the wind of speech.

original: aa rdo rje ma gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sku ste /
analyzed: aa rdo rje ma gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sku ste /
translated: A is Vajrī, the nature of the aggregate of form, the body.

original: khy'a sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: khy'a sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: KṢA is the gnosis of the indivisibility of body, speech, and mind.

original: de rnams ae wam du gyur pa 'dis ni ji ltar bdag med rnal 'byor ma /
analyzed: de rnams ae wam du gyur pa 'dis ni ji ltar bdag med rnal 'byor ma /
translated: By these becoming E and VAM, it is as Nairātmyāyoginī.

original: ae wam gyi rnam pa nyid de /
analyzed: ae wam gyi rnam pa nyid de /
translated: E and VAM are the forms of Nairātmyāyoginī.

original: bdag med rnal 'byor ma ji lta ba de ltar mkha' 'gro ma thams cad ae wam nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag med rnal 'byor ma ji lta ba de ltar mkha' 'gro ma thams cad ae wam nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Just as Nairātmyāyoginī is so too are all the ḍākinīs E and VAM.

original: lag pa gcig ni thod pas brel //
analyzed: lag pa gcig ni thod pas brel //
translated: One hand is occupied with a skull-cup.

original: kam bde ba ste /
analyzed: kam bde ba ste /
translated: KAM is bliss.

original: skyong bar byed pa'i phyir ka p'a la /
analyzed: skyong bar byed pa'i phyir ka p'a la /
translated: It is a skull-cup because it protects.

original: padma chos 'byung bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: padma chos 'byung bdag med ma'o //
translated: The lotus is the source of phenomena, Nairātmyā.

original: gcig ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: gcig ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: One is Vajradhara.

original: thod pa gcig gi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: thod pa gcig gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: He is the nature of a single skull-cup.

original: lag pa ni lnga'i bdag nyid can gnyis te /
analyzed: lag pa ni lnga'i bdag nyid can gnyis te /
translated: Two hands are the nature of five.

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i ye shes zhes pa lag pa gcig ni thod pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i ye shes zhes pa lag pa gcig ni thod pa ste /
translated: The gnosis of the indivisibility of the three vajras is one hand occupied with a skull-cup.

original: 'dis gnyis ka dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis gnyis ka dbyer med pa'o //
translated: By this, both are indivisible.

original: brel ba ni dang po dang bral ba bya ghra ste /
analyzed: brel ba ni dang po dang bral ba bya ghra ste /
translated: Occupied is free from the first, which is a jhaṭiti.

original: ye shes de yang dang po spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes de yang dang po spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and that intuition is the first abandonment.

original: aa bdag med ma ste de dang dbyer med pa lag pa @153b gcig ni thod pas brel zhes pa'o //
analyzed: aa bdag med ma ste de dang dbyer med pa lag pa @153b gcig ni thod pas brel zhes pa'o //
translated: Abhayā is Nairātmya, and inseparable from her, one-handed, that is, holding a skull-cup.

original: g-yas pa na ni gri gug 'dzin //
analyzed: g-yas pa na ni gri gug 'dzin //
translated: In the right hand, a flaying knife.

original: g-yas pa na ni nyi ma rin chen dbang po ste /
analyzed: g-yas pa na ni nyi ma rin chen dbang po ste /
translated: In the right hand, the sun, Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: de'i rgyur gri gug 'dzin pa ji ltar gri gug gzung ba las gcod pa de bzhin du rin chen dbang po yang mi shes pa gcod par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rgyur gri gug 'dzin pa ji ltar gri gug gzung ba las gcod pa de bzhin du rin chen dbang po yang mi shes pa gcod par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: holding a flaying knife as its cause. Just as a flaying knife is held in order to cut, so Ratnasaṃbhava is the cutter of ignorance.

original: g-yas pa na ni gri gug 'dzin //
analyzed: g-yas pa na ni gri gug 'dzin //
translated: In the right hand, a flaying knife.

original: zhes pa 'dis bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa kho na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa kho na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: By this, Vajradhara is inseparable from Nairātmya.

original: kha tv'am ga yang g-yon nyid kyis //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga yang g-yon nyid kyis //
translated: The khaṭvāṅga is in the left hand.

original: zhes pa g-yon zla bas kha tv'am ga zhes pa stong pa nyid bcu drug bdag med ma rnam par dag pa byang chub kyi sems so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa g-yon zla bas kha tv'am ga zhes pa stong pa nyid bcu drug bdag med ma rnam par dag pa byang chub kyi sems so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The khaṭvāṅga is the left moon, the sixteen emptinesses, the pure Nairātmya, the bodhicitta.

original: stag gi pags pa rked par dkris //
analyzed: stag gi pags pa rked par dkris //
translated: A tiger skin is wrapped around the waist.

original: stag gi pags pa'i sgras gzugs sna tshogs pa spro ba'i bdag nyid kyis g-yogs pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: stag gi pags pa'i sgras gzugs sna tshogs pa spro ba'i bdag nyid kyis g-yogs pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The tiger skin is the conventional truth, which is the nature of the emission of various forms.

original: aa bdag med ma /
analyzed: aa bdag med ma /
translated: A is Nairātmya,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ste gnyis ka dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ste gnyis ka dbyer med pa'o //
translated: the ultimate truth, the inseparability of the two.

original: bde bar 'gro ba'i phyir rked pa ste /
analyzed: bde bar 'gro ba'i phyir rked pa ste /
translated: The waist is the path to bliss,

original: stag gi pags pa rked par dkris //
analyzed: stag gi pags pa rked par dkris //
translated: the tiger skin wrapped around the waist.

original: zhes pa 'dis bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang rab tu gsal bar mdzad do zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang rab tu gsal bar mdzad do zhes pa'i don no //
translated: This makes it clear that Vajradhara is inseparable from Nairātmya.

original: ro la zhon pa zhes pa ro chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: ro la zhon pa zhes pa ro chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Riding a corpse means that the corpse is the realm of reality.

original: de la zhon pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnams khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhon pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnams khyab pa'o //
translated: Riding it means that he pervades the realm of reality.

original: gzi brjid 'bar zhes pa rang bzhin med pa 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid 'bar zhes pa rang bzhin med pa 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Blazing with splendor means that he is clear light, which is essenceless.

original: phyag gnyis zhes pa bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: phyag gnyis zhes pa bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: Two arms means that he has the nature of the two truths.

original: ser po ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: ser po ni nyi ma'o //
translated: Yellow means the sun.

original: gyen du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes pa gyen du ste ser po dang gyen du yang yin pa'i phyir gyen du ser po'o //
analyzed: gyen du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes pa gyen du ste ser po dang gyen du yang yin pa'i phyir gyen du ser po'o //
translated: Upward means upward, and because it is yellow and upward, it is upward yellow.

original: dbu la skyes pa ni dbu skyes pa de zla ba'o //
analyzed: dbu la skyes pa ni dbu skyes pa de zla ba'o //
translated: The head-born is the moon.

original: gyen du ser po dang dbu skyes pa ni gyen du ser po dbu skyes so //
analyzed: gyen du ser po dang dbu skyes pa ni gyen du ser po dbu skyes so //
translated: The upward-yellow and head-born is the upward-yellow head-born.

original: 'di gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can a'a: a'a li bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can a'a: a'a li bsdus pa ste /
translated: The nature of these two is the A and A-lineage.

original: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa bsdus pa'i bdag nyid can nyid bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa bsdus pa'i bdag nyid can nyid bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The nature of the collection of wisdom and method is the Nairatmya mandala.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba de bzhin du rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor yang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba de bzhin du rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor yang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, just as the Nairatmya mandala, so also is the Vajradhara mandala.

original: gri gug gi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ;
analyzed: gri gug gi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ;
translated: The purity of the flaying knife is stated:

original: nga rgyal la sogs skyon drug rnams //
analyzed: nga rgyal la sogs skyon drug rnams //
translated: The six faults of pride and so forth

original: gcod phyir gri gug gnas pa nyid //
analyzed: gcod phyir gri gug gnas pa nyid //
translated: are cut, and so the flaying knife abides.

original: ces pa nga rgyal dang / gti mug dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / phrag dog dang / phra mo zhes pa skyon drug go //
analyzed: ces pa nga rgyal dang / gti mug dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / phrag dog dang / phra mo zhes pa skyon drug go //
translated: Pride, delusion, desire, hatred, jealousy, and pettiness are the six faults.

original: de rnams gcod pa'i phyir gri gug gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams gcod pa'i phyir gri gug gnas pa nyid de /
translated: In order to cut them, the flaying knife abides.

original: 'di'i skyon drug rnam par dag pa @154a * //
analyzed: 'di'i skyon drug rnam par dag pa @154a * //
translated: The six faults are purified

original: nyid do // skyon drug rnam par dag pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang / rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par dag pa kho na ste //
analyzed: nyid do // skyon drug rnam par dag pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang / rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par dag pa kho na ste //
translated: just in the purity of the five Tathagatas and Vajrasattva.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes pa'o //🔽dngos po dngos med rnam rtog gi //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes pa'o // dngos po dngos med rnam rtog gi //
translated: This is called “nondual intuition.”

original: mgo bo padma'i snod yin te /
analyzed: mgo bo padma'i snod yin te /
translated: The head is the vessel of the lotus,🔽the conceptualization of entity and nonentity.

original: dngos po 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'khor ba'o //
translated: “ Entity” is cyclic existence.

original: dngos med ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dngos med ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: “ Nonentity” is nirvana.

original: gnyis ka'i kun du rtog pa dang bral ba'i mgo bo dang po nyid kyis padma'i snod thod pa'i snod de /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i kun du rtog pa dang bral ba'i mgo bo dang po nyid kyis padma'i snod thod pa'i snod de /
translated: The head, free from the conceptualization of both, is the vessel of the lotus, the vessel of the skull.

original: gnyis su med pa rnam par dag pa thod pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa rnam par dag pa thod pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The purity of nonduality is called “skull.”

original: yang na / dngos po ni dngos por gyur pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: yang na / dngos po ni dngos por gyur pa skye ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, “entity” is the arising of that which has become an entity.

original: dngos med ni dngos por ma gyur pa skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos med ni dngos por ma gyur pa skye ba med pa ste /
translated: “ Nonentity” is the arising of that which has not become an entity.

original: skye ba nyid skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba nyid skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Arising itself is nonarising.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam rtog kun du rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam rtog kun du rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is free from the conceptualization of conceptualization.

original: de'i mgo bo de'i rtsa bas padma'i snod ye shes kyi gnas yin te /
analyzed: de'i mgo bo de'i rtsa bas padma'i snod ye shes kyi gnas yin te /
translated: The head of that lotus is the vessel of wisdom, the abode of wisdom.

original: de nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of “perfect wisdom.”

original: bdud rnams rnam pa bzhi yi khrag / dngos grub rgyu phyir btung bar bya //
analyzed: bdud rnams rnam pa bzhi yi khrag / dngos grub rgyu phyir btung bar bya //
translated: One should drink the blood of the four kinds of demons for the sake of power.

original: thod pa khrag gis bkang pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: thod pa khrag gis bkang pa zhes pa ste /
translated: The skull is filled with blood.

original: thod par de bdud bzhi po rnams kyi khrag btung bar bya ste /
analyzed: thod par de bdud bzhi po rnams kyi khrag btung bar bya ste /
translated: One should drink the blood of the four demons in the skull.

original: phung po la sogs bdud bzhi po de'i phyir bdud bzhi bcom pa las dngos grub du 'gyur zhing dngos grub kyi rgyu'i phyir btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs bdud bzhi po de'i phyir bdud bzhi bcom pa las dngos grub du 'gyur zhing dngos grub kyi rgyu'i phyir btung bar bya'o //
translated: For the sake of the four demons, the aggregates and so on, one should drink for the sake of power, which is the cause of power, by conquering the four demons.

original: yang na sems can rnams dga' ba med par byed pa'i phyir bdud de /
analyzed: yang na sems can rnams dga' ba med par byed pa'i phyir bdud de /
translated: Or, a demon is that which causes sentient beings to be without joy.

original: sems can dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: sems can dbang po rnams so //
translated: The faculties of sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyi yul la chags pa las dga' bar 'gyur zhing de dag log pa na dga' ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yul la chags pa las dga' bar 'gyur zhing de dag log pa na dga' ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: From attachment to their objects, they become joyful, and when they are reversed, they become without joy.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa bzhi po rnams kyis dbang po rnams kyi yul spang ste /
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa bzhi po rnams kyis dbang po rnams kyi yul spang ste /
translated: One should abandon the objects of the faculties by means of the four joys and so on.

original: 'dis ni bdud bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdud bzhi'o //
translated: This is the four demons.

original: de rnams kyi de dang 'brel ba'i khrag ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi de dang 'brel ba'i khrag ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Their blood, which is related to them, is the characteristic of passion.

original: btung zhing chags pa med par bya //
analyzed: btung zhing chags pa med par bya //
translated: One should drink it and be without passion.

original: chags pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyid las lhan cig skyes pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyid las lhan cig skyes pa ste /
translated: From the very nature of being without passion, it is innate.

original: lhan cig skyes pa nyid kyis kyang chags pa med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa nyid kyis kyang chags pa med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: And by being innate, one becomes without passion.

original: dngos grub rgyu phyir pa dngos grub ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dngos grub rgyu phyir pa dngos grub ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: For the sake of the cause of power, power is the effect.

original: rgyu ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni byed pa'o //

original: dngos grub nyid rgyu dang rgyu nyid 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: dngos grub nyid rgyu dang rgyu nyid 'bras bu ste /

analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i don du lhan cig skyes pa'i mthar thug pas rgyu dang 'bras bu yang lhan cig skyes pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //

analyzed: zhes pa kha tv'am ga'i rnam par dag pa gsungs te /

analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa @154b kha tv'am ga zhes pa'o //
translated: By the aspects of emptiness.🔽The purification of the khat

original: yang na / aam 'gro ba'i phyir aam ga'o //
analyzed: yang na / aam 'gro ba'i phyir aam ga'o //
translated: am is ga because of going.

analyzed: de yang kha tv'am ga mkha' la 'gro ba'i phyir mkha' spyod ma ste /
translated: And that is khaṭvāṅga because of going in the sky.

analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid do //
translated: And that is emptiness.

original: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How so? It is said:

analyzed: rnam pas zhes pa /
translated: By the aspect.

original: k'a k'a li dang / a'a a'a li ste /
analyzed: k'a k'a li dang / a'a a'a li ste /
translated: Ka is the kālī, and ā is the ālī.

analyzed: k'a zhes pa a'a li k'a li gnyis ka'i n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis so ;
translated: Ka is the two garlands of nāda of both ālī and kālī.

original: / ra ni de spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / ra ni de spong ba'i phyir ro //

original: sku mdog dang phyag dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can lha'i rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sku mdog dang phyag dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can lha'i rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin no //

original: rdzogs pa yi yang rim pa nyid //
analyzed: rdzogs pa yi yang rim pa nyid //

original: rdzogs pa'i sgras yongs su grub pa ste lha'i rnam pa dag gri gug la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sgras yongs su grub pa ste lha'i rnam pa dag gri gug la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: The word “perfection” means the perfect nature, the nature of the deity’s form, which is the nature of the pure nature of the flaying knife and so forth.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyis gang zhig rtogs par bya ba de ni rim pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyis gang zhig rtogs par bya ba de ni rim pa'o //
translated: The stage is that which is to be realized by the extremely pure nature of the perfect nature, which is the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: 'dis ni rim pa gnyis mnyam par gnas nas ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni rim pa gnyis mnyam par gnas nas ni /
translated: By this, the two stages are equal.

original: rdo rje can rnams dbyer med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje can rnams dbyer med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: The vajra holders are those who possess the indivisible gnosis.

original: chos 'chad do zhes pa de rnams chos ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: chos 'chad do zhes pa de rnams chos ston par mdzad do //
translated: They teach the Dharma. They teach the Dharma.

original: yang na rim pa ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rim pa ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the stage is realization.

original: ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes so //
translated: It is gnosis.

original: des bskyed pa ni bskyed pa'i sgras kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: des bskyed pa ni bskyed pa'i sgras kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That which is generated by that is the relative truth, which is the correct gnosis.

original: gang gi phyir gyi don la yang gi sgra ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gyi don la yang gi sgra ste /
translated: The word “also” in the phrase “for the sake of” has the meaning of “and.”

original: gang gi phyir nyid ces pa ae'i sgras chos 'byung bdag med ma dang / ba byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyid ces pa ae'i sgras chos 'byung bdag med ma dang / ba byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The word “itself” in “ultimate reality itself” means the source of phenomena, i.e., Nairātmya, and the “va” means the bodhicitta.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa dang / dbyer med pa kho na kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa dang / dbyer med pa kho na kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the two are inseparable, ultimate reality is precisely the conventional reality.

original: rdzogs pa nyid dang yang zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgras don dam pa'i bden pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa nyid dang yang zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgras don dam pa'i bden pa'i ye shes so //
translated: “ Perfection itself” is the wisdom of ultimate reality, the term for the perfection stage.

original: nyid dang yang zhes pa kho na'i don la yang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: nyid dang yang zhes pa kho na'i don la yang gi sgra'o //
translated: The word “itself” in “itself” means the very same thing as the word “precisely” in “precisely.”

original: de yang bden pa gnyis dbyer @156b med pa kho na ye shes zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bden pa gnyis dbyer @156b med pa kho na ye shes zhes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the inseparability of the two realities is precisely the wisdom.

original: de ltar rim pas gang zhig rim gnyis ye shes gnyis po de mnyam par gnas nas ni /
analyzed: de ltar rim pas gang zhig rim gnyis ye shes gnyis po de mnyam par gnas nas ni /
translated: Thus, in this way, the one who abides in the equality of the two wisdoms of the two stages,

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis nges par bya ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis nges par bya ste /
translated: should be ascertained by means of equality.

original: rdo rje can dbyer med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams chos 'chad do zhes pa /
analyzed: rdo rje can dbyer med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams chos 'chad do zhes pa /
translated: The vajra holders, who possess the wisdom of inseparability, teach the Dharma.

original: chos kyi sku ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ston par mdzad de /
translated: They manifest the dharmakāya.

original: 'di lta bu nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi sku bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi sku bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the very same as the Bhagavān’s dharmakāya, which is said to be the nature of the two truths.🔽The generated aspect has been explained.

original: bskyed pa'i cha ni bshad zin to zhes pa gtsug lag la ni 'dir rtags kyi tshig ma ning du bstan to //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i cha ni bshad zin to zhes pa gtsug lag la ni 'dir rtags kyi tshig ma ning du bstan to //
translated: Here in the treatise, the neuter words are taught.

original: nam mkha'i khams su bha ga bsam //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams su bha ga bsam //
translated: The bhaga is imagined in the space element.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: And so forth up to

original: dga' bral mthar yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' bral mthar yang de bzhin no //
translated: The end of the separation from joy is also like that.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis bskyed pa'i cha bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis bskyed pa'i cha bshad zin to //
translated: This explains the generated aspect.

original: yang na / bskyed pa'i cha zhes pa /
analyzed: yang na / bskyed pa'i cha zhes pa /
translated: Or, the generated aspect is

original: bskyed pa'i sgras rab tu rtogs pa dang spangs pa'i ye shes te bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i sgras rab tu rtogs pa dang spangs pa'i ye shes te bdag med ma'o //
translated: the generated wisdom of realization and abandonment, which is Nairātmya.

original: cha ni rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: cha ni rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: The aspect is the division.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de'i bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang ngo /
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de'i bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang ngo /
translated: The nature of Vajradhara is the nature of the five wisdoms, such as mirror-like wisdom.

original: bskyed pa dang cha yang bskyed pa'i cha ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa dang cha yang bskyed pa'i cha ste /
translated: The generated and the aspect are the generated aspect.

original: gnyis su med pa nyid las ma ning ngo //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa nyid las ma ning ngo //
translated: From the nonduality, the neuter.

original: de bshad zin te rab tu bstan to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bshad zin te rab tu bstan to zhes pa'o //
translated: That has been explained and taught.

original: gsungs pa'i bskyed pa'i cha nyid rdzogs pa nyid kyis kyang bshad par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i bskyed pa'i cha nyid rdzogs pa nyid kyis kyang bshad par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to explain the perfection of the very generation, it is said:

original: mkha' khams la zhes padma la //
analyzed: mkha' khams la zhes padma la //
translated: In the realm of space, in the lotus,

original: bha ga zhes pa ye shes brjod //
analyzed: bha ga zhes pa ye shes brjod //
translated: the bhaga is said to be gnosis.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim par bshad na nam mkha'i khams la zhes pa padma chos 'byung rten du gyur pa rnams la /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim par bshad na nam mkha'i khams la zhes pa padma chos 'byung rten du gyur pa rnams la /
translated: If explained in the completion stage, in the realm of space, in the lotus, the source of phenomena, the support,

original: brten par gyur pa bha ga / ye shes rdo rje zhes brjod pa ye shes so //
analyzed: brten par gyur pa bha ga / ye shes rdo rje zhes brjod pa ye shes so //
translated: the supported is the bhaga, the gnosis vajra, which is gnosis.

original: sgom pa zhes pa snyoms 'jug ste //
analyzed: sgom pa zhes pa snyoms 'jug ste //
translated: Meditation is union.

original: de yi bde ba 'khor lor brjod //
analyzed: de yi bde ba 'khor lor brjod //
translated: Its bliss is said to be the wheel.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The gnosis of realization through sameness

original: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
translated: is the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: de'i bde ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i ye shes ni 'khor lor brjod //
analyzed: de'i bde ba snyoms par 'jug pa'i ye shes ni 'khor lor brjod //
translated: Its bliss, the gnosis of union, is said to be the wheel.

original: ji ltar rigs par rang rig ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par rang rig ste /
translated: It is self-awareness, as is appropriate.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa na gang zhig dga' ba la sogs pa'i ye shes de ni rang gi rig pa ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa na gang zhig dga' ba la sogs pa'i ye shes de ni rang gi rig pa ste /
translated: In the union, the gnosis of joy and so on is self-awareness,

original: bdag nyid rig pa'i ngo bo nyid las so //
analyzed: bdag nyid rig pa'i ngo bo nyid las so //
translated: from the nature of self-awareness.

original: lha ni byang chub sems yin no //
analyzed: lha ni byang chub sems yin no //
translated: The deity is the enlightened mind.

original: zhes pa de nyid byang chub kyi sems gang zhig stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid lha'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de nyid byang chub kyi sems gang zhig stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid lha'o //
translated: That very enlightened mind, which is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, is the deity.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba khu ba yin //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba khu ba yin //
translated: How is it that the semen is the element?

original: de phyir lhan skyes rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: de phyir lhan skyes rnam pa gnyis //
translated: Therefore, there are two types of connate.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba'i sgras khu ba brjod de /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba'i sgras khu ba brjod de /
translated: The word “how” indicates semen.

original: khu ba de nyid lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: khu ba de nyid lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: That very semen is connate.

original: @157a * // de'i phyir zhes pa rgyu de nyid las rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: @157a * // de'i phyir zhes pa rgyu de nyid las rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, from that very cause, there are two types.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two types of connate.

original: re zhig btsun mo shes rab yin //
analyzed: re zhig btsun mo shes rab yin //
translated: First, the queen is wisdom.

original: zhes pa gang zhig bud med kyi rang bzhin de ni re zhig lhan cig skyes pa shes rab yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa gang zhig bud med kyi rang bzhin de ni re zhig lhan cig skyes pa shes rab yin no //
translated: That which has the nature of a woman is first the connate wisdom.

original: thabs ni skyes bur brjod pa ste //
analyzed: thabs ni skyes bur brjod pa ste //
translated: The method is said to be the person.

original: zhes pa gang zhig khu ba'i rang bzhin de ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa gang zhig khu ba'i rang bzhin de ni skyes bu'o //
translated: That which has the nature of semen is the person.

original: 'di ni khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa dag thabs dang shes rab nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa dag thabs dang shes rab nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the connate and the method and wisdom.

original: phyi nas 'di dag rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: phyi nas 'di dag rnam pa gnyis //
translated: And later, these two aspects.

original: 'di dag zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dag gi re re la rnam pa gnyis nyid de /
analyzed: 'di dag zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dag gi re re la rnam pa gnyis nyid de /
translated: These two aspects are in each of wisdom and means.

original: don dam kun rdzob dbye ba las //🔽don dam ni don dam pa'i bden pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam kun rdzob dbye ba las // don dam ni don dam pa'i bden pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: From the division of ultimate and relative,🔽the ultimate is the ultimate truth, the coemergent.

original: kun rdzob ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa khu ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa khu ba'o //
translated: The relative is the relative truth, the seminal fluid.

original: re zhig skyes bu rnam pa gnyis //🔽khu ba de yi bde ba yang //
analyzed: re zhig skyes bu rnam pa gnyis // khu ba de yi bde ba yang //
translated: First, there are two kinds of men.🔽And the pleasure of that seminal fluid

original: gang zhig khu ba dang 'brel ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig khu ba dang 'brel ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: is the pleasure associated with the seminal fluid.

original: skyes bu ji bzhin shes rab la'ang //🔽khu ba de yi bde ba yang //
analyzed: skyes bu ji bzhin shes rab la'ang // khu ba de yi bde ba yang //
translated: Just as with the man, so also with wisdom.🔽And the pleasure of that seminal fluid

original: de nyid phyir na dga' ba nyid //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na dga' ba nyid //
translated: is the same as the joy.

original: bzhi po rnams kyi rab dbye ba //
analyzed: bzhi po rnams kyi rab dbye ba //
translated: Therefore, the division of the four🔽joys is as follows.

original: bzhi po rnams kyi zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams la zhes pa gcig gi tshig la padma rnams la zhes pa mang po tshig ste /
analyzed: bzhi po rnams kyi zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams la zhes pa gcig gi tshig la padma rnams la zhes pa mang po tshig ste /
translated: The four is the singular case of “in the space element,” and the many cases of “in the lotuses.”

original: gang zhig dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dga' ba rnams kyi yang shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis bzhi po rnams zhes bud med kyi rtags kyi bstan to //🔽gang phyir lhan skyes rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: gang zhig dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dga' ba rnams kyi yang shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis bzhi po rnams zhes bud med kyi rtags kyi bstan to // gang phyir lhan skyes rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The four joys are taught by the term “women” because of their nature as the four joys and because of their nature as method and wisdom.

original: rgyu gang gi phyir lhan cig skyes pa rnams pa bzhir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir lhan cig skyes pa rnams pa bzhir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why are there four types of connate?

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs las te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs las te /
translated: Because of the stage of completion.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because of the stage of completion, because of the realization of the yoginīs’ wheel, which is the nature of the utterly pure dharmadhātu.

original: dga' ba dang po dpa' bo ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang po dpa' bo ste /
translated: The first joy is the hero.

original: dpa' bo ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The hero is Vajradhara.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med pa las ma ning ngo //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pa las ma ning ngo //
translated: From the inseparability of the two, the neuter.

original: mchog tu dga' ba rnal 'byor ma /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba rnal 'byor ma /
translated: Supreme joy is the yoginī.

original: rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma'o //🔽shin tu bde dga' mtha' dag nges //🔽bzang po'i dga' ba ni shin tu bde ba ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma'o // shin tu bde dga' mtha' dag nges // bzang po'i dga' ba ni shin tu bde ba ste /
translated: The yoginī is Nairātmya.🔽The joy of supreme bliss is ascertained.

original: nges pa ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: The joy of supreme bliss is ascertained.

original: gang gi phyir mtha' dag ste dus mnyam pa nyid du dbang po dang yul rnams gang du thim par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtha' dag ste dus mnyam pa nyid du dbang po dang yul rnams gang du thim par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the dissolution of all the sense faculties and objects simultaneously.

original: shin tu bde ba de yang nges pa'i dga' ba ste //
analyzed: shin tu bde ba de yang nges pa'i dga' ba ste //
translated: That bliss is also the definitive joy.

original: shin tu bde dga' zhes pa dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu bde dga' zhes pa dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
translated: The bliss of joy is the joy of the separation from joy.

original: de yang mtha' dag rdo rje 'chang dang @157b bdag med ma nyid dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mtha' dag rdo rje 'chang dang @157b bdag med ma nyid dbyer med pa'o //
translated: That is also the totality, which is the indivisibility of Vajradhara and Nairātmya.🔽The method of that bliss is the knowledge of all.

original: de bde thabs ni thams cad rig / de las bar ma chad par gang zhig bde ba lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa dang / thabs ni byang chub kyi sems khu ba'o //
analyzed: de bde thabs ni thams cad rig / de las bar ma chad par gang zhig bde ba lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa dang / thabs ni byang chub kyi sems khu ba'o //
translated: The method is the bodhicitta, the seminal essence.

original: de gnyis nyid thams cad rig thams cad shes pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis nyid thams cad rig thams cad shes pa'o //
translated: Those two are the knowledge of all, the consciousness of all.

original: dga' bas bde ba cung zad de ;🔽/ zhes pa /
analyzed: dga' bas bde ba cung zad de ; / zhes pa /
translated: The bliss of joy is slight.

original: dga' ba dang po dpa' bo ste //🔽zhes kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: dga' ba dang po dpa' bo ste // zhes kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid can /
translated: The first joy is the hero.

original: rdo rje 'chang du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang du gsungs pa /
translated: It is said to be Vajradhara, who has the nature of the conventional truth.

original: de ci lta bu zhe na rgyas par ston pa bde ba ye shes kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de ci lta bu zhe na rgyas par ston pa bde ba ye shes kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: What is that like? It is taught extensively: the aspect of the gnosis of bliss.

original: cung zad ces pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: cung zad ces pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can te /
translated: The “slight” is the nature of the extremely pure dharmadhātu.

original: dbang po dang yul rtogs pa'i rang bzhin can kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul rtogs pa'i rang bzhin can kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: It is the gnosis that is the nature of the relative truth, which has the nature of the realization of the sense organs and objects.

original: mchog tu dga' ba de bas lhag / ces pa /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba de bas lhag / ces pa /
translated: The supreme joy is beyond that.

original: mchog tu dga' ba rnal 'byor ma zhes pa gang yin pa de rgyas par ston pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba rnal 'byor ma zhes pa gang yin pa de rgyas par ston pa ste /
translated: The supreme joy is the yoginī, which is taught extensively.

original: mchog rmad du byung ba ste /
analyzed: mchog rmad du byung ba ste /
translated: It is the supreme wonder.

original: dga' ba lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: It is the connate joy.

original: de bas lhag ces pa lhag pa nyid lhag pa ste /
analyzed: de bas lhag ces pa lhag pa nyid lhag pa ste /
translated: “Beyond that” is the superiority of the superiority.

original: de phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes las lhag pa don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes las lhag pa don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
translated: Therefore, the gnosis that is the nature of the ultimate truth is beyond the gnosis that is the nature of the relative truth.

original: yang na / de bas lhag pa ni 'dzin pa lhag pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: yang na / de bas lhag pa ni 'dzin pa lhag pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Or, “beyond that” is the bliss of the superiority of the apprehender.

original: de nyid lhag pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid lhag pa ste /
translated: That itself is the superiority.

original: lhan cig skyes pa rtogs pas 'khyud pa'i ye shes de nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa rtogs pas 'khyud pa'i ye shes de nyid ces pa'o //
translated: That gnosis is the connate joy, which is the realization of the embrace.

original: dga' bral dga' bas chags bral 'gyur //
analyzed: dga' bral dga' bas chags bral 'gyur //
translated: The joy of the separation from joy is the separation from passion.

original: zhes pa / shin tu bde dga' mtha' dag nges //
analyzed: zhes pa / shin tu bde dga' mtha' dag nges //
translated: The verse that goes, “All the limits of bliss and joy are ascertained”

original: zhes pa gang yin pa de rgyas par ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa gang yin pa de rgyas par ston pa ste /
translated: is taught extensively.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' ba ni dga' bral lo //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' ba ni dga' bral lo //
translated: Joy that is superior is the joy of separation.

original: de dga' bral dang dga' ba yang yin pa'i phyir dga' bral dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de dga' bral dang dga' ba yang yin pa'i phyir dga' bral dga' ba ste /
translated: Because it is both the joy of separation and joy, it is the joy of the joy of separation.

original: dga' ba gsum gyi bdag nyid las dga' ba rnams kyis zhes pa mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: dga' ba gsum gyi bdag nyid las dga' ba rnams kyis zhes pa mang po'i tshig go //
translated: From the nature of the three joys, “joys” is a plural term.

original: chags bral ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i chags pa ste /
analyzed: chags bral ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i chags pa ste /
translated: Separation from attachment is superior attachment.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' bas khyad par du 'phags pa'i chags pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' bas khyad par du 'phags pa'i chags pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Superior joy is superior attachment.

original: yang na / dga' bral dga' bas zhes pa /
analyzed: yang na / dga' bral dga' bas zhes pa /
translated: Or, “the joy of the joy of separation”

original: dga' ba dang / mchog dga' dag gis rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis lhan cig skyes pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / mchog dga' dag gis rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis lhan cig skyes pa gnyis te /
translated: is the two types of connate gnosis, which is the nature of Vajradhara and Nairātmya, through the joy and supreme joy.

original: de yang / dbang po yul gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang / dbang po yul gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it is said, “The nature of the sense organ and object.”

original: de gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid kyis gnyis ka'i dga' ba dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid kyis gnyis ka'i dga' ba dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because those two are inseparable, there is the joy of both.

original: rnam par shes pa las kyang de'i @158a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las kyang de'i @158a * //
translated: It is not from consciousness.🔽

original: bdag nyid kyis bde ba'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bde ba'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
translated: And from consciousness, too, it is the nature of the bliss aspect,

original: ngo bo gcig tu rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo gcig tu rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: by the realization of the single essence.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid las //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid las //
translated: From the nature of the three vajras,

original: dga' bral dga' bas chags bral 'gyur //
analyzed: dga' bral dga' bas chags bral 'gyur //
translated: the bliss of separation from joy is free from attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni chags bral lo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni chags bral lo //
translated: “Separation from attachment” is free from attachment.

original: 'dod chags ni kun du chags pa'i mtshan nyid de ;
analyzed: 'dod chags ni kun du chags pa'i mtshan nyid de ;
translated: Attachment is the characteristic of complete attachment,

original: dbang po dang yul gyi kun du chags pa'i mtshan nyid las rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul gyi kun du chags pa'i mtshan nyid las rnam par grol ba /
translated: and from the characteristic of complete attachment to the sense faculties and objects, it is liberated.

original: rnam par shes pa bde ba gcig pu'i ngo bor yongs su gnas pa gang yin pa der 'gyur te de yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bde ba gcig pu'i ngo bor yongs su gnas pa gang yin pa der 'gyur te de yin no //
translated: It becomes that which is the single essence of blissful consciousness, and that is it.

original: de yang kun du chags pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang kun du chags pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: And that is also the nature of complete attachment.

original: gal te de ltar na /🔽lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ji lta bu zhe na /🔽lhag ma lhan cig skyes dga' nyid //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ji lta bu zhe na / lhag ma lhan cig skyes dga' nyid //
translated: If it is like that,🔽how is the connate joy?🔽The remainder is connate joy itself.

original: lhag ma zhes pa bde ba'i rnam pa nye bar dmigs pa'i dga' ba /
analyzed: lhag ma zhes pa bde ba'i rnam pa nye bar dmigs pa'i dga' ba /
translated: The remainder is the joy of the observation of the aspect of bliss.

original: dbang po dang yul tha dad med pa bde ba'i rnam pa yongs su gyur pa kun du chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dga' bral la /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul tha dad med pa bde ba'i rnam pa yongs su gyur pa kun du chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dga' bral la /
translated: The consciousness that has the characteristic of attachment, which is the complete transformation of the aspect of bliss, is the nondifferentiation of the sense faculty and the object.

original: lhan cig skyes dga' zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes dga' zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The connate joy is connate pristine awareness.

original: de ni bde ba spangs nas min //
analyzed: de ni bde ba spangs nas min //
translated: It is not without bliss.

original: zhes pa'i gsungs las khu ba dang bde bdag bskyed bya skyed byed kyi khyad par gyi phyir chags pa dang chags bral rnams 'dres par gyur pa nyid kyis chags pa dang chags bral rnam par spangs pa yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsungs las khu ba dang bde bdag bskyed bya skyed byed kyi khyad par gyi phyir chags pa dang chags bral rnams 'dres par gyur pa nyid kyis chags pa dang chags bral rnam par spangs pa yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes pa ste /
translated: Because of the difference between the producer and the produced, the semen and the bliss, the connate pristine awareness is the perfect pristine awareness that is free from attachment and aversion because of the mixture of attachment and aversion.

original: 'di ni / de bde thabs ni thams cad rig / ces pa gang yin pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bde thabs ni thams cad rig / ces pa gang yin pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the verse, “It knows all the methods of bliss.”

original: dang po rig par 'dod pa sta /
analyzed: dang po rig par 'dod pa sta /
translated: The first pristine awareness is asserted to be the desire.

original: ye shes kyi dang po reg par 'dod pas 'jug pa'o zhes pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dang po reg par 'dod pas 'jug pa'o zhes pa /
translated: The first pristine awareness is the desire to enter through contact.

original: dga' bas bde ba cung zad de //
analyzed: dga' bas bde ba cung zad de //
translated: Joy is a little bliss.

original: zhes pa gang yin pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa gang yin pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of that.

original: gnyis pa bde ba 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa bde ba 'dod pa'o //
translated: The second is the desire for pleasure.

original: zhes pa / gang zhig reg pa de la bde ba 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhes pa / gang zhig reg pa de la bde ba 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: The desire for pleasure is the desire for pleasure in that contact.

original: mchog tu dga' bde bas lhag / ces pa gang yin pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' bde bas lhag / ces pa gang yin pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of that.

original: gsum pa 'dod chags nyams pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gsum pa 'dod chags nyams pa'i phyir //
translated: The third is the decline of passion.

original: dbang po dang yul dbye ba med pas shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i phyir 'dod chags nyams pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dbye ba med pas shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i phyir 'dod chags nyams pa ste /
translated: The decline of passion is due to the inseparability of wisdom and means, because there is no differentiation of faculties and objects.

original: dbang po dang yul gyi kun du chags pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul gyi kun du chags pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is freedom from attachment to faculties and objects.

original: de'i phyir / dga' bral dga' bas chags bral 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dga' bral dga' bas chags bral 'gyur //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes pa gang yin pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa gang yin pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: the extensive explanation of that is:

original: des na bzhi pa bsgom par bya //
analyzed: des na bzhi pa bsgom par bya //
translated: The fourth is to be cultivated.

original: des na zhes pa @158b 'dod chags nyams pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: des na zhes pa @158b 'dod chags nyams pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The fourth is to be cultivated because of the decline of passion.

original: bde ba'i rnam pa yong su gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa las kyang dbu mar gnas pa'i phyir 'dod chags nyams pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam pa yong su gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa las kyang dbu mar gnas pa'i phyir 'dod chags nyams pa'o //
translated: And because consciousness, which has become the aspect of bliss, is located in the central channel, passion is destroyed.

original: rgyu des na bsgom zhing snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na bsgom zhing snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: For that reason, one should cultivate and enter into meditative union.

original: khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa dag las dbyer med pa nyid do rje 'chang gi ye shes so zhes nges par bya ste /
analyzed: khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa dag las dbyer med pa nyid do rje 'chang gi ye shes so zhes nges par bya ste /
translated: One should ascertain that the exalted wisdom of Vajradhara is inseparable from the semen and the innate joy.

original: lhag ma lhan cig skyes dga' nyid //
analyzed: lhag ma lhan cig skyes dga' nyid //
translated: The rest is just innate joy.

original: ces pa gang yin pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //🔽da ni bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ces pa gang yin pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o // da ni bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa kho na'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of that.

original: rdo rje 'chang ngo zhes rab tu gsal bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ngo zhes rab tu gsal bar mdzad pa /
translated: Now, in order to make it very clear that Vajradhara is inseparable from Nairatmya,🔽it is said:

original: mchog tu dga' ba srid par brjod /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba srid par brjod /
translated: Supreme joy is said to be existence.

original: mchog tu dga' ba de ni srid pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba de ni srid pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa /
translated: That supreme joy is existence, the conventional truth,

original: rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes te /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes te /
translated: the exalted wisdom of Vajradhara.

original: sngar mchog tu dga' ba rnal 'byor ma zhes gsungs pa las /
analyzed: sngar mchog tu dga' ba rnal 'byor ma zhes gsungs pa las /
translated: Previously, supreme joy was said to be the Yoginī.

original: de ni de nyid rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de nyid rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that is the exalted wisdom of Vajradhara,

original: 'di gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes so zhes pa ste /
translated: The wisdom that has the nature of the inseparability of these two.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis dga' ba bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba las shes rab dang thabs dag la yang dbye ba med pa'i phyir dga' ba bzhi po lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes dang dbyer med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis dga' ba bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba las shes rab dang thabs dag la yang dbye ba med pa'i phyir dga' ba bzhi po lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes dang dbyer med pa kho na'o //
translated: Because of the nature of wisdom and method, the four joys are distinguished. Since there is no distinction in wisdom and method, the four joys are inseparable from the connate wisdom.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: chags bral las ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: chags bral las ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: Nirvana is from the absence of passion.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i chags pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam pa'i bden pa bdag med ma'i ye shes te /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i chags pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam pa'i bden pa bdag med ma'i ye shes te /
translated: The characteristic of passion that is superior is the wisdom of ultimate truth, Nairātmya.

original: srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dbyer med pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dbyer med pa gang yin pa /
translated: It is the inseparability of existence and nirvana.

original: dbu ma dga' ba tsam zhig ni //
analyzed: dbu ma dga' ba tsam zhig ni //
translated: The mere joy of the middle

original: lhan skyes 'di rnams kyis spangs pa'o //
analyzed: lhan skyes 'di rnams kyis spangs pa'o //
translated: is abandoned by these connates.

original: zhes pa gang zhig gzu bor gyur pa de ni dbu ma yin la /🔽de ni dga' ba tsam ste /
analyzed: zhes pa gang zhig gzu bor gyur pa de ni dbu ma yin la / de ni dga' ba tsam ste /
translated: The middle is that which is straightforward.🔽It is mere joy.

original: bde ba'i ye shes de 'ba' zhig nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba'i ye shes de 'ba' zhig nyid do //
translated: It is only the wisdom of bliss.

original: de ni mchog dga' la sogs pa rnams kyi rtsa ba nyid bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mchog dga' la sogs pa rnams kyi rtsa ba nyid bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the root of the supreme joy, etc.

original: de ni thams cad thun mong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni thams cad thun mong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the commonality of all.

original: de yang lhan cig skyes pa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de yang lhan cig skyes pa bzhi pa ste /
translated: It is the fourth, the innate.

original: gsum po 'di rnams kyis spongs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di rnams kyis spongs pa'o //
translated: It is abandoned by these three.

original: gsum po 'di yang de la /
analyzed: gsum po 'di yang de la /
translated: And these three are in that.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis de nyid du rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis de nyid du rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the entry into that very nature,

original: nye bar dmigs pa med pas 'di rnams kyis rnam pa sna tshogs pas spangs shing yongs su dor ba yin la /
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa med pas 'di rnams kyis rnam pa sna tshogs pas spangs shing yongs su dor ba yin la /
translated: these are abandoned by the various kinds of non-apprehension and are completely rejected.

original: dga' ba gsum po lhan cig skyes pa las gzhan yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba gsum po lhan cig skyes pa las gzhan yang ma yin te /
translated: The innate is not other than the three joys,

original: thams cad de nyid kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad de nyid kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because everything is included in that very nature.

original: yang @159a na gang /
analyzed: yang @159a na gang /
translated: Or else,

original: mchog tu dga' ba srid pa ni /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba srid pa ni /
translated: existence is the supreme joy.

original: yang dag pa'i chags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de srid pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de srid pa ste /
translated: That which has the characteristic of true passion is existence,

original: rtag pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of permanence.

original: chags bral las ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: chags bral las ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: Nirvana is from the absence of passion.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang chags bral te chang pa'o ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang chags bral te chang pa'o ;
translated: That which is the characteristic of nirvāṇa, free from attachment, is also free from attachment.

original: / srid pa dang mya ngan 'das pa rtag pa dang chad pa gnyis ka rnam par spangs pa gang yin pa dbu ma bar mar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: / srid pa dang mya ngan 'das pa rtag pa dang chad pa gnyis ka rnam par spangs pa gang yin pa dbu ma bar mar gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is the middle way, free from eternalism and nihilism with respect to existence and nirvāṇa, is the middle.

original: de yang dga' ba tsam gyi ye shes 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de yang dga' ba tsam gyi ye shes 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: Moreover, that is the mere wisdom of joy.

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: And that also

original: mtshan ma'i rgyu ba 'byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rgyu ba 'byung ba kho na'o //
translated: is the arising of the movement of signs.

original: gang zhig lhan cig skyes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: gang zhig lhan cig skyes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes te /
translated: That which is connate is the wisdom of perfect buddhahood.

original: da ni 'di rnams kyis spangs zhes pa rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni 'di rnams kyis spangs zhes pa rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Now, “they abandon” means that they abandon eternalism, nihilism, and so on.

original: lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa de ni gsum po 'di rnams nyid dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa de ni gsum po 'di rnams nyid dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: That which is connate is connate with these three.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: spangs pa khyad par gyis yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa khyad par gyis yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: It is completely abandoned by the special abandonment.

original: 'dis ni lhan cig skyes pa nyid dga' ba bzhir skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni lhan cig skyes pa nyid dga' ba bzhir skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: This connateness arises as the four joys.

original: thig le bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thig le bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Since it has the nature of the four bindus, the sixteen emptinesses are purified, and that is the connate gnosis.

original: dga' ba dang po dpa' bo ste //
analyzed: dga' ba dang po dpa' bo ste //
translated: The first joy is the hero.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa bzhi dang / dga' ba bde ba cung zad de //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa bzhi dang / dga' ba bde ba cung zad de //
translated: The four brief explanations are “The first joy is a slight bliss,” and so on.🔽The four extensive explanations are “The second joy is the supreme,” and so on.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bshad pa bzhi dang / dang po reg par 'dod pa ste //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa shin tu rgyas par bshad pa bzhi dang / mchog tu dga' ba srid par brjod //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bshad pa bzhi dang / dang po reg par 'dod pa ste // zhes pa la sogs pa shin tu rgyas par bshad pa bzhi dang / mchog tu dga' ba srid par brjod //
translated: The four very extensive explanations are “The first is the desire to touch,” and so on.

original: ces pa la sogs pa mjug bsdu ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa mjug bsdu ba bzhi ste /
translated: The four summaries are “Supreme joy is said to be existence,” and so on.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug gi bdag nyid can kho na lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug gi bdag nyid can kho na lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The connate gnosis is the nature of the sixteen emptinesses.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba la sogs pa dga' ba gsum ni lhan cig skyes pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir tha dad med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis lhan cig skyes pa mtshan ma'i yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba la sogs pa dga' ba gsum ni lhan cig skyes pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir tha dad med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis lhan cig skyes pa mtshan ma'i yul ma yin pa /
translated: Since the three joys, beginning with joy, are not other than the connate, they are connate, not objects of signs, by nature of being undifferentiated.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa /
translated: It is not of the nature of grasped or grasper.

original: rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the domain of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gzhan gyis brjod min lhan cig skyes //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod min lhan cig skyes //
translated: The connate is not to be expressed by another.

original: gang du yang ni mi rnyed de //🔽bla ma brgyud pas nyer bsten pas //
analyzed: gang du yang ni mi rnyed de // bla ma brgyud pas nyer bsten pas //
translated: It is not found anywhere.🔽It is to be known from my merit

original: bdag gis bsod nams las shes bya //🔽gzhan gyis su yis brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis bsod nams las shes bya // gzhan gyis su yis brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: through attending to the lineage gurus.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ngag gi lam las 'das pa'i phyir ro //🔽@159b dngos po la gang du yang rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ngag gi lam las 'das pa'i phyir ro // @159b dngos po la gang du yang rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not to be expressed by another because the connate is beyond the path of speech.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not found anywhere in things because it is beyond the domain of grasped and grasper.

original: bdag gis shes bya rang nyid kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis shes bya rang nyid kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It is to be known by oneself.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: bsod nams las zhes pa bsod nams kyi tshogs las so //
analyzed: bsod nams las zhes pa bsod nams kyi tshogs las so //
translated: From merit, that is, from the accumulation of merit.

original: rgyu de nyid kyi phyir bla ma brgyud pa nye bar bstan par bya lte ;
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyi phyir bla ma brgyud pa nye bar bstan par bya lte ;
translated: For that very reason, it is to be known through attending to the lineage gurus.

original: bla ma gzhan dang gzhan bsten pa de las de mnyes pas bla ma'i drin las khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma gzhan dang gzhan bsten pa de las de mnyes pas bla ma'i drin las khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: From that, by pleasing him, one will understand through the guru’s kindness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs las ye shes kyi tshogs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs las ye shes kyi tshogs zhes brjod do //
translated: For that very reason, the accumulation of wisdom is said to come from the accumulation of merit.

original: yang na gang /
analyzed: yang na gang /
translated: Or else, what?

original: bdag gis shes bya rang gis nyams su myong bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gis shes bya rang gis nyams su myong bar bya ste /
translated: I will experience the object of knowledge by myself.

original: rang nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of self-experience is connate.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is contradictory for an action to be done on itself,

original: rang rig pa zhes pa shin tu phra mo ste /
analyzed: rang rig pa zhes pa shin tu phra mo ste /
translated: self-awareness is extremely subtle.

original: lhan cig skyes pa de rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul yang ma yin no zhes pa ngag dang lus dang sems las 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa de rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul yang ma yin no zhes pa ngag dang lus dang sems las 'das pa nyid do //
translated: That connate [wisdom] is not even the domain of consciousness. It is said to be beyond speech, body, and mind.

original: de ltar na ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na ci ltar zhe na /
translated: In that case, how?

original: bsod nams las zhes pa bsod nams kyi tshogs las te /
analyzed: bsod nams las zhes pa bsod nams kyi tshogs las te /
translated: From merit means from the accumulation of merit.

original: bla ma brgyud pa nyer bsten pa //
analyzed: bla ma brgyud pa nyer bsten pa //
translated: By attending to the lineage of gurus

original: zhes pa bla ma'i rim pa goms pa las so //
analyzed: zhes pa bla ma'i rim pa goms pa las so //
translated: means from cultivating the stages of the guru.

original: 'dis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rim pa lnga dang bral bas yang dag pa'i de kho na rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rim pa lnga dang bral bas yang dag pa'i de kho na rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
translated: By this, one does not attain the real suchness, because one is devoid of the five stages of manifest, perfect enlightenment.

original: thog mar kun shes pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: thog mar kun shes pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: First, by the state of all-knowing, one is liberated from the eight worldly dharmas.

original: de nas bstan pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bstan pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Then, by the state of teaching,

original: de las spong ba'o //
analyzed: de las spong ba'o //
translated: one is liberated from that.

original: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is that like?

original: ye shes kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dbyer med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa rim pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dbyer med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa rim pa ste /
translated: The wisdom of the relative and the ultimate are inseparable, which is the stage.

original: rim pa 'dis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises by this stage.

original: de la gdams ngag ste /
analyzed: de la gdams ngag ste /
translated: That is the instruction.

original: gang zhig skyes pa'i ye shes de ni de nyid do zhes pa dang / de thams cad khyod la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi thabs su ster ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig skyes pa'i ye shes de ni de nyid do zhes pa dang / de thams cad khyod la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi thabs su ster ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises is suchness, and all of that is given to you as the method of the mahāmudrā siddhi.

original: gnang ba ni khyod kyis kyang byang chub snying po'i mthar thug pa 'gro ba'i don phun sum tshogs pa'i ched du dad pa'i stobs dang dran pa'i stobs dang brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang shes rab kyi stobs kyang yongs su spang bar mi bya'o zhes pa kun shes pa
analyzed: gnang ba ni khyod kyis kyang byang chub snying po'i mthar thug pa 'gro ba'i don phun sum tshogs pa'i ched du dad pa'i stobs dang dran pa'i stobs dang brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang shes rab kyi stobs kyang yongs su spang bar mi bya'o zhes pa kun shes pa
translated: The permission is: “You should not abandon the power of faith, the power of mindfulness, the power of diligence, and the power of wisdom for the sake of the perfection of the benefit of migrating beings up to the essence of enlightenment.”

original: dang / bstan pa dang / rim pa dang / gdams ngag dang / gnang ba ste /
analyzed: dang / bstan pa dang / rim pa dang / gdams ngag dang / gnang ba ste /
translated: The five are the teaching, the explanation, the stages, the instructions, and the permission.

original: rim pa lnga ston pa'i drin nyid las mchog dang phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rim pa lnga ston pa'i drin nyid las mchog dang phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: From the kindness of teaching the five stages, one becomes supreme and perfect.

original: ston pa'i drin nyid yang dag @160a pa'i ye shes mchog gi rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i drin nyid yang dag @160a pa'i ye shes mchog gi rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes mtshon pa'o //
translated: The kindness of the teacher is the cause of supreme, perfect pristine consciousness, not anything else.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid //
translated: The nature of the connate

original: rim pa gzhan gyis gsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rim pa gzhan gyis gsal ba'i phyir //
translated: is made clear by another stage.🔽The inferior, the middling, the supreme,

original: dman pa bar ma mchog rnams dang // gzhan rnams gang rnams de rnams dang // 'di rnams thams cad mnyam pa zhes //
analyzed: dman pa bar ma mchog rnams dang // gzhan rnams gang rnams de rnams dang // 'di rnams thams cad mnyam pa zhes //
translated: and others, all of them are equal.

original: de nyid bsgom pa rnams gyis blta //
analyzed: de nyid bsgom pa rnams gyis blta //
translated: should be seen by those who meditate on reality.

original: dman pa dngos po phra mo'i don //
analyzed: dman pa dngos po phra mo'i don //
translated: The inferior is the meaning of subtle things,

original: mchog ni dngos por brjod par bya //
analyzed: mchog ni dngos por brjod par bya //
translated: the superior is said to be substantial,

original: bar ma gnyis kyis spangs pa ste //
analyzed: bar ma gnyis kyis spangs pa ste //
translated: the middling is abandoned by both,

original: gzhan rnams zhes pa dbang po drug / gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo //
analyzed: gzhan rnams zhes pa dbang po drug / gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo //
translated: and the others are the six sense faculties.

original: 'di rnams thams cad tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad tshogs pa'o //
translated: Whatever they are, they are all the collection.

original: mdor bstan pa dman pa la sogs pa rnams kyis rgyas par bshad pa ni dngos po phra mo'i don zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dman pa la sogs pa rnams kyis rgyas par bshad pa ni dngos po phra mo'i don zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The brief explanation of the inferior and so on is the extensive explanation of the meaning of subtle things and so on.

original: dngos po phra mo'i don ni shes rab po //
analyzed: dngos po phra mo'i don ni shes rab po //
translated: The meaning of subtle things is wisdom.

original: dngos por brjod par bya zhes pa thabs so //
analyzed: dngos por brjod par bya zhes pa thabs so //
translated: That which is said to be substantial is method.

original: bar ma gnyis kyis spangs pa ste /
analyzed: bar ma gnyis kyis spangs pa ste /
translated: The middling is abandoned by both.

original: zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
translated: That is the wisdom of the nature of Vajradhara, the indivisibility of wisdom and method.

original: dbang po drug ces pa drug pa rdor je 'chang gi ye shes so //
analyzed: dbang po drug ces pa drug pa rdor je 'chang gi ye shes so //
translated: The six sense faculties is the wisdom of the sixth, Vajradhara.

original: gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo //
analyzed: gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo //
translated: Whatever they are, they are all the collection.

original: zhes pa de sdud pa dang spro ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: zhes pa de sdud pa dang spro ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: This is the nature of the gathering and the emanating.

original: 'di rnams thams cad ces pa thams cad ye shes kyi rang bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad ces pa thams cad ye shes kyi rang bzhin kho na'o //
translated: All these, all of them, are of the nature of gnosis alone.

original: tshogs pa zhes pa tshogs par gyur pa nyid tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa zhes pa tshogs par gyur pa nyid tshogs pa ste /
translated: The gathering is the gathering itself.

original: mtha' dag bsdus pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: mtha' dag bsdus pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes so //
translated: The gnosis is the nature of the totality of all.

original: yang na gang /
analyzed: yang na gang /
translated: Or else,

original: dman pa dngos po phra mo'i don //
analyzed: dman pa dngos po phra mo'i don //
translated: the inferior is the object of subtle things.

original: zhes pa dga' ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa dga' ba'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the gnosis of joy.

original: mchog ni dngos por brjod par bya //
analyzed: mchog ni dngos por brjod par bya //
translated: The supreme is to be expressed as a thing.

original: zhes pa mchog dga'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa mchog dga'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the gnosis of supreme joy.

original: bar ma gnyis kyis spangs pa ste //
analyzed: bar ma gnyis kyis spangs pa ste //
translated: The middle is abandoned by the two.

original: zhes pa dga' bral gyi dga' ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa dga' bral gyi dga' ba'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the gnosis of the joy of the absence of joy.

original: gzhan rnams zhes pa dbang po drug 'di rnams las zhes pa ste 'di rnams thams cad dbyer med pa nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: gzhan rnams zhes pa dbang po drug 'di rnams las zhes pa ste 'di rnams thams cad dbyer med pa nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The others, the six sense organs, are from these. All of them are inseparable, the nature of the sixth gnosis, Vajradhara, the nature of the five gnoses.

original: de nyid sdud pa dang spro ba'i bdag nyid can gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid sdud pa dang spro ba'i bdag nyid can gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo zhes pa'o //
translated: Those which are the nature of the collection and emanation of those are the “stable and moving.”

original: 'di rnams thams cad ces pa dga' ba la sogs pa'i ye shes 'di rnams thams cad do //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad ces pa dga' ba la sogs pa'i ye shes 'di rnams thams cad do //
translated: “ All of these” are all of these wisdoms of joy, etc.

original: ham nyid min zhes pa ham gi rang bzhin nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ham nyid min zhes pa ham gi rang bzhin nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: “ Not just the syllable ham” is not just the nature of the syllable ham.

original: rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa yang de la yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //🔽mnyam pa mtshungs @160b pa'i bya ba ste //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa yang de la yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o // mnyam pa mtshungs @160b pa'i bya ba ste //
translated: The concept of the nature of Vajradhara does not exist in that.

original: zhes pa dga' ba la sogs pa thams cad mtshungs pa'i bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa dga' ba la sogs pa thams cad mtshungs pa'i bya ba nyid do //
translated: “ Equal, similar activity” is the very same activity of all, joy, etc.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ro mnyam de nyid sgom rnams kyis //
analyzed: ro mnyam de nyid sgom rnams kyis //
translated: “ The meditators on that equality”

original: mnyam pa mtshungs pa zhes par brjod pa dbyer med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mnyam pa mtshungs pa zhes par brjod pa dbyer med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: is said to be “equal, similar” and is said to be “indivisible.”

original: de'i 'khor lo ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i 'khor lo ro zhes brjod do //
translated: “ Its wheel is said to be taste.”

original: de'i nyams su myong ba ni ro zhes pa ro mnyam gcig tu gyur pa ste //
analyzed: de'i nyams su myong ba ni ro zhes pa ro mnyam gcig tu gyur pa ste //
translated: Its experience is said to be “taste,” which is the single taste of equality.

original: ci ltar brjod par bya zhe na //
analyzed: ci ltar brjod par bya zhe na //
translated: How is that to be expressed?

original: don 'di yis ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: don 'di yis ni brjod par bya //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: don de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: don de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The same point is being made:

original: nga las 'gro ba thams cad byung //
analyzed: nga las 'gro ba thams cad byung //
translated: All beings come from me.

original: nga las sa gsum po yang byung //
analyzed: nga las sa gsum po yang byung //
translated: The three worlds come from me.

original: nga yis 'di dag thams cad khyab //
analyzed: nga yis 'di dag thams cad khyab //
translated: I pervade all this.

original: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ma mthong //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ma mthong //
translated: I do not see any other nature of beings.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rnam 'phrul ci yang bsal ba med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rnam 'phrul ci yang bsal ba med do //
translated: There is no manifestation of a different nature at all.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is it so?

original: nga las 'gro ba thams cad byung //
analyzed: nga las 'gro ba thams cad byung //
translated: All beings come from me.
