original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa las 'das pa'i dbang po dang yul yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa las 'das pa'i dbang po dang yul yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there are no sense faculties and objects that transcend consciousness.

original: sa gsum ni sku dang gsung dang thugs te /
analyzed: sa gsum ni sku dang gsung dang thugs te /
translated: The three worlds are the body, speech, and mind,

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa nyid las gzhan med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa nyid las gzhan med do //
translated: because there is nothing other than consciousness.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can te /
translated: All this is of the nature of the five wisdoms and the three bodies.

original: nga yis rnam par shes pas khyad pa de'i phyir //
analyzed: nga yis rnam par shes pas khyad pa de'i phyir //
translated: I pervade consciousness. Therefore,

original: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin de las gzhan med cing ye shes las gzhan cung zad kyang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin de las gzhan med cing ye shes las gzhan cung zad kyang ma mthong ste /
translated: I do not see any other nature of beings than that, and I do not see anything else other than wisdom.

original: ye shes gcig pu'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par shes par rtogs pa'i 'gro ba yang med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes gcig pu'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par shes par rtogs pa'i 'gro ba yang med do zhes pa'o //
translated: And there is no world of consciousness, which is the nature of the single gnosis.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtogs bya dang // rtogs byed rnam pa'i sems ma gzigs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtogs bya dang // rtogs byed rnam pa'i sems ma gzigs //
translated: The Tathagata does not see a mind with the aspect of the cognized and cognizer.🔽Where there is no cognized and cognizer,

original: gang la rtogs bya rtogs byed dang // de la rtogs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: gang la rtogs bya rtogs byed dang // de la rtogs pa yod ma yin //
translated: There is no cognition.🔽And,

original: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang sems kyis sems mi mthong ste /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang sems kyis sems mi mthong ste /
translated: The mind does not see the mind.🔽And,

original: gang yang sems gnyis 'grogs shing phrad pa med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang sems gnyis 'grogs shing phrad pa med do zhes pa'o //
translated: Two minds do not meet and join.

original: ae wam rtogs nas rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: ae wam rtogs nas rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who understands evam

original: shin tu mnyam gzhag gang goms pa //
analyzed: shin tu mnyam gzhag gang goms pa //
translated: And is well-equipoised and habituated

original: bsod nams dman pa'i mi rnams kyang //
analyzed: bsod nams dman pa'i mi rnams kyang //
translated: Even those of little merit

original: de ni 'grub 'gyur the tshom med //
analyzed: de ni 'grub 'gyur the tshom med //
translated: Will have no doubt that they will be accomplished.

original: ae yig dang wam yig gi bdag nyid can rtogs shing nges par shes nas rnal 'byor pa zung du 'jug pa gnas pa /
analyzed: ae yig dang wam yig gi bdag nyid can rtogs shing nges par shes nas rnal 'byor pa zung du 'jug pa gnas pa /
translated: The yogi who understands and knows the nature of the letters e and vam, and is well-equipoised and habituated in the yoga of union,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa dbyer med pa la gnas pa gang zhig goms par byed pa bar chad med par 'thob par 'gyur ba de ni 'grub 'gyur 'dir the tshom med pa phyag rgya chen por 'gyur ro //🔽bsod nams dman pa yang zhes pa bsod nams nye bar bsags @161a * //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa dbyer med pa la gnas pa gang zhig goms par byed pa bar chad med par 'thob par 'gyur ba de ni 'grub 'gyur 'dir the tshom med pa phyag rgya chen por 'gyur ro // bsod nams dman pa yang zhes pa bsod nams nye bar bsags @161a * //
translated: That which is the attainment of the practice of the inseparability of equipoise and post-equipoise, which is the attainment of the uninterrupted path, that is the accomplishment, here, of the Great Seal, of that there is no doubt.

original: pa'i bdag nyid ni re zhig 'grub par 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: pa'i bdag nyid ni re zhig 'grub par 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: Even those of little merit, the nature of whose merit is accumulated, will certainly accomplish it.

original: bsod nams dman pa yang ye shes kyi mthu las dngos grub thob bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsod nams dman pa yang ye shes kyi mthu las dngos grub thob bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Even those of little merit will attain power through the power of wisdom.

original: bar ma chad par bya ba rab tu 'jug pa'i rang bzhin kho na lhan cig skyes par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: bar ma chad par bya ba rab tu 'jug pa'i rang bzhin kho na lhan cig skyes par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach that the nature of the practice of the uninterrupted engagement is co-emergence, it is said:

original: bza' dang btung dang de bzhin khrus //
analyzed: bza' dang btung dang de bzhin khrus //
translated: Eat, drink, and likewise bathe,

original: sad dang nyal yang bsam par bya //
analyzed: sad dang nyal yang bsam par bya //
translated: and think about sleeping and waking.

original: phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pa //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pa //
translated: The one who desires the Great Seal

original: de las goms pa dang bcas thob //
analyzed: de las goms pa dang bcas thob //
translated: attains it through practice.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la yang lhan cig skyes pa rtag tu bsam par bya ste /🔽rgyu de las phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pa /
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la yang lhan cig skyes pa rtag tu bsam par bya ste / rgyu de las phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pa /
translated: One should also contemplate the innate in all activities such as eating, drinking, and so on.🔽From that cause, one should obtain the innate, which is the desire for the Great Seal.

original: lhan cig skyes pa thob cing lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa thob cing lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should obtain the nature of the innate.

original: bza' ba ni lus kyi mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bza' ba ni lus kyi mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Eating is freedom from attachment to the body.

original: btung ba ni ngag gi mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: btung ba ni ngag gi mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Drinking is freedom from attachment to speech.

original: khrus ni sems kyi mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: khrus ni sems kyi mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Bathing is freedom from attachment to the mind.

original: sad pa dang nyal ba dang spro ba dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid kyi bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sad pa dang nyal ba dang spro ba dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid kyi bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin te /
translated: Awakening, sleeping, expanding, and contracting are the nature of Vajradhara, inseparable from Nairātmya.

original: bsam par bya zhing ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gcig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam par bya zhing ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gcig par bya'o //
translated: One should contemplate and unify with the nature of gnosis.

original: de'i phyir de las goms pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las goms pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is endowed with practice.

original: goms pa rnam par rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: goms pa rnam par rgyas pa'o //
translated: Practice is extensive.

original: de'i dngos po ni goms par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni goms par gyur pa ste /
translated: That entity is practice.

original: lhan cig goms pas 'jug pa'i phyir goms pa dang bcas pa thob cing rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig goms pas 'jug pa'i phyir goms pa dang bcas pa thob cing rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating it together, one attains and obtains the one with cultivation.

original: phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pa //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pa //
translated: The one who desires the great seal🔽is the one who desires the great seal,🔽who desires and is desirous of the great seal,

original: phyag rgya chen po kun nas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid kyis 'dod pa dang mngon par 'dod pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po kun nas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid kyis 'dod pa dang mngon par 'dod pa /
translated: by the pervasion and pervasiveness of the great seal.

original: de ni phyag rgya chen po mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de ni phyag rgya chen po mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: That is the one who desires the great seal,

original: rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Vajradhara.

original: de gsal bar ston pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de gsal bar ston pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to clarify that,

original: phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pa //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pa //
translated: the one who desires the great seal

original: spro ba dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid can bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes kyi rang bzhin rnal 'byor pas rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: spro ba dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid can bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes kyi rang bzhin rnal 'byor pas rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: is the yogi who should complete the nature of the gnosis of Vajradhara, inseparable from Nairatmya, who has the nature of emanating and gathering.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni mnyam pa nyid du gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang sgom pa gsum po dmigs pa med pa nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni mnyam pa nyid du gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang sgom pa gsum po dmigs pa med pa nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Coemergence is taught in order to demonstrate that the object of meditation, the meditator, and the meditation itself are not perceived, because they are of the same nature as equality.

original: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom bya ste //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom bya ste //
translated: All beings are the object of meditation,

original: gang phyir yid kyis bsgom mi bya //
analyzed: gang phyir yid kyis bsgom mi bya //
translated: because the mind does not meditate on itself.

original: thams cad chos ni yongs shes pa'i //
analyzed: thams cad chos ni yongs shes pa'i //
translated: The meditation of one who fully understands all phenomena

original: sgom pa bsgom pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: sgom pa bsgom pa nyid ma yin //
translated: is not meditation.

original: 'gro ba @161b thams cad ces pa khams gsum par gtogs pa 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho 'gro ba drug tu gtogs pa sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / shing ljon pa la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten rnams te /
analyzed: 'gro ba @161b thams cad ces pa khams gsum par gtogs pa 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho 'gro ba drug tu gtogs pa sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / shing ljon pa la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten rnams te /
translated: All beings refers to the world of sentient beings, which is included in the three realms and the six kinds of transmigrating beings, and the world of the inanimate environment, such as trees and so forth.

original: thams cad bsgom par bya zhing snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad bsgom par bya zhing snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: All of these are the object of meditation and are to be brought into meditative equipoise.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what means?

original: yid kyis zhes pa sems kyis te //
analyzed: yid kyis zhes pa sems kyis te //
translated: By the mind, that is, by the mental consciousness.

original: rgyu gang gi phyir 'gro ba thams cad sems tsam kho na yin pa de'i phyir bsgom pa zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir 'gro ba thams cad sems tsam kho na yin pa de'i phyir bsgom pa zhes brjod cing /
translated: Because all beings are only mind, they are said to be the object of meditation.

original: sgom pa de nyid ni sgom pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sgom pa de nyid ni sgom pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: That meditation is not meditation itself.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
translated: It is not meditative concentration.

original: ci ltar gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: thams cad chos ni yongs shes pa /
analyzed: thams cad chos ni yongs shes pa /
translated: Because all phenomena are fully understood.

original: gang yin pa de ni bsgom par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni bsgom par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is fully understood is not to be cultivated.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad lhan cig yongs su 'jug pa mnyam pa nyid las shes pa de'i phyir bsgom par bya ba ma yin zhing snyoms par 'jug par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad lhan cig yongs su 'jug pa mnyam pa nyid las shes pa de'i phyir bsgom par bya ba ma yin zhing snyoms par 'jug par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because all phenomena are simultaneously engaged in the sameness of understanding, therefore they are not to be cultivated and are not to be concentrated upon.

original: de ltar yang slob dpon la babs /
analyzed: de ltar yang slob dpon la babs /
translated: Thus, the master Buddhaguhya🔽says:

original: gzung ba gzugs brnyan lta bu ste //
analyzed: gzung ba gzugs brnyan lta bu ste //
translated: The object is like a reflection.

original: sems las byung ba thog med la //
analyzed: sems las byung ba thog med la //
translated: From beginningless time,

original: rnam shes de yi rnam pa yang //
analyzed: rnam shes de yi rnam pa yang //
translated: consciousness and its aspects

original: phan tshun gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
analyzed: phan tshun gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
translated: are like mutual reflections.

original: ji ltar me ltong lta mig gi gzugs brnyan dang me long yang dus mnyam du mthong ba /
analyzed: ji ltar me ltong lta mig gi gzugs brnyan dang me long yang dus mnyam du mthong ba /
translated: Just as the reflection of a form and the mirror are seen simultaneously,

original: de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dbyer med pa kho na rtag tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dbyer med pa kho na rtag tu 'byung ste /
translated: in the same way, the apprehended object and apprehending subject always occur only as inseparable.

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa mnyam pa nyid du gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes yin pa'i phyir sgom pa sgom pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa mnyam pa nyid du gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes yin pa'i phyir sgom pa sgom pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Knowledge is the identity of the equality of the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses, and therefore meditation is not meditation.

original: 'gro ba'i sgras dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sgras dbang po rnams so //
translated: The word “world” refers to the sense faculties.

original: thams cad kyi sgras yul rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgras yul rnams so //
translated: The word “all” refers to the objects.

original: yid kyi sgras sems yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi sgras sems yin te /
translated: The word “mind” refers to the mind.

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid rtag tu shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid rtag tu shes so //
translated: One should always know the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: mdor bstan pa'i don nyid rgyas par ston pa /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i don nyid rgyas par ston pa /
translated: The meaning of the brief explanation itself is taught in detail:

original: brtan dang g-yo ba'i dngos po gang //
analyzed: brtan dang g-yo ba'i dngos po gang //
translated: Whatever things are stable or moving,

original: rtsva dang gel ba 'khri shing sogs //
analyzed: rtsva dang gel ba 'khri shing sogs //
translated: such as grass, vines, creepers, and so on,

original: bsgom bya gzhan gyi de nyid ni //
analyzed: bsgom bya gzhan gyi de nyid ni //
translated: are the reality of the object of meditation.

original: bdag gi dngos po rang bzhin can //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po rang bzhin can //
translated: The nature of one’s own entity🔽is the reality of the object of meditation.

original: 'dis ni brtan pa bems po dang g-yo ba 'gro ba srog chags rnams te /
analyzed: 'dis ni brtan pa bems po dang g-yo ba 'gro ba srog chags rnams te /
translated: This means that the stable, inanimate world and the moving, animate world of living beings

original: brtan dang g-yo ba dngos po thams cad de /
analyzed: brtan dang g-yo ba dngos po thams cad de /
translated: are all the things of the stable and moving worlds.

original: dngos po'i don rnams so ;🔽/ da nyid gsal bar byed pa rtsva ni phra mo rnams so //
analyzed: dngos po'i don rnams so ;🔽/ da nyid gsal bar byed pa rtsva ni phra mo rnams so //
translated: They are the objects of reality.🔽The word “reality” clarifies that.

original: gel ba ni shing gi rang bzhin 'dus par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gel ba ni shing gi rang bzhin 'dus par gyur pa'o //
translated: A bush is a collection of trees.

original: 'khri shing ni gyes pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'khri shing ni gyes pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: A creeper is a spreading collection.

original: rtsva dang gel pa 'khri shing ngo //🔽nyams ba dang 'phel ba'i rang bzhin bems po rnams la yang rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir rnam pa gsum nyid nye @162a * //
analyzed: rtsva dang gel pa 'khri shing ngo // nyams ba dang 'phel ba'i rang bzhin bems po rnams la yang rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir rnam pa gsum nyid nye @162a * //
translated: Grass, bushes, and creepers🔽are the three kinds of inanimate things that are subject to growth and decay.

original: bar bstan to //
analyzed: bar bstan to //
translated: The three kinds are taught because they are the three kinds.

original: sogs pa'i sgras 'gro ba zhes pa la sogs pa g-yo ba rnams kyi yang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras 'gro ba zhes pa la sogs pa g-yo ba rnams kyi yang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the three kinds of animate things that move, such as animals.

original: de yang bsgom bya dam pa'i de nyid rmad du byung ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang bsgom bya dam pa'i de nyid rmad du byung ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: And that is the object of meditation, the reality that is the nature of the marvelous pristine awareness.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ni'i  sgra ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: ni'i  sgra ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: The word “for” indicates the reason.

original: bdag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin can ;
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin can ;
translated: The nature of the reality of the self🔽is the nature of the reality of the self.

original: / bdag gi dngos po ni ji ltar bdag dang po nas ma skyes pa de bzhin du brtan pa'i dngos po rnams kyang dang po nas ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: / bdag gi dngos po ni ji ltar bdag dang po nas ma skyes pa de bzhin du brtan pa'i dngos po rnams kyang dang po nas ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Just as the self is unborn from the beginning, so too are all things unborn from the beginning.

original: 'dis ni gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i phyir thams cad yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i phyir thams cad yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: This is because of the realization of non-duality, everything is of the nature of perfect wisdom.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba dag ji ltar tha dad ce na /
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba dag ji ltar tha dad ce na /
translated: how are the stable and the moving different?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽de rnams kyi gcig gzhan yod min //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / de rnams kyi gcig gzhan yod min //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽Among them, one does not exist as another.

original: zhes pa brtan pa de rnams kyi gcig nyid de gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa brtan pa de rnams kyi gcig nyid de gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Among them, the stable ones, one does not exist as another.🔽Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: rang rig bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: rang rig bde ba chen po ste /
translated: Self-awareness is great bliss.

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes te /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes te /
translated: It is the wisdom of self-awareness.

original: brtan pa rnams sems med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa rnams sems med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the stable ones are without mind.

original: yang na gang brtan pa dang g-yo ba de rnams kyi yang gang zhig gcig gnyis su med pa de ni med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gang brtan pa dang g-yo ba de rnams kyi yang gang zhig gcig gnyis su med pa de ni med pa'o //
translated: Or, among those that are stable and moving, one does not exist as another, that is non-existent.

original: de'i rang bzhin ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its nature like?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / yod min rang rig pa yong pa nyid ldog pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / yod min rang rig pa yong pa nyid ldog pa ste /
translated: Non-existent, self-awareness is the reversal of existence.

original: bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because action on oneself is contradictory.

original: de log pa na med pa nyid kyang ldog pa'i phyir gnyis ka log pa'i rang rig pa gnyis su med pa rmad du byung ba de ni bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: de log pa na med pa nyid kyang ldog pa'i phyir gnyis ka log pa'i rang rig pa gnyis su med pa rmad du byung ba de ni bde ba chen po ste /
translated: When that is reversed, nonexistence is also reversed. That marvelous nondual self-awareness, which is the reversal of both, is great bliss.

original: de nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That is the perfect pristine consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir rang rig pa gnyis ka dang bral ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang rig pa gnyis ka dang bral ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked why self-awareness is free from both,🔽it is said:

original: gsungs pa / rang rig las ni 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rang rig las ni 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: It is accomplished from self-awareness.

original: rang rig pa ni sgom pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni sgom pa'o //
translated: Self-awareness is meditation.

original: las ni rang rig rang bzhin te //
analyzed: las ni rang rig rang bzhin te //
translated: The action is the nature of self-awareness.

original: gnod pa las ni las skye 'gyur //
analyzed: gnod pa las ni las skye 'gyur //
translated: Karma arises from harm.

original: zhes pa gang gi phyir rang rig pa'i rgyu las phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub tu gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa gang gi phyir rang rig pa'i rgyu las phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub tu gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the result of self-awareness is the siddhi of mahāmudrā,

original: rang rig las ni grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: rang rig las ni grub par 'gyur //
translated: it is accomplished from self-awareness.

original: rang rig pa ni sgom pa'o //🔽ni zhes pa gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni sgom pa'o // ni zhes pa gang gi phyir te /
translated: Self-awareness is meditation.

original: gang zhig rang rig pa de ni gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sgom pa snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rang rig pa de ni gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sgom pa snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The word “because” means that since that self-awareness is the essence of the inseparability of the two, meditation is meditative equipoise.

original: las ni rang rig rang bzhin te /
analyzed: las ni rang rig rang bzhin te /
translated: The action is the nature of self-awareness.

original: gang yang de'i las bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid de yang rang rig pa'i rnam 'phrul nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang de'i las bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid de yang rang rig pa'i rnam 'phrul nyid do //
translated: And that which is the nature of the experience of the results of karma, pleasure and pain, is also the manifestation of self-awareness.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: gnod pa las ni las skye 'gyur //
analyzed: gnod pa las ni las skye 'gyur //
translated: Karma arises from harm.

original: zhes pa gang gi @162b gnod pa 'khrul pa las ni las skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa gang gi @162b gnod pa 'khrul pa las ni las skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Karma arises from the harm of error.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed thams cad yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed thams cad yin la /
translated: All formations are conditioned by ignorance.

original: ma rig pa yang gti mug ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang gti mug ste /
translated: And ignorance is delusion.

original: gti mug kyang 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug kyang 'khrul pa'o //
translated: And delusion is error.

original: 'khrul pa ni de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Error is the apprehension of something as what it is not.

original: ji ltar thag pa 'khyil pa la sbrul gyi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar thag pa 'khyil pa la sbrul gyi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of a snake in a coiled rope.

original: 'khrul pa de nyid ni sa bon te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa de nyid ni sa bon te /
translated: That error itself is the seed.

original: 'khrul pa de'i dbang gis gnod pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa de'i dbang gis gnod pa'o //
translated: By the power of that error, there is harm.

original: de las kyang las dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang las dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And from that, karma, pleasure, pain, and so on arise.

original: 'di nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rang nyid 'phrog po rang byed po //
analyzed: rang nyid 'phrog po rang byed po //
translated: One’s own thief, one’s own doer.

original: rang nyid rgyal po rang gtso bo //🔽rang nyid 'phrog po zhes pa rang nyid sdud pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang nyid rgyal po rang gtso bo // rang nyid 'phrog po zhes pa rang nyid sdud pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: One is the king, one is the chief,🔽one is the appropriator.

original: rang byed po zhes pa rang nyid spro ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang byed po zhes pa rang nyid spro ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: One is the agent.🔽One is the king.

original: rang nyid rgyal po zhes pa rang nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //🔽rang gtso bo zhes pa thams cad kyi mnga' bdag tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang nyid rgyal po zhes pa rang nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin no // rang gtso bo zhes pa thams cad kyi mnga' bdag tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: One is the chief.🔽One is the king, the chief, the appropriator, the agent, and the seer.

original: gzugs sna tshogs pa'i nor bur spro ba dang sdud pa dang gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs pa'i nor bur spro ba dang sdud pa dang gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The gem is the nature of the various forms, the nature of expansion and contraction, and the nature of manifestation.

original: 'phrog pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phrog pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: By the nature of the appropriator, it is the nature of objects such as form.

original: byed pa po'i rang bzhin nyid kyis mig la sogs pa dbang po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa po'i rang bzhin nyid kyis mig la sogs pa dbang po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: By the nature of the agent, it is the nature of sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: rgyal po nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal po nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: By the nature of the king, it is the nature of consciousness.

original: gtso bo nyid kyis yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kho na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid kyis yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kho na zhes pa'o //
translated: By the nature of the chief, it is the indivisible nature of objects, faculties, and consciousness, which is the nature of perfect wisdom alone.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ye shes rang nyid byed pa po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ye shes rang nyid byed pa po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For that very reason, since pristine consciousness itself is the agent,🔽attachment, anger, jealousy,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang phrag dog dang // de bzhin gti mug nga rgyal nyid //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang phrag dog dang // de bzhin gti mug nga rgyal nyid //
translated: and likewise, ignorance and pride,

original: de kun de gnas nyams dga' bar //
analyzed: de kun de gnas nyams dga' bar //
translated: all of those are the abode of that,

original: bcu drug cha la mchod ma yin //
analyzed: bcu drug cha la mchod ma yin //
translated: the delightful one, not worshiped in the sixteenth part.🔽When all of those, attachment, anger, and so on, are realized in the abode of that,

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa de kun de gnas yang dag pa'i ye shes rtogs pa na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa de kun de gnas yang dag pa'i ye shes rtogs pa na /
translated: the perfect pristine consciousness,

original: khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: what is the difference?

original: nyams dga' ba mdzes par gyur pa na 'dod chags la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: nyams dga' ba mdzes par gyur pa na 'dod chags la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin te /
translated: When attachment and so on become beautiful, delightful, they are the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: de'i ngo bor skyes pa'i ye shes nyid kyis ma ning du bstan to //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor skyes pa'i ye shes nyid kyis ma ning du bstan to //
translated: The pristine consciousness that arises in the essence of that is shown to be the neutral state.

original: bcu drug cha la mchod ma yin //
analyzed: bcu drug cha la mchod ma yin //
translated: Not worshiped in the sixteenth part

original: zhes pa zla ba ni cha bco lnga'i bdag nyid can nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa zla ba ni cha bco lnga'i bdag nyid can nyid do //
translated: means that the moon is the nature of the fifteen parts.

original: de'i cha bcu drug pa ni med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i cha bcu drug pa ni med pa kho na ste /
translated: The sixteenth part of that does not exist at all,

original: byed pa cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not perform any function.

translated: “Aspect” refers to their division.

original: 'di lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa des gnod pa rnams par brtag par nus pa ma yin te ye shes nyid ni rnam par brtag par bya ba dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa des gnod pa rnams par brtag par nus pa ma yin te ye shes nyid ni rnam par brtag par bya ba dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible to conceive of the harm done by such conceptualization, because wisdom itself transcends all that is to be conceived and all conceptualization.

original: ye shes kyi che ba'i bdag nyid nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes kyi che ba'i bdag nyid nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the greatness of wisdom, it says:🔽Not from all the Vedānta🔽and the like,

original: rig byed grub mtha' thams cad dang // de bzhin rab 'byams la sogs kyis //🔽'grub min dag las 'gyur ba yang //
analyzed: rig byed grub mtha' thams cad dang // de bzhin rab 'byams la sogs kyis // 'grub min dag las 'gyur ba yang //
translated: nor from the other schools,

original: skye dang srid pa gzhan du'o //
analyzed: skye dang srid pa gzhan du'o //
translated: is there birth or existence elsewhere.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni //
translated: The attainment of the great seal

original: thabs gzhan gyi sa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: thabs gzhan gyi sa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: is not by any other means.

original: rig byed dang grub mtha' yang rig byed grub mtha' ste /
analyzed: rig byed dang grub mtha' yang rig byed grub mtha' ste /
translated: The Vedānta and the schools are the Vedānta schools.

original: de rnams thams cad dang rig byed grub mtha' yang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams thams cad dang rig byed grub mtha' yang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they are all of those and also Vedānta schools,

original: rig byed grub mtha' thams cad do //
analyzed: rig byed grub mtha' thams cad do //
translated: they are all the Vedānta schools.

original: seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa de rnams kyis bsngags pa'i tshig rnams dang rang gi lta ba bsngags pa las rab 'byams la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub gal zhig stem yin no //
analyzed: seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa de rnams kyis bsngags pa'i tshig rnams dang rang gi lta ba bsngags pa las rab 'byams la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub gal zhig stem yin no //
translated: Those such as the Lion, the Thief, and the Heart of Wealth, with their words of praise, and those such as the Infinite with their praise of their own view, are also the means of attaining the Great Seal.🔽But how is that?

original: 'o na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: gsungs pa / dag pas 'gyur te rnam par dag pa bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dbyer med pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i lam shes pa las so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / dag pas 'gyur te rnam par dag pa bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dbyer med pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i lam shes pa las so //
translated: By purity, from the knowledge of the path of the indivisibility of the creation and completion stages, the relative and the ultimate.

original: gang du skye dang srid pa gzhan du'o ;
analyzed: gang du skye dang srid pa gzhan du'o ;
translated: Where? In this world and in other existences.

original: / skye ba 'jig rten 'di dang srid pa gzhan skye ba gzhan dang gzhan du ste /
analyzed: / skye ba 'jig rten 'di dang srid pa gzhan skye ba gzhan dang gzhan du ste /
translated: In this world and in other existences, in other births and other lives.

original: 'dis ni skye ba gzhan dang gzhan rnams su yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni skye ba gzhan dang gzhan rnams su yang ngo //
translated: This shows that in other births and other lives as well.

original: phyag rgya chen po 'grub bar mi 'gyur ba de nyid gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po 'grub bar mi 'gyur ba de nyid gsal bar byed pa /
translated: To clarify that the Great Seal is not attained,

original: 'jig rten 'di dang gzhan du yang //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang gzhan du yang //
translated: in this world and in other existences

original: de dang bral bas dngos grub med //
analyzed: de dang bral bas dngos grub med //
translated: Since one is devoid of that, there is no spiritual power.🔽Since one is devoid of that knowledge of complete purity, there is no spiritual power of the great seal in either of the two worlds.

original: rnam par dag pa yongs su shes pa de dang bral bas 'jig rten gnyis kar yang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub med pa kho na'o zhes ldog pa'i sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa yongs su shes pa de dang bral bas 'jig rten gnyis kar yang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub med pa kho na'o zhes ldog pa'i sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba bstan par mdzad de /
translated: The following verse is stated to indicate the reverse by way of the forward process:

original: kye yi rdo rje mi shes gang //
analyzed: kye yi rdo rje mi shes gang //
translated: Whatever ignorance of Hevajra

original: de yi ngal ba don med 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi ngal ba don med 'gyur //
translated: that is meaningless toil.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang gis kye'i rdo rje kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ye shes @165a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang gis kye'i rdo rje kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ye shes @165a * //
translated: Whatever yogi does not know and does not understand the wisdom of the indivisibility of the conventional and the ultimate Hevajra,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin mi shes shing ma rtogs pa de'i ngal ba rig byed la sogs pa'i tshig brjod pa'i don la 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin mi shes shing ma rtogs pa de'i ngal ba rig byed la sogs pa'i tshig brjod pa'i don la 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: the emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations, his toil is the affliction of engaging in the meaning of the words of the Vedas and so forth.

original: yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it does not hold the result that is the characteristic of true enlightenment,

original: don med rgyu ma yin pa la 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med rgyu ma yin pa la 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not a cause is not an effect.

original: kye'i rdo rje shes pa la yang rgyun du goms pa dang bral ba las dngos grub yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje shes pa la yang rgyun du goms pa dang bral ba las dngos grub yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Also, in the knowledge of Hevajra, there is no power without constant practice.🔽In order to teach this, (the Bhagavān) declares,

original: chu bo'i rgyun ni rab 'bab dang // sgron ma'i 'od ni rab bcings ltar //
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun ni rab 'bab dang // sgron ma'i 'od ni rab bcings ltar //
translated: Like the flow of a river and the light of a lamp,

original: rtag tu de nyid rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: rtag tu de nyid rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: The yogi/nī should always

original: nyin dang mtshan mor gnas par bya //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mor gnas par bya //
translated: Dwell day and night.

original: ji ltar chu bo'i rgyun rab tu 'bab pa tha dad pa med pa dang / sgron ma'i 'od rab tu bcings pa tha dad pa med pa dang / de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas khams gsum po dbyer med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gcig pu'i skus kye'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar chu bo'i rgyun rab tu 'bab pa tha dad pa med pa dang / sgron ma'i 'od rab tu bcings pa tha dad pa med pa dang / de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas khams gsum po dbyer med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gcig pu'i skus kye'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis gnas par bya ste /
translated: Just as the flow of a river is uninterrupted and the light of a lamp is bound, so the yogi/nī should always dwell in the yoga of Hevajra with the body of the sole non-conceptual gnosis, the indivisible three realms.

original: nyin dang mtshan mor zhes pa dus thams cad du bar ma chad pa nyid kyis zhes pa'i don to zhes pa le'u rdzogs pa'i sgo yis le'ur gsungs pa'i don yang dag par sdud pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mor zhes pa dus thams cad du bar ma chad pa nyid kyis zhes pa'i don to zhes pa le'u rdzogs pa'i sgo yis le'ur gsungs pa'i don yang dag par sdud pa gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the chapter is summarized in the words of the conclusion:🔽The chapter on the gathering of the great yoginis, called the wheel of the yoginis, of the mind of all the tathagatas, body, speech, and mind, is the eighth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kye'i rdo rjer rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba rnal 'byor ma chen mo 'du ba'i le'u brgyad pa'o zhes pa ye shes lnga dang sku gsum dang shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can kun
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kye'i rdo rjer rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba rnal 'byor ma chen mo 'du ba'i le'u brgyad pa'o zhes pa ye shes lnga dang sku gsum dang shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can kun
translated: The wisdom that is the nature of the five wisdoms, three bodies, and the union of wisdom and means,

original: rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsungs dang thugs kye'i rdo rjer zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsungs dang thugs kye'i rdo rjer zhes pa'o //
translated: the wisdom of the inseparability of the conventional and the ultimate, is the mind of all the tathagatas, body, speech, and mind.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo gang zhig mi shes pa gcod pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo gang zhig mi shes pa gcod pa ste /
translated: The wheel of the yoginis is that which cuts through ignorance.

original: le'u gang na de yod pa ni rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: le'u gang na de yod pa ni rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The chapter in which it is found is called the wheel of the yoginis.

original: rnal 'byor ma chen mo ni bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma chen mo ni bdag med ma ste /
translated: The great yoginī is Nairātmya.

original: de'i 'du ba ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'du ba ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: Her assembly is the gathering.

original: a'a pa ni des khyab pa ste /
analyzed: a'a pa ni des khyab pa ste /
translated: Apa means pervaded by that.

original: des na kam bde ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: des na kam bde ba'i ye shes so //
translated: Therefore, kaṃ is the gnosis of bliss.

original: le'u gang na de yod pa ni rnal 'byor ma chen mo'i 'du ba'o //
analyzed: le'u gang na de yod pa ni rnal 'byor ma chen mo'i 'du ba'o //
translated: The chapter in which that exists is the Great Yoginī Assembly.

original: de yang pa ta g-yogs pa dang sbas pa ste /
analyzed: de yang pa ta g-yogs pa dang sbas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, paṭa means covered and hidden.

original: de len pa dang 'dzin pa'i phyir le'u'o //
analyzed: de len pa dang 'dzin pa'i phyir le'u'o //
translated: Therefore, a le’u is a chapter because it takes and holds that.

original: de yang khyab pa'i rang bzhin kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa /
analyzed: de yang khyab pa'i rang bzhin kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa /
translated: Moreover, it is pervasion, the indivisibility of the relative and the ultimate.🔽Ma ḥaṃ is the meaning of ma ḥaṃ, the sixteen emptinesses, and the purity of Vajradhara.

original: ma a'a: ste m'a: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor @165b shin tu dri ma med pa las le'u brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: ma a'a: ste m'a: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor @165b shin tu dri ma med pa las le'u brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the eighth chapter of the commentary on the Hevajra Tantra called “The Pure Key to the Essential Points.”

original: // / da ni rim pa gnyis rnam par dag pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir phung bo la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam pa gnyis ka'i rnam par dag pa rab tu bstan ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / da ni rim pa gnyis rnam par dag pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir phung bo la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam pa gnyis ka'i rnam par dag pa rab tu bstan ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to teach the purity of the aggregates and so forth in both aspects, for the sake of attaining the great seal of perfect pristine awareness, which is the attainment of the Great Seal, he says:

original: de nas gzhan yang rnam par dag pa'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang rnam par dag pa'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, moreover, the chapter on purity will be explained.

original: de nas rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo las gzhan bar ma chad par rnam par dag pa'i le'u khyad par du 'phags pa'i dag pa ni rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo las gzhan bar ma chad par rnam par dag pa'i le'u khyad par du 'phags pa'i dag pa ni rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: After the chapter on the wheel of yoginis, without interruption, the special purity of the chapter on purity is purity.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: It is the indivisibility of the conventional and the ultimate, the nonduality of Vajradhara and Nairatmya.

original: le'u ni pa ta sbas pa ste /
analyzed: le'u ni pa ta sbas pa ste /
translated: A chapter is a patala, a hiding place.

original: de len pa dang 'dzin pa'i phyir le'u'o //
analyzed: de len pa dang 'dzin pa'i phyir le'u'o //
translated: Since it takes up and holds that, it is a chapter.

original: rnam par bshad par bya'o zhes pa khyad par du gyur pa'i tshul gyis rab tu bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad par bya'o zhes pa khyad par du gyur pa'i tshul gyis rab tu bstan par bya'o //
translated: It will be explained means that it will be taught in a special way.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: nges par dngos po thams cad kyi //
analyzed: nges par dngos po thams cad kyi //
translated: The purity of all entities

original: rnam dag de bzhin nyid du brjod //
analyzed: rnam dag de bzhin nyid du brjod //
translated: is said to be suchness.

original: ces pa 'di la don gnas pa'i phyir dngos po don gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa 'di la don gnas pa'i phyir dngos po don gnas pa ste /
translated: Here, the “abiding of the object” is the abiding of the object.

original: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That is their purity.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Suchness is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: thams cad kyi zhes pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba rnams te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi zhes pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba rnams te /
translated: “All” refers to the animate and inanimate worlds.

original: de'i phyir gnyis ka yang dngos po nyid kyis yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis ka yang dngos po nyid kyis yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, both are to be thoroughly examined by means of entities.

original: don rtogs pa kho na tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir 'dis ni don dam pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: don rtogs pa kho na tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir 'dis ni don dam pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Since the realization of the object is the result of valid knowledge, this is the purity of the ultimate.

original: phyi nas re re'i dbye ba yis //
analyzed: phyi nas re re'i dbye ba yis //
translated: Next, by the divisions of each,

original: lha rnams kyi ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi ni brjod par bya //
translated: the deities are to be expressed.

original: phyi nas zhes pa de ma thag par ma chad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: phyi nas zhes pa de ma thag par ma chad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Next” means immediately after, without interruption.

original: re re'i dbye ba yis zhes pa re re'i rnam pa yis /
analyzed: re re'i dbye ba yis zhes pa re re'i rnam pa yis /
translated: “By the divisions of each” means by the aspects of each.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: Of what?

original: lha rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi ste /
translated: Of the deities.

original: khyad par gyi don la ni'i sgra'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi don la ni'i sgra'o //
translated: The word “indeed” has the special meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod cing mtshan mar bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod cing mtshan mar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is expressed and signified.

original: mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid las kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i 'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid las kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i 'o //
translated: The nature of the sign is the conventional truth.

original: lha rnams kyi re re'i dbye bas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ste /🔽kun rdzob kyi bden pa la lha'i rnam pas phung po la sogs pa rnams rnam par sbyong zhing /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi re re'i dbye bas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ste / kun rdzob kyi bden pa la lha'i rnam pas phung po la sogs pa rnams rnam par sbyong zhing /
translated: The purity of the entities such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases is by the division of each of the deities.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pas so zhes pa rim pa gnyis rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pas so zhes pa rim pa gnyis rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The conventional truth is purified by the aspect of the deities, and the aggregates and so on are purified by the aspect of suchness, which is the ultimate truth.🔽The purity of the two stages is the indivisibility of the two.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med pa bsgom par bya zhing yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pa bsgom par bya zhing yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should meditate on that and attain perfect complete enlightenment.

original: da ni nges @166a * //
analyzed: da ni nges @166a * //
translated: Now, in order to explain the meaning of the two truths, it is said:

original: par dngos po thams cad kyi //
analyzed: par dngos po thams cad kyi //
translated: The nature of all entities

original: zhes thun mong du gsungs pas don dam pa'i rnam par dag pa mngon par brjod nas phyi nas re re'i dbye ba yis /
analyzed: zhes thun mong du gsungs pas don dam pa'i rnam par dag pa mngon par brjod nas phyi nas re re'i dbye ba yis /
translated: Thus, having expressed the ultimate purity in common, he says,

original: lha rnams kyi ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi ni brjod par bya //
translated: The gods are to be expressed by the divisions of each one.

original: zhes pa dngos po'i dbye ba nyid kyis khyad par du so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa dngos po'i dbye ba nyid kyis khyad par du so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the distinctions individually by the divisions of the entities themselves, he says,

original: dbang po drug dang phung po lnga ;
analyzed: dbang po drug dang phung po lnga ;
translated: The six sense faculties, the five aggregates,

original: / skye mched drug dang 'byung chen lnga //
analyzed: / skye mched drug dang 'byung chen lnga //
translated: The six sense bases, and the five great elements,🔽Are pure by nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni rnam par dag / ces pa dbang po cug mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid rnams te dbang po drug go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni rnam par dag / ces pa dbang po cug mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid rnams te dbang po drug go //
translated: The six sense faculties are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: phung po lnga ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The five aggregates are form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: skye mched drug ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang bde ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang bde ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The six sense bases are form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and pleasure, etc.

original: 'byung ba chen po lnga ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po lnga ni /
translated: The five great elements are

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'o //
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin gdod ma nyid nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rnam par dag pa 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin gdod ma nyid nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rnam par dag pa 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: All of these are pure by nature, luminous, because of the very fact that they are not produced from the beginning.

original: don dam pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate purity.

original: de nyid gang zhig nyon mongs ba dang mi shes pa rnams kyis bsgribs pa de lha'i rnam pas rnam par sbyong bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid gang zhig nyon mongs ba dang mi shes pa rnams kyis bsgribs pa de lha'i rnam pas rnam par sbyong bar bya ste /
translated: That very [nature] which is obscured by afflictions and ignorance is purified by the aspect of the deity.

original: kun rdzob kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the conventional purity.

original: rnam par dag pa gnyis ka yang rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can kho na ste /
