translated: The two dakinis Khecarī and Bhūcari are the purities of existence and nirvāṇa.

original: srid dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: srid dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: By the nature of existence and peace,

original: lha mo gnyis po 'di dag gnas //
analyzed: lha mo gnyis po 'di dag gnas //
translated: these two goddesses abide.

original: srid pa'i rang bzhin gyis sa spyod ma'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rang bzhin gyis sa spyod ma'o //
translated: By the nature of existence, she is Pṛthivī.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis mkha' spyod ma'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis mkha' spyod ma'o //
translated: By the nature of nirvāṇa, she is Khecarī.

original: 'dis ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin ye shes kyi rnam pa 'di dag brtan par gnas te /
analyzed: 'dis ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin ye shes kyi rnam pa 'di dag brtan par gnas te /
translated: This is the firm abiding of these aspects of gnosis, the nature of existence and nirvāṇa.

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of non-movement.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: lha mo gnyis so //
analyzed: lha mo gnyis so //
translated: It is the two goddesses.

original: goo r'i la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purity of Gaurī and so forth is stated:

original: gzugs la goo r'i rtag tu bshad //
analyzed: gzugs la goo r'i rtag tu bshad //
translated: In form, Gaurī is always explained.

original: gzugs rnam par dag pa goo r'i'o //🔽sgra la tsoo r'i rab tu grags //
analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pa goo r'i'o // sgra la tsoo r'i rab tu grags //
translated: The purity of form is Gaurī.🔽In sound, Caurī is well known.

original: sgra rnam par dag pa tsoo r'i'o //🔽dri yi cha la be t'a l'i //
analyzed: sgra rnam par dag pa tsoo r'i'o // dri yi cha la be t'a l'i //
translated: The purity of sound is Caurī.🔽In the aspect of smell, Vetālī.

original: dri rnam par dag pa be t'a l'i'o //🔽ro la ghasma r'i rab grags //
analyzed: dri rnam par dag pa be t'a l'i'o // ro la ghasma r'i rab grags //
translated: The purity of smell is Vetālī.🔽In taste, Ghasmarī is well known.

original: ro rnam par dag pa ghasma r'i'o //🔽reg las spyod ma zhes bshad //🔽reg bya rnam @168a * //
analyzed: ro rnam par dag pa ghasma r'i'o // reg las spyod ma zhes bshad // reg bya rnam @168a * //
translated: The purity of taste is Ghasmarī.🔽In touch, Pukkāsī is explained.

original: par dag pa sa spyod ma'o //
analyzed: par dag pa sa spyod ma'o //
translated: The purity of touch is Pukkāsī.

original: chos kyi dbyings la mkha' spyod ma //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la mkha' spyod ma //
translated: In the phenomena element, Khecarī.

original: chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: The reality realm is the non-conceptual suchness.

original: des rnam par dag pa mkha' spyod ma'o //
analyzed: des rnam par dag pa mkha' spyod ma'o //
translated: By that, the pure is the Sky-farer.

original: rtag tu 'di rnams rnam dag na //
analyzed: rtag tu 'di rnams rnam dag na //
translated: Always pure of these,

original: de nyid rnal 'byor bas 'grub 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor bas 'grub 'gyur //
translated: that alone is accomplished by the yogi.

original: goo r'i la sogs pa 'di rnams dang 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa des gang gi tshe rtag par rgyun du bar chad med par gyur pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa de kho na'i rnal 'byor dang ldan par 'gyur zhing de kho na'i rnal
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs pa 'di rnams dang 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa des gang gi tshe rtag par rgyun du bar chad med par gyur pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa de kho na'i rnal 'byor dang ldan par 'gyur zhing de kho na'i rnal
translated: By that purity of form, etc. associated with these Gauri, etc., when it is uninterrupted, always, continuously, then that yogi is endowed with that alone, the yoga of that alone,

original: 'byor pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: and he alone will accomplish the Great Seal, the power of yoga.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa kho na rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa kho na rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach that the mandala is just the indivisibility of the two, the extremely pure wheel of yoginis, the reality realm nature, the indivisibility of Vajradhara and Nairatmya, the purity, he declares:

original: phyag rnams stong nyid dag pa ste //🔽phyag rnams ni stong pa nyid bcu drug ste /
analyzed: phyag rnams stong nyid dag pa ste // phyag rnams ni stong pa nyid bcu drug ste /
translated: The hands are the purity of the emptinesses.🔽The hands are the sixteen emptinesses.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa kho na phyag bcu drug go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa kho na phyag bcu drug go //
translated: The sixteen emptinesses are the sixteen hands.

original: bdud dag pa las zhabs dag go //
analyzed: bdud dag pa las zhabs dag go //
translated: The feet are the purity of the demons.

original: zhes pa rigs tsam gyis zhabs dag ces pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa rigs tsam gyis zhabs dag ces pa ste /
translated: The feet are pure by the mere fact of being feet.

original: bdud bzhi rnam par dag pas zhabs bzhi'o //🔽rnam thar brgyad kyi zhal rnams te /
analyzed: bdud bzhi rnam par dag pas zhabs bzhi'o // rnam thar brgyad kyi zhal rnams te /
translated: The four feet are the purity of the four demons.🔽The faces are the eight liberations.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pas zhal brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pas zhal brgyad rnams so //
translated: The eight faces are the purity of the eight liberations.

original: rdo rje gsum gyis dag pa spyan //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyis dag pa spyan // zhes pa ste /
translated: The eyes are the purity of the three vajras.

original: 'dis ni phyag dang zhabs dang zhal dang spyan rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyag dang zhabs dang zhal dang spyan rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of the hands, feet, faces, and eyes.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug ces pa nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug ces pa nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The sixteen emptinesses are the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, the emptiness of the inner and outer, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great immensity, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of specific characteristics, the emptiness of the absence of intrinsic nature, and the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-entities.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang ; mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong ba nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang /🔽rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang ; mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong ba nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of nonrejection, the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽the emptiness of defining attributes, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of nonobservation, the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of nonthings, the emptiness of things, the emptiness of nonthings,

original: rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid de /
translated: the emptiness of its own entity, and the emptiness of the entity of others.

original: 'dir dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid ces @168b pa bzhi ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir bcu drug go //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid ces @168b pa bzhi ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir bcu drug go //
translated: Here, the four kinds of emptiness, namely, the emptiness of things, the emptiness of non-things, the emptiness of own-nature, and the emptiness of other-nature, are included in the emptiness of non-apprehension, so there are sixteen kinds of emptiness.

original: nang gi chos mig la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: nang gi chos mig la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The internal phenomena are the eyes, etc.

original: de rnams mig la sogs pa rnams nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams mig la sogs pa rnams nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since they are empty of the eyes, etc., it is the emptiness of the internal.

original: phyi'i chos gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams te /
analyzed: phyi'i chos gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams te /
translated: The external phenomena are the objects, such as form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir phyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir phyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since they are empty of the forms, etc., it is the emptiness of the external.

original: nang gi chos mig la sogs pa rnams /
analyzed: nang gi chos mig la sogs pa rnams /
translated: The internal phenomena are the eyes, etc.

original: phyi'i chos gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams kyis stong zhing /
analyzed: phyi'i chos gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams kyis stong zhing /
translated: Since they are empty of the external phenomena, the objects such as form, etc.,

original: nang gi chos mig la sogs pa rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang gi chos mig la sogs pa rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: and since the internal phenomena, the eyes, etc., are empty of the internal phenomena, it is the emptiness of the internal and the external.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis chos thams cad stong pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis chos thams cad stong pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of emptiness, because all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir chen po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir chen po stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the great is the emptiness of the great, because the eastern direction, etc., is empty of the eastern direction, etc.

original: don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The ultimate is nirvana.

original: des mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa'i phyir don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: des mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa'i phyir don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang ; gzugs med pa'i khams ni 'dus byas te de rnams nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang ; gzugs med pa'i khams ni 'dus byas te de rnams nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The compounded is the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm. The emptiness of those is the emptiness of the compounded.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pas stong pa ni 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pas stong pa ni 'dus ma byas te /
translated: The uncompounded is empty of origination, cessation, etc.

original: de des stong pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de des stong pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of the uncompounded.

original: de las mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de las mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of what transcends limits?

original: gang gi mtha' nye bar dmigs pa med pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi mtha' nye bar dmigs pa med pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste /
translated: That which is not perceived as an extreme is beyond extremes.

original: mtha' las 'das pa mtha' las 'das pas stong pa'i phyir 'di ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa mtha' las 'das pas stong pa'i phyir 'di ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: Because that which is beyond extremes is empty of that which is beyond extremes, this is explained as the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: de la thog ma dang tham med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thog ma dang tham med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of what is not to be discarded?

original: gang gi thog ma med cing mtha' mi dmigs pa de'i dbus med do //
analyzed: gang gi thog ma med cing mtha' mi dmigs pa de'i dbus med do //
translated: That which has no beginning and is not perceived as an end has no middle.

original: gang gi thog ma med cing dbus med la tha ma mi dmigs pa de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi thog ma med cing dbus med la tha ma mi dmigs pa de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
translated: That which has no beginning and no middle and is not perceived as an end is without beginning and end.

original: de ni des stong pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni des stong pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Because that is empty of that, it is the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of inherent existence?

original: chos gang gi dor ba ni spro ba dang 'dor ba spong ba'o //🔽de ltar ma yin pa ni dor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang gi dor ba ni spro ba dang 'dor ba spong ba'o // de ltar ma yin pa ni dor ba med pa ste /
translated: The inherent existence of a phenomenon is its existence by virtue of its own characteristic.

original: de des stong pa'i phyir dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de des stong pa'i phyir dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Because that is empty of that, it is the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: gang zhig 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin de ni des stong pa'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //🔽gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir rang gi @169a * //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin de ni des stong pa'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid do // gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir rang gi @169a * //
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature is that the intrinsic nature of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena is empty of itself.

original: mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //🔽chos thams cad ni phung po lnga la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do // chos thams cad ni phung po lnga la sogs pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic identity is that the aggregates of form and so on are empty of their own specific characteristics.

original: de rnams nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is that all phenomena, the five aggregates and so on, are empty of themselves.

original: 'das pa'i chos la ma 'ongs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos la da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la da ltar byung ba nye bar dmigs pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa'i chos la ma 'ongs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos la da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la da ltar byung ba nye bar dmigs pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of nonobservation is that past phenomena are not observed in the future, present phenomena are not observed in the past and future, and past and future phenomena are not observed in the present.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin ni yang dag par sbyor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin ni yang dag par sbyor ba med pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature is that the intrinsic nature of phenomena is not something that can be joined with anything.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is a “process” because it is dependently arisen.

original: sbyor ba des stong pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: sbyor ba des stong pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
translated: It is the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence because it is empty of that process.

original: sbyor ba ni rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The “process” is the essential nature of non-existence because it is devoid of an essential nature.

original: dngos po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: “ Existence” is the five aggregates that are appropriated.

original: dngos po de yang dngos pos stong pa'i phyir dngos po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po de yang dngos pos stong pa'i phyir dngos po stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the emptiness of existence because that existence is empty of existence.

original: dngos po med pa ni 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni 'dus ma byas te /
translated: “ Non-existence” is the unconditioned.

original: de des stong pa'i phyir dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de des stong pa'i phyir dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the emptiness of non-existence because it is empty of that.

original: rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa nyid de /
translated: “ One’s own nature” is the non-erroneous essential nature.

original: de des stong pa'i phyir rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de des stong pa'i phyir rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the emptiness of one’s own nature because it is empty of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di kho na ltar gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di kho na ltar gnas te /
translated: Whether the Tathāgatas arise or not, this reality of dharmas just exists.

original: chos gnas ba nyid dang chos nges pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: chos gnas ba nyid dang chos nges pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The reality of phenomena, the certainty of phenomena, thusness, nonerroneous thusness, unaltered thusness, and the perfect end.

original: de des stong pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de des stong pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of other entities.

original: de la gzhan gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because other entities do not exist.

original: 'dir stong pa nyid bcu drug kho nar gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir stong pa nyid bcu drug kho nar gzung ste /
translated: Here, only sixteen kinds of emptiness are accepted.

original: stong pa nyid bzhi ni nang du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bzhi ni nang du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Four kinds of emptiness should be understood as internal.

original: bdud dag pa las zhabs dag go zhes pa phung po'i bdud ni tshangs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdud dag pa las zhabs dag go zhes pa phung po'i bdud ni tshangs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The four demons are purified in the feet. The demon of the aggregates takes the form of Brahma.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni gnod sbyin gyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni gnod sbyin gyi gzugs can no //
translated: The demon of afflictions has the form of a yaksha.

original: 'chi bdag gi bdud ni gshin rje'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi bdud ni gshin rje'i gzugs can no //
translated: The demon of the Lord of Death has the form of Yama.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud ni dbang po'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud ni dbang po'i gzugs can no //
translated: The demon of the sons of the gods has the form of Indra.

original: 'di rnams las rnam par rgyal bas bdud bzhi rnam par dag pas zhabs bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams las rnam par rgyal bas bdud bzhi rnam par dag pas zhabs bzhi'o //
translated: Since one is victorious over these, the four demons are purified in the four feet.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgyad rnam par dag pa zhal brgyad ces pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang // rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgyad rnam par dag pa zhal brgyad ces pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang // rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgyad de /
translated: The eight gates of liberation are emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, the cultivation of the contemplation of the repulsiveness whose characteristic is natural luminosity, and so on.

original: de dag rnam par dag pas zhal rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rnam par dag pas zhal rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Since they are purified, the faces are purified.🔽The ten totalities are the ten hands.

original: gzugs can @169b gzugs rnams stong par lta ba dang / nang gi gzugs rnams stong par lta ba dang / phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams stong par lta ba dang / skye mched rnams stong par lta ba dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched stong par lta ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs can @169b gzugs rnams stong par lta ba dang / nang gi gzugs rnams stong par lta ba dang / phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams stong par lta ba dang / skye mched rnams stong par lta ba dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched stong par lta ba dang /
translated: The ten totalities are the totality of form, the totality of the formless, the totality of internal form, the totality of external form, the totality of the sense bases, the totality of the sphere of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched stong par lta ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched stong par lta ba dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched stong par lta ba'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched stong par lta ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched stong par lta ba dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched stong par lta ba'o //
translated: the totality of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the totality of the sphere of nothingness, and the totality of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: spyan rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: spyan rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The eyes are the purities of body, speech, and mind.

original: rdo rje gsum rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: They are the purities of the three vajras.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purities of the great elements are stated:

original: sa ni pukka s'i ru bshad //
analyzed: sa ni pukka s'i ru bshad //
translated: Earth is said to be Pukkasī.

original: chu khams sha ba r'i ru brjod //
analyzed: chu khams sha ba r'i ru brjod //
translated: The water element is said to be Śavarī.

original: me ni tsanda l'ir shes bya //
analyzed: me ni tsanda l'ir shes bya //
translated: Fire is known to be Caṇḍālī.

original: rlung ni g-yung mor rab tu grags //
analyzed: rlung ni g-yung mor rab tu grags //
translated: Wind is well known to be Ḍombinī.

original: zhes pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnam par dag pas mkha' 'gro ma bzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnam par dag pas mkha' 'gro ma bzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purities of the four great elements are the purities of the four dakinis.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purities of hatred and so forth are stated:

original: zhe sdang 'khor lo can zhes bshad //
analyzed: zhe sdang 'khor lo can zhes bshad //
translated: Hatred is said to be Cakrika.

original: 'khor lo can zhes pa 'khor lo'i gtso mo bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo can zhes pa 'khor lo'i gtso mo bdag med ma ste /
translated: Cakrika, the chief of the cakras, is Nairātmya.

original: de ni zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: She is the purity of hatred.

original: zhe sdang ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Hatred is Akṣobhya.

original: rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma kho na'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma kho na'o //
translated: She is Nairātmya, who is inseparable from Vajradhara.

original: 'dod chags chu yi rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: 'dod chags chu yi rnal 'byor ma //
translated: Desire is Varuṇīyoginī.

original: de ni 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: She is the purity of desire.

original: 'dod chags ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Passion is Amitābha.

original: da rnam par dag pa chu'i rnal 'byor ma ste //
analyzed: da rnam par dag pa chu'i rnal 'byor ma ste //
translated: This is the water-yoginī, purified of jealousy.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa dang dbyer med pa'i chu'i rnal 'byor ma'o //🔽phrag dog rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa dang dbyer med pa'i chu'i rnal 'byor ma'o // phrag dog rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: She is the water-yoginī inseparable from Amitābha.🔽Envy is the Vajraḍāka.

original: phrag dog rnam par dag pa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ste /
analyzed: phrag dog rnam par dag pa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ste /
translated: This is the Vajraḍāka, purified of envy.

original: don yod grub pa rnam par dag pa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma yin pa'i phyir de dang dbyer med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: don yod grub pa rnam par dag pa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma yin pa'i phyir de dang dbyer med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: She is inseparable from Amoghasiddhi, because she is the purification of Amoghasiddhi.

original: ser sna gsang ba'i dkar mo ste /
analyzed: ser sna gsang ba'i dkar mo ste /
translated: Avarice is the secret Lāsyā.

original: ser sna rnam par dag pa nang gi rim par gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma ste /
analyzed: ser sna rnam par dag pa nang gi rim par gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma ste /
translated: This is the inner-circle ḍākinī, purified of avarice.

original: rin chen dbang po rnam par dag pa'i phyir de dang dbyer med pa nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rin chen dbang po rnam par dag pa'i phyir de dang dbyer med pa nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: She is inseparable from Ratnasaṃbhava, because she is the purification of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: gti mug de bzhin rdo rjer bshad //
analyzed: gti mug de bzhin rdo rjer bshad //
translated: Delusion is explained as the Vajra.

original: ces pa gti mug rnam par dag pa rdo rje ma ste /
analyzed: ces pa gti mug rnam par dag pa rdo rje ma ste /
translated: This is the Vajra, purified of delusion.

original: rdo rje ma ni rnam par snang mdzad rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje ma ni rnam par snang mdzad rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The Vajra is Vairocana, because she is the purification of Vairocana.

original: de dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje ma zhes pa'o //
translated: and Vajra Woman, inseparable from him.

original: 'dis ni / zhe sdang la sogs rnam sbyong ba //
analyzed: 'dis ni / zhe sdang la sogs rnam sbyong ba //
translated: This is the purification of hatred, etc.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa rnam par dag pa nang gi rim par gnas pa rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams so //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa rnam par dag pa nang gi rim par gnas pa rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams so //
translated: The five dakinis, inseparable from Vajradhara, are the internal sequence of the purification of hatred, etc.

original: rim pa 'dis phung po rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis phung po rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: By this sequence, the aggregates are purified.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs las ni //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs las ni //
translated: By the side of the creation stage,

original: 'dis ni phung po sbyang bar bya //🔽rim pa 'dis phung po zhes pa gzugs kyi phung po la sogs @170a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po sbyang bar bya // rim pa 'dis phung po zhes pa gzugs kyi phung po la sogs @170a * //
translated: by this, the aggregates are purified.

original: pas phung po lnga sbyang zhing dri ma med par bya'o //
analyzed: pas phung po lnga sbyang zhing dri ma med par bya'o //
translated: By this sequence, the aggregates, the five aggregates of form, etc., are purified and made stainless.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs las ni //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs las ni //
translated: By the side of the creation stage,

original: zhes pa lha'i rnam pa las so //
analyzed: zhes pa lha'i rnam pa las so //
translated: by the aspect of the deity.

original: yang na gang bskyed pa'i sgras rab tu rtogs par bskyed pa ni bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gang bskyed pa'i sgras rab tu rtogs par bskyed pa ni bskyed pa ste /
translated: Or else, that which is generated by the word “creation” is the creation,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir phul du byung ba'i ye shes so /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir phul du byung ba'i ye shes so /
translated: the supreme intuition, because it is not the domain of the disciples, etc.

original: de rim gyis rnyed pa'i phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: de rim gyis rnyed pa'i phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: Since it is attained in stages, it is the stage of development.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid las so //
translated: Therefore, it is from the nature of perfect pristine consciousness.

original: de nyid ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is that? It is said:

original: phyogs las rnam pa gnyis ka'ang //
analyzed: phyogs las rnam pa gnyis ka'ang //
translated: Both aspects from the directions.

original: zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid las rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma la sogs pa dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid las rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma la sogs pa dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the indivisibility of the relative and the ultimate, Vajradhara and Nairātmya are indivisible.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa kho na rab tu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa kho na rab tu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to clarify the indivisibility of the relative and the ultimate, perfect pristine consciousness is said to be:

original: gang dang gang gis 'jig rten 'ching 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis 'jig rten 'ching 'gyur ba //
translated: Whatever and however the world is bound,

original: de dang des ni 'ching ba las grol te //
analyzed: de dang des ni 'ching ba las grol te //
translated: by that and by that it is liberated from bondage.

original: 'jig rten rmongs pa de ni ma rtogs pa ;
analyzed: 'jig rten rmongs pa de ni ma rtogs pa ;
translated: The world does not understand that delusion;

original: / de nyid rnam spangs dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: / de nyid rnam spangs dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: without abandoning that, one will not attain siddhi.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa gang dang gang gis 'jig rten 'ching 'gyur 'khor bar 'ching zhing bcings par gyur ba de dang des ni 'ching ba 'khor bar gzung ba las grol zhing thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa gang dang gang gis 'jig rten 'ching 'gyur 'khor bar 'ching zhing bcings par gyur ba de dang des ni 'ching ba 'khor bar gzung ba las grol zhing thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: By whatever attachment to desire and so on, the world is bound, bound in cyclic existence, by that very [attachment] it is freed from grasping at cyclic existence, and is liberated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten rmongs pa gti mug gi mun pas bsgribs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten rmongs pa gti mug gi mun pas bsgribs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the world is deluded, obscured by the darkness of delusion.

original: de nyid ma rtogs pa de kho na mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ma rtogs pa de kho na mi shes pa'o //
translated: Not understanding thatness, one does not know reality.

original: de kho na shes pa med pa las /
analyzed: de kho na shes pa med pa las /
translated: Due to the absence of knowledge of reality,

original: dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one does not attain spiritual power, one does not obtain spiritual power.

original: yang na gang 'jig rten ni phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: yang na gang 'jig rten ni phung po lnga ste /
translated: Or else, the world is the five aggregates,

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi mngon par zhen pa gang dang gang gis 'ching 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi mngon par zhen pa gang dang gang gis 'ching 'gyur ba /
translated: by whatever attachment to objects such as form, one is bound,

original: mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: one becomes attached.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa de dang de nyid kyis ni 'ching ba las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa de dang de nyid kyis ni 'ching ba las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that very attachment to form and so on, one is freed from bondage.

original: 'jig rten ni rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni rmongs pa ste /
translated: The world is deluded,

original: ci ltar zhe na /🔽de kho na'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa de kho na rnam par spangs pa ste rang bzhin yongs su shes pa spangs pa las /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / de kho na'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa de kho na rnam par spangs pa ste rang bzhin yongs su shes pa spangs pa las /
translated: How is that?

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The Great Seal is not attained through the abandonment of the non-realization of the nature of reality, through the abandonment of the thorough knowledge of the nature.🔽It is attained through the thorough knowledge of the nature of the extremely pure Reality Body.

original: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can yongs su shes pa las 'grub par 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du sgrib pa nyid las 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can yongs su shes pa las 'grub par 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du sgrib pa nyid las 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is established through thorough knowledge of the nature of the extremely pure Reality Body, but in other ways, through the obscurations, one will revolve in cyclic existence.

original: de phyir dri med sgra med gzugs nyid med //
analyzed: de phyir dri med sgra med gzugs nyid med //
translated: Therefore, there is no stainlessness, no sound, no form itself,

original: ro yang med de sems ni rnam par @170b dag ;
analyzed: ro yang med de sems ni rnam par @170b dag ;
translated: no taste either, and the mind is thoroughly pure.

original: / reg med chos med thams cad rnam par dag / rang bzhin dag pa'i 'gro la 'gro bar shes //
analyzed: / reg med chos med thams cad rnam par dag / rang bzhin dag pa'i 'gro la 'gro bar shes //
translated: There is no touch, no phenomena, all are thoroughly pure, and one should know that beings are beings with a pure nature.

original: de phyir dri med sgra med gzugs nyid med //
analyzed: de phyir dri med sgra med gzugs nyid med //
translated: Therefore, there is no stainlessness, no sound, no form itself,

original: ro yang med do //
analyzed: ro yang med do //
translated: no taste either.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sems ni rnam par dag pa chos thams cad sems tsam gcig pu'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir sems las phyi rol du gyur pa so sor gsal ba gzhan cung zad kyang med kyi /
analyzed: sems ni rnam par dag pa chos thams cad sems tsam gcig pu'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir sems las phyi rol du gyur pa so sor gsal ba gzhan cung zad kyang med kyi /
translated: The mind is pure, because all phenomena are of the nature of mind only.🔽There is not the slightest external object that is distinct from the mind.

original: sems 'ba' zhig kho na rnam pa de dang de nyid kyis so sor gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems 'ba' zhig kho na rnam pa de dang de nyid kyis so sor gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind alone appears in various forms.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: phyi rol don ni yod min te //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni yod min te //
translated: External objects do not exist.

original: ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags pa //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags pa //
translated: As imagined by the childish,

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: The mind disturbed by habitual tendencies

original: don du snang ba rab tu byung //
analyzed: don du snang ba rab tu byung //
translated: Appears as objects.🔽Moreover:

original: gzhan yang / dngos po gang dang gang gis ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dngos po gang dang gang gis ni //
translated: By whatever things

original: mi rnams kyi yid yang dag sbyar //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi yid yang dag sbyar //
translated: The mind of people is purified,

original: des de'i rang bzhin nyid 'gyur te //
analyzed: des de'i rang bzhin nyid 'gyur te //
translated: By that it becomes their nature,

original: nor bu sna tshogs gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: nor bu sna tshogs gzugs bzhin no //
translated: Like a jewel in various forms.

original: de'i phyir thams cad sems tsam kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad sems tsam kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, everything is mind only.

original: sems ni rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The mind is pure.

original: reg med chos med /
analyzed: reg med chos med /
translated: There are no objects, no dharmas.

original: khyad par ci lta bu'i sems de rnam par dag ce na /
analyzed: khyad par ci lta bu'i sems de rnam par dag ce na /
translated: In what way is the mind pure?

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: thams cad rnam par dag pas khams gsum pa rnam par dag pa ste sems rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par dag pas khams gsum pa rnam par dag pa ste sems rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Since everything is pure, the three realms are pure, i.e., the mind is pure.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin dag pa nyid las 'gro ba 'gro bar shes pa'i rnam pa kho na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin dag pa nyid las 'gro ba 'gro bar shes pa'i rnam pa kho na zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the aspect of knowing the world as just the pure nature.

original: yang na gang /
analyzed: yang na gang /
translated: Or else, what?

original: de'i phyir dri med sgra med gzugs nyid med ro yang med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir dri med sgra med gzugs nyid med ro yang med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no sound, no form, no taste,

original: sems ni rnam par dag pa 'dis ni dri la sogs pa rnams dgag pa'i phyir sems kyi yang ngo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni rnam par dag pa 'dis ni dri la sogs pa rnams dgag pa'i phyir sems kyi yang ngo zhes pa ste /
translated: and no mind. By this purity of mind, smell, etc., are also negated.

original: rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i dag pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i dag pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: The purity of the purity of the nature is the gnosis of the dharma-dhātu, which is extremely pure.

original: reg med chos med ces pa bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba yang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: reg med chos med ces pa bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba yang med pa kho na'o //
translated: There is no touch, no dharma, i.e., there is no experience of pleasure, etc.

original: thams cad rnam par dag ces pa rnam par dag pa yin gyi rnam par ma dag pa ni cung zad kyang med de //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par dag ces pa rnam par dag pa yin gyi rnam par ma dag pa ni cung zad kyang med de //
translated: Everything is pure, i.e., everything is pure, not even a little impure.

original: des par dngos po thams cad kyi //
analyzed: des par dngos po thams cad kyi //
translated: The pure suchness of all things

original: rnam dag de bzhin nyid du brjod //
analyzed: rnam dag de bzhin nyid du brjod //
translated: is said to be the ultimate.

original: ces thog mar gsungs pa'i mjug bsdu ba nyid do //
analyzed: ces thog mar gsungs pa'i mjug bsdu ba nyid do //
translated: This is the conclusion of what was stated at the beginning.

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin dag pa'i 'gro ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin dag pa'i 'gro ba nyid de /
translated: This shows that the world is pure by nature.

original: de'i phyir 'gro bas shes pa brtan pa dang g-yo pa la sogs pa thams cad yang dag pa'i ye shes dang dbyer med pa kho na 'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro bas shes pa brtan pa dang g-yo pa la sogs pa thams cad yang dag pa'i ye shes dang dbyer med pa kho na 'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the world is inseparable from the perfect wisdom of the stable and the unstable.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'di dag thams cad sems tsam zhes //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad sems tsam zhes //
translated: “All this is mere mind,”

original: thub pa yis ni gang bstan pa //
analyzed: thub pa yis ni gang bstan pa //
translated: thus taught the Sage.

original: skrag pa yongs su spangs phyir te //
analyzed: skrag pa yongs su spangs phyir te //
translated: This is to abandon fear,

original: de ni byis pa'i de nyid min //
analyzed: de ni byis pa'i de nyid min //
translated: but it is not the reality for the childish.

original: zhes pa'o // rnam par dag pa'i le'u ste dgu pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rnam par dag pa'i le'u ste dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth chapter, on purity.

original: @171a * // bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dang dbyer med pa mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo dbyer med pa nyid kyis gang zhig khyad par du 'phags par dag pa ste //
analyzed: @171a * // bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dang dbyer med pa mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo dbyer med pa nyid kyis gang zhig khyad par du 'phags par dag pa ste //
translated: The mandala of the nine Vajradharas inseparable from Nairatmya, and the wheel of the nature of the fifteen dakinis inseparable from that mandala, are the purity of the special.🔽

original: le'u gang du shin tu rnam par dag pa ni de'i le'u ste dgu pa'o zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las le'u dgu pa'o /
analyzed: le'u gang du shin tu rnam par dag pa ni de'i le'u ste dgu pa'o zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las le'u dgu pa'o /
translated: The chapter is so called because it is the ninth chapter in which the extremely pure is taught.🔽The yoga of the extremely pure stage of perfection is the yoga of the great seal, which is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.🔽The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.🔽The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.
