analyzed: // / rim pa gnyis rnam par dag pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can yang dag pa'i de kho na goms par byed pa ni 'bras bu phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnal 'byor ma'i le'u kha sbyor🔽nyid las dkyil 'khor gnyis so //
translated: The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.🔽The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.🔽The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.🔽The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.🔽The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.🔽The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.🔽The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.🔽The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal of the stage of perfection.

original: de gnyis kyi bdag nyid can nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i le'ur yang rim pa gnyis rnam par dag pa mngon par brjod nas /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bdag nyid can nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i le'ur yang rim pa gnyis rnam par dag pa mngon par brjod nas /
translated: Since the two are of the same nature, the chapter on purification also expresses the purification of the two stages.

original: da ni slob ma dbang bskur ba'i le'u bshad par bya ba'i phyir gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni slob ma dbang bskur ba'i le'u bshad par bya ba'i phyir gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to explain the chapter on the consecration of disciples, it is said:

original: ji ltar gang zhig dbang bskur nas ni de nyid bshad ces pa'i gsungs las /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zhig dbang bskur nas ni de nyid bshad ces pa'i gsungs las /
translated: Having consecrated whom, that reality is explained.

original: dbang bskur med par de kho na bstan par mi nus shing dbang bskur yang dkyil 'khor dang bral bas yang dag par bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor dang dbang bskur ba dag gi cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: dbang bskur med par de kho na bstan par mi nus shing dbang bskur yang dkyil 'khor dang bral bas yang dag par bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor dang dbang bskur ba dag gi cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: Without consecration, it is not possible to teach thatness, and consecration also cannot be properly accomplished without a mandala. Therefore, the ritual of the mandala and consecration is taught.

original: de nas 'di las dkyil 'khor gyi //
analyzed: de nas 'di las dkyil 'khor gyi //
translated: Then, from this, the stages of the mandala

original: rim pa ji bzhi yang dag bshad //
analyzed: rim pa ji bzhi yang dag bshad //
translated: are explained just as they are.

original: gang gis slob ma dbang bskur ba'i //
analyzed: gang gis slob ma dbang bskur ba'i //
translated: Also, the ritual of consecrating disciples

original: cho ga'ang rab tu bshad par bya //
analyzed: cho ga'ang rab tu bshad par bya //
translated: is fully explained.

original: de nas zhes pa de ma thag bar ma chad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa de ma thag bar ma chad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Then means immediately, without interruption.

original: 'di las zhes pa rnam par dag pa'i le'u'i rjes thogs 'di las dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rab tu bshad de /
analyzed: 'di las zhes pa rnam par dag pa'i le'u'i rjes thogs 'di las dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rab tu bshad de /
translated: From this means from the immediately following chapter on purity, the ritual of the maṇḍala will be fully explained.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bstan par bya'o //
translated: The ritual of the maṇḍala should be taught.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga gang gis slob ma dbang bskur ba /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga gang gis slob ma dbang bskur ba /
translated: By what ritual of the maṇḍala is the disciple initiated?

original: dbang bskur zhing mtshon par byed pa ni dbang bskur bar brjod do //
analyzed: dbang bskur zhing mtshon par byed pa ni dbang bskur bar brjod do //
translated: Initiation and the indication of the deity are called initiation.

original: de'i cho ga'ang rab tu bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i cho ga'ang rab tu bshad par bya'o //
translated: Its ritual should also be fully explained.

original: 'dis ni dkyil 'khor ma mthong pa'i dbang bskur ba med do //
analyzed: 'dis ni dkyil 'khor ma mthong pa'i dbang bskur ba med do //
translated: By this, there is no initiation without seeing the maṇḍala.

original: dbang ma bskur ba'i de kho na thob pa med do //
analyzed: dbang ma bskur ba'i de kho na thob pa med do //
translated: Without initiation, there is no attainment of reality.

original: de kho na med pa'i phyag rgya chen po 'grub pa med do /
analyzed: de kho na med pa'i phyag rgya chen po 'grub pa med do /
translated: Without reality, there is no accomplishment of mahāmudrā.

original: dngos grub kyi don du de kho na thob pa dang / de'i don du dbang bskur ba dang / dbang bskur ba'i don du dkyil 'khor yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi don nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: dngos grub kyi don du de kho na thob pa dang / de'i don du dbang bskur ba dang / dbang bskur ba'i don du dkyil 'khor yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi don nyid gsungs pa /
translated: For the sake of attainment, there is the attainment of reality, for that purpose there is initiation, and for the sake of initiation there is the maṇḍala. Therefore, the meaning of the maṇḍala is taught:

original: nor 'dzin sbyang bya rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: nor 'dzin sbyang bya rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi should purify the earth.

original: dang por lha yi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: dang por lha yi bdag nyid can //
translated: First, having the nature of the deity,

original: aom raksha raksha zhes pas sbyang pa'i sngags kyis @171b nor 'dzin sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom raksha raksha zhes pas sbyang pa'i sngags kyis @171b nor 'dzin sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: one should purify the earth with the mantra of purification, “Oṃ rakṣa rakṣa.”

original: dang por sngon du lha'i bdag nyid can zhes pa gang gi bdag nyid lha kho na yin pa de ni lha'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: dang por sngon du lha'i bdag nyid can zhes pa gang gi bdag nyid lha kho na yin pa de ni lha'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: “First, having the nature of the deity” means that one who has the nature of the deity alone is one who has the nature of the deity.

original: slob dpon rang nyid lha'i sku'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: slob dpon rang nyid lha'i sku'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the master himself is the nature of the deity’s body.

original: yang nor 'dzin zhes pa chos 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang nor 'dzin zhes pa chos 'byung ste /
translated: “Earth” is the source of phenomena.

original: sbyang bya zhes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can nyid kyis rnam par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyang bya zhes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can nyid kyis rnam par gnas par bya'o //
translated: “That which is to be purified” is the utterly pure nature of the dharmadhātu, which should be visualized.

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par dag pa dang lha'i rnam pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par dag pa dang lha'i rnam pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: “The yogi” is the purity of suchness and the purity of the deity’s form.

original: dang por zhes pa ji ltar gnyis su med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dang por zhes pa ji ltar gnyis su med par gyur pa'o //
translated: “First” means how they become nondual.

original: lha'i bdag nyid can zhes pa rnal 'byor pa gang zhig lha'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa de ni lha'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: lha'i bdag nyid can zhes pa rnal 'byor pa gang zhig lha'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa de ni lha'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: The one who is endowed with the yoga of the gnosis of the nature of the deity is the one who has the nature of the deity.

original: ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin rnam par dag pa gnyis kyi ye shes kyi sku zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin rnam par dag pa gnyis kyi ye shes kyi sku zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the gnosis body of the two purities, which is the nature of the three bodies and the five gnoses.

original: 'bad pas h'um las rdo rje can //
analyzed: 'bad pas h'um las rdo rje can //
translated: Having made the vajra from the syllable hūṃ with effort,

original: byas te phyi nas dkyil 'khor bri //
analyzed: byas te phyi nas dkyil 'khor bri //
translated: then draw the maṇḍala.

original: nor 'dzin rnam par sbyangs pa ste //
analyzed: nor 'dzin rnam par sbyangs pa ste //
translated: The earth is purified,

original: bar ma chad pas rnal 'byor pas dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar ma chad pas rnal 'byor pas dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: and the yogin should draw the maṇḍala without interruption.

original: 'bad pas h'um las rdo rje can byas te zhes pa //
analyzed: 'bad pas h'um las rdo rje can byas te zhes pa //
translated: Having made the vajra from the syllable hūṃ with effort,

original: re phas sngon du nyi ma rnam bsgom sa te zhes pa la sogs pa'i rim pas rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi dang / rdo rje'i gur dang / rdo rje'i ra ba ste /
analyzed: re phas sngon du nyi ma rnam bsgom sa te zhes pa la sogs pa'i rim pas rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi dang / rdo rje'i gur dang / rdo rje'i ra ba ste /
translated: having previously meditated on the sun with the syllable raṃ, and so on, the yogin should draw the maṇḍala without interruption.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis gzhal yas khang rnam par bsams nas de'i dbus su dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis gzhal yas khang rnam par bsams nas de'i dbus su dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: Having visualized the celestial mansion with a nature of vajras, one should draw the mandala in its center.

original: yang na / h'um las rdo rje can byas te //
analyzed: yang na / h'um las rdo rje can byas te //
translated: Or else, having made the vajra from the syllable hūṃ,

original: zhes pa h'um yig dbyer med pa kho na rdo rje 'chang dang / bdag med ma'i bdag nyid can du byas te /
analyzed: zhes pa h'um yig dbyer med pa kho na rdo rje 'chang dang / bdag med ma'i bdag nyid can du byas te /
translated: the syllable hūṃ alone is made into Vajradhara and Nairātmyā.

original: phyi nas zhes pa de ma thag par ma chad pa nyid kyis dkyil 'khor yang dag pa'i ye shes bri zhing rtag tu lhag par gnas pas rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas zhes pa de ma thag par ma chad pa nyid kyis dkyil 'khor yang dag pa'i ye shes bri zhing rtag tu lhag par gnas pas rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, immediately after that, without interruption, the mandala of pure pristine consciousness should be drawn and always established by abiding.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i gnas gsungs pa //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i gnas gsungs pa //
translated: The place for drawing the mandala is stated:🔽In a garden, an uninhabited place,

original: skyed tshal skye bo med gnas dang // byang chub sems dpa'i khyim dang ni //
analyzed: skyed tshal skye bo med gnas dang // byang chub sems dpa'i khyim dang ni //
translated: the house of a bodhisattva,

original: dkyil 'khor khang pa'i nang du yang //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor khang pa'i nang du yang //
translated: or inside a mandala house,

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa bzhengs par bya //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bzhengs par bya //
translated: the supreme mandala should be erected.

original: skyed tshal zhes pa sa gzhi shing ljon pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: skyed tshal zhes pa sa gzhi shing ljon pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: A garden is a place with various trees and plants.

original: byin gyis brlab pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the place of consecration.

original: skye bo med ces pa skye bo ma rungs pa dang bral ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: skye bo med ces pa skye bo ma rungs pa dang bral ba'i gnas so //
translated: The word without people means a place free from bad people.

original: gnas zhes pa yul phyogs so //
analyzed: gnas zhes pa yul phyogs so //
translated: The word place means a region.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i khyim du ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i khyim du ni //
translated: In the house of a Bodhisattva,

original: zhes pa skye bo ngan pa dang bral yang skye bo bzang po dang ldan pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: zhes pa skye bo ngan pa dang bral yang skye bo bzang po dang ldan pa'i gnas te /
translated: means a place free from bad people but endowed with good people.

original: gnas 'di rnams su dkyil 'khor gyi khang @172a * //🔽pa bya zhing /
analyzed: gnas 'di rnams su dkyil 'khor gyi khang @172a * // pa bya zhing /
translated: In these places one should build a mandala house.

original: de'i nang du dkyil 'khor bzhengs par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i nang du dkyil 'khor bzhengs par bya ste /
translated: And inside that one should construct the mandala.

original: dam pa zhes pa mchog go //
analyzed: dam pa zhes pa mchog go //
translated: The word excellent means supreme.

original: yang na / skyed tshal zhes pa skyes pa dang de'i theg pa ye shes te /
analyzed: yang na / skyed tshal zhes pa skyes pa dang de'i theg pa ye shes te /
translated: Alternatively, garden means the vehicle of a man and the wisdom of that vehicle.

original: skyed tshal spro ba'i ye shes de la'o //
analyzed: skyed tshal spro ba'i ye shes de la'o //
translated: The wisdom of delighting in a garden is in that.

original: skye bo med ces pa gang la skye bo dbang po la sogs pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: skye bo med ces pa gang la skye bo dbang po la sogs pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The word without people means that which is free from people, the sense faculties, and so forth.

original: skye bo med pa sdud pa'i ye shes de la'o //
analyzed: skye bo med pa sdud pa'i ye shes de la'o //
translated: The wisdom of gathering without people is in that.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i khyim dang ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i khyim dang ni //
translated: In the house of a Bodhisattva,

original: zhes pa / byang chub rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes dang sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhes pa / byang chub rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes dang sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The Bodhisattva is the nonconceptual intuition and the three worlds are identical.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes srid pa gsum dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes srid pa gsum dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The three worlds are nonconceptual intuition.

original: de'i khyim ni gnas te /
analyzed: de'i khyim ni gnas te /
translated: His house is the abode.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gnas 'di rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gnas 'di rnams so //
translated: These are the abodes of nonconceptuality.

original: dkyil 'khor khang pa'i nang du yang //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor khang pa'i nang du yang //
translated: In the center of the house

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi gnas gang yin pa ni nang ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi gnas gang yin pa ni nang ste /
translated: The center is the abode of perfect intuition.

original: de la rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa nyid kyis yongs su bcad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa nyid kyis yongs su bcad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, because of the absence of all conceptual thought and discursive thought, it cannot be delimited.

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa bzhengs par bya //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bzhengs par bya //
translated: One should erect the holy mandala.

original: khyab pa nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang ni dam pa dang / sdom pa dang / mchog dang / gong ma ste /
analyzed: khyab pa nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang ni dam pa dang / sdom pa dang / mchog dang / gong ma ste /
translated: Vajradhara is holy, restrained, supreme, and higher, because of his pervasiveness.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
translated: He is not the domain of experience of the Sravakas, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa'i don du rdul tshon gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa'i don du rdul tshon gsungs pa /
translated: The colors of the sand are mentioned for the purpose of erecting the mandala.

original: lha yi tshon gyis bri ba ste //
analyzed: lha yi tshon gyis bri ba ste //
translated: One should draw with divine colors,

original: yang na 'bring po nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yang na 'bring po nyid kyis so //
translated: or else with the middle one.

original: rin chen lnga yi phye ma'am //
analyzed: rin chen lnga yi phye ma'am //
translated: With the five precious substances

original: yang na 'bras la sogs pas so //
analyzed: yang na 'bras la sogs pas so //
translated: or else with rice and so forth.

original: lha'i zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i lha lhag par gnas pas so //
analyzed: lha'i zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i lha lhag par gnas pas so //
translated: The divine means the pure deities such as Vairocana, etc., by the rite of consecration.

original: tshon gyis bri ba ste zhes pa tshon gyi ri mo la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: tshon gyis bri ba ste zhes pa tshon gyi ri mo la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The colors means the colored powders, etc.

original: rin chen lnga zhes pa aindra n'i la dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / zla ba chu shel dang / ma ra ka ta la sogs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rin chen lnga zhes pa aindra n'i la dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / zla ba chu shel dang / ma ra ka ta la sogs pa rnams sam /
translated: The five precious substances means sapphire, pearl, lapis lazuli, moonstone, and ruby, etc.

original: yang na gang /
analyzed: yang na gang /
translated: Or else, what?

original: mu men dang / dung dang / bye ru dang / gser dang / dngul la sogs pa'i bye ma rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mu men dang / dung dang / bye ru dang / gser dang / dngul la sogs pa'i bye ma rnams kyis so //
translated: The five precious substances means sapphire, conch, coral, gold, and silver, etc.

original: yang na zhes pa phyogs gzhan te /
analyzed: yang na zhes pa phyogs gzhan te /
translated: Or else, in another way means

original: 'bras la sogs pas so zhes pa 'bras dang gro la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pas so zhes pa 'bras dang gro la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: with rice and so forth, which means rice, wheat, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnam par dag pa'i kha dog lnga'i rang bzhin rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnam par dag pa'i kha dog lnga'i rang bzhin rnams kyis so //
translated: By the five colors, which are the nature of the five pure Tathāgatas.

original: yang na lha'i zhes pa lha ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na lha'i zhes pa lha ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, “of the gods” means of Indra and so on.

original: de rnams kyi ai na sems dra lha yis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ai na sems dra lha yis zhes pa'o //
translated: “Their” means of their minds.

original: de spong zhing 'dor ba'i phyir lha yis ra'o //
analyzed: de spong zhing 'dor ba'i phyir lha yis ra'o //
translated: “Of the gods” means of the gods who abandon and reject them.

original: de yang chu ste /
analyzed: de yang chu ste /
translated: That is water.

original: 'di ni dbang po dang sems spong ba'i chu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po dang sems spong ba'i chu'o //
translated: This is the water that abandons the sense organs and the mind.

original: de yang / yul ni dbang po dang rnam par @172b shes pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa kho na zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang / yul ni dbang po dang rnam par @172b shes pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa kho na zhes pa'i don to //
translated: And that is the object, because it is not different from the sense organ and the consciousness. The meaning is that it is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: de la ae ka na chos 'byung las skyes pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can gyi ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: de la ae ka na chos 'byung las skyes pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can gyi ye shes kyis so //
translated: There, “by the one” means by the gnosis that arises from the dharma-dhātu, which is born from the dharma-born lotus.

original: 'bring po yis ni yang na'o //🔽aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: 'bring po yis ni yang na'o // aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: “By the middle one” means by the gnosis of the enjoyment body.🔽“A” is Nairātmya.

original: tha mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: tha mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: “Tha” is Akṣhobhya.

original: ba byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: ba byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: “Va” is bodhicitta.

original: aa bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: aa bdag med ma ste /
translated: “A” is Nairātmya.

original: rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa spro ba dang sdud pa dang / sdud pa dang spro ba'i bdag nyid can gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid kyis yongs su bcad par mi nus pa'i phyir rgyu des na dbu ma'o //
analyzed: rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa spro ba dang sdud pa dang / sdud pa dang spro ba'i bdag nyid can gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid kyis yongs su bcad par mi nus pa'i phyir rgyu des na dbu ma'o //
translated: Because of the impossibility of defining it by the two, expansion and contraction, which are gradual and not gradual, and by the indivisibility of the two, contraction and expansion, therefore it is the Middle.

original: khyad par gyi don la ni'i sgra ste /
analyzed: khyad par gyi don la ni'i sgra ste /
translated: The word “in” has the sense of distinction.

original: khyad par 'di lta bus khyad par du 'phags pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par 'di lta bus khyad par du 'phags pa zhes pa'o //
translated: It is distinguished by such a distinction.

original: rin chen lnga yi rang bzhin zhes pa lnga'i sgra dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: rin chen lnga yi rang bzhin zhes pa lnga'i sgra dbang po rnams te /
translated: “The nature of the five jewels” — the word “five” is the sense faculties.

original: rin chen ni sems so //
analyzed: rin chen ni sems so //
translated: The jewel is the mind.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de rnams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de rnams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Its nature is their transformation.

original: phye ma yis zhes pa rdul phra rab yang dag par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phye ma yis zhes pa rdul phra rab yang dag par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: “With powder” — because of the expression of the subtle particles.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “Pervading the sphere of space” — by those.

original: yang na zhes pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras la sogs pas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras la sogs pas zhes pa'o //
translated: “Or” — the indivisibility of the two, the result of intuition, etc.

original: yang na 'bras la sogs pa zhes pa ji ltar 'bras ni phub ma las rnam par grol ba nyid las snying por rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yang na 'bras la sogs pa zhes pa ji ltar 'bras ni phub ma las rnam par grol ba nyid las snying por rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Or else, “rice, etc.” is like how rice is posited as the essence due to being free from the husk.

original: de bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib g-yogs spangs pa nyid las shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib g-yogs spangs pa nyid las shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, the nature of the utterly pure dharmadhātu is due to abandoning the obscurations of superimposition, etc.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i ka dang po rnams kyis kam bde ba 'dzag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i ka dang po rnams kyis kam bde ba 'dzag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The first ka of that is the gnosis of the nature of the bliss of nonemission.

original: de nyid dang po gtso bo'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de nyid dang po gtso bo'i rgyu ste /
translated: That is the primary cause of the first.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the tathāgatas.

original: de rnams kyi zhes pa rnam pa gnyis ka'i rnam par dag pa dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes pa rnam pa gnyis ka'i rnam par dag pa dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “Of those” means the nature of Vajradhara, who is the purity of both aspects, the nature of the two maṇḍalas.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi tshad gsungs pa //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi tshad gsungs pa //
translated: The measure of the maṇḍala is stated:

original: dkyil 'khor khru gsum bya ba ste //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor khru gsum bya ba ste //
translated: The maṇḍala should be made three cubits,

original: mthe bong gsum ni lhag ma bzhi //
analyzed: mthe bong gsum ni lhag ma bzhi //
translated: with three thumbs and the rest four.

original: khru gsum zhes pa mi bskyod pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir te /🔽khru ni sor mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: khru gsum zhes pa mi bskyod pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir te / khru ni sor mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Three cubits is for the sake of the purification of Akṣobhya.🔽A cubit is twenty-four finger lengths.

original: sor mo yang nas bzhi'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: sor mo yang nas bzhi'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: A finger is the size of four barley grains.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis ni khru ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis ni khru ste /
translated: Thus, two of those are a cubit.

original: gsum gyi tshad do //
analyzed: gsum gyi tshad do //
translated: The measure is three cubits.

original: mthe bong gsum ni lhag pa khru re re mthe bong gsum lhag pa sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: mthe bong gsum ni lhag pa khru re re mthe bong gsum lhag pa sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Three thumbs are one cubit.

original: bzhi zhes pa mthe bong gi tshad ni nas bzhi ste /
analyzed: bzhi zhes pa mthe bong gi tshad ni nas bzhi ste /
translated: Four is the measure of a thumb, which is four barley grains.

original: 'di ni tshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad do //
translated: This is the measure.🔽Or, the mandala is three cubits.

original: yang na / dkyil 'khor khru gsum zhes pa gsum gyi sgras sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: yang na / dkyil 'khor khru gsum zhes pa gsum gyi sgras sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
translated: The word three is body, speech, and mind.

original: khru'i sgras lnga'i bdag @173a * //🔽nyid can gnyis te /
analyzed: khru'i sgras lnga'i bdag @173a * // nyid can gnyis te /
translated: The word cubit is the nature of five.

original: dbang po dang yul lo //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul lo //
translated: That is, the sense organs and objects.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo ste /
translated: The mandala is the principal of the mandala.

original: sems kyi ming can ye shes so //
analyzed: sems kyi ming can ye shes so //
translated: The mind is the gnosis that has that name.

original: zhes pa sku gsum dang / ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa sku gsum dang / ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That is, the gnosis of reality, which is the nature of the three kāyas and the five gnoses.

original: bya ba zhes pa 'di nyid 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bya ba zhes pa 'di nyid 'bras bu ste /
translated: The action is the result of this.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: de nyid khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between that and the previous one?

original: mthe bong gsum ni lhag pa zhes pa /
analyzed: mthe bong gsum ni lhag pa zhes pa /
translated: The three fingers are the excess.

original: gsum gyi sgras lhan cig skyes pa ye shes kyi cha shas gsum ste /
analyzed: gsum gyi sgras lhan cig skyes pa ye shes kyi cha shas gsum ste /
translated: The word “three” refers to the three parts of the innate gnosis,

original: dga' ba la sogs pa dga' bral gyi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa dga' bral gyi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: which are the joy and so forth up to the culmination of the separation from joy.

original: de ni mthe bong ni mthe bong lhag pa ste //
analyzed: de ni mthe bong ni mthe bong lhag pa ste //
translated: That is the excess of the thumb.

original: mthe bong ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: mthe bong ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The thumb is Vajradhara.

original: de lhag par mtshon par byed de ;
analyzed: de lhag par mtshon par byed de ;
translated: He is the one who is indicated by the excess.

original: kam bde ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: kam bde ba'i ye shes so //
translated: Kam is the gnosis of bliss.

original: de yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang bzhi ste /
translated: That is also fourfold.

original: bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The fourth is the meaning of the gnosis that is innate.

original: dkyil 'khor der rig ma gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor der rig ma gzhug par bya ste /
translated: One should introduce the knowledge consort into that maṇḍala.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: der ni rig ma gzhug bya ste /
analyzed: der ni rig ma gzhug bya ste /
translated: One should introduce the knowledge consort

original: lha mo rigs lnga las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lha mo rigs lnga las byung ba'o //
translated: into that, arisen from the five families of goddesses.

original: dkyil 'khor der ni rig ma zhes pa btsun mo shes rab bo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor der ni rig ma zhes pa btsun mo shes rab bo //
translated: “Into that maṇḍala” is the queen of wisdom.

original: lha mo zhes pa lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo zhes pa lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Goddess” is endowed with the yoga of the deity.

original: rigs lnga las byung ba zhes pa rdo rje'i rigs la sogs pa rigs lnga las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga las byung ba zhes pa rdo rje'i rigs la sogs pa rigs lnga las skyes pa'o //
translated: Born from the five clans means born from the five clans of the vajra clan and so on.

original: yang na / der ni zhes pa yang dag pa'i ye shes su rig ma zhes pa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: yang na / der ni zhes pa yang dag pa'i ye shes su rig ma zhes pa bdag med ma'o //
translated: Or else, there means in the authentic intuition, the knowledge woman means the selflessness woman.

original: gzhug bya ste zhes pa phul du byung bas zhugs pa de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhug bya ste zhes pa phul du byung bas zhugs pa de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should introduce means one should abide in the nature of that introduction by the highest.

original: lha mo zhes pa lha'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: lha mo zhes pa lha'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: Goddess means having the nature of a deity.

original: sdud pa'i bdag nyid can 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi de ni spro ba'i rang bzhin can yang ngo //
analyzed: sdud pa'i bdag nyid can 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi de ni spro ba'i rang bzhin can yang ngo //
translated: She is not only of the nature of the gathering, but also of the nature of the emanation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rigs lnga las byung ba'i rigs lnga ni me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rigs lnga las byung ba'i rigs lnga ni me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'o //
translated: For that very reason, born from the five clans means the five intuitions of the mirror-like intuition and so on.

original: de rnams las byung ba ni skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams las byung ba ni skyes pa ste /
translated: Born from those means arisen.

original: gang zhig spro bar byed pa de rigs lnga las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig spro bar byed pa de rigs lnga las byung ba'o //
translated: That which emanates is born from the five clans.

original: yang na ji ltar gang rnyed de /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar gang rnyed de /
translated: Or else, how? means what is found?

original: de ltar bcu drug lon pa nyid /
analyzed: de ltar bcu drug lon pa nyid /
translated: Thus, one who is sixteen years old.

original: rigs lnga med pa'i phyir thun mong ba ji ltar gang rnyed pa bzang mo ma yin pa yang ste /
analyzed: rigs lnga med pa'i phyir thun mong ba ji ltar gang rnyed pa bzang mo ma yin pa yang ste /
translated: Since the five clans do not exist, how can there be a common one?

original: 'on kyang bcu drug lon pa gzung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bcu drug lon pa gzung ste /
translated: But one who has reached sixteen years of age is to be taken,

original: byang chub kyi sems rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the thought of enlightenment is expanded.

original: yang na / aa tha b'a zhes pa bdag med ma dang rdo rje 'chang dbyer med pa dang / rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na / aa tha b'a zhes pa bdag med ma dang rdo rje 'chang dbyer med pa dang / rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Or else, atha vā means the indivisibility of Nairātmya and Vajradhara, and the indivisibility of Vajradhara and Nairātmya, the nature of perfect intuition.

original: gang zhig ces pa nges pa'i bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa nges pa'i bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Whoever” cannot be construed as a definite action.

original: ji ltar rnyed pa zhes pa rnam pa gang gis rnyed pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa zhes pa rnam pa gang gis rnyed pa'i ye shes so //
translated: “As found” is the intuition found in whatever way.

original: bcu drug lon pa zhes pa stong pa @173b nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: bcu drug lon pa zhes pa stong pa @173b nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: “One who has reached sixteen years of age” is the thought of enlightenment, purified of the sixteen emptinesses.

original: de ster zhing yongs su gtong ba'i phyir bcu drug lon pa'o //
analyzed: de ster zhing yongs su gtong ba'i phyir bcu drug lon pa'o //
translated: “One who has reached sixteen years of age” is so called because he bestows and gives that.

original: de ni stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa dang byang chub kyi sems kyang ste bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa dang byang chub kyi sems kyang ste bdag med ma'o //
translated: That is the sixteen emptinesses, and also the enlightenment spirit, which is Nairātmya.

original: des de'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su spong ba'i phyir de la bag chags kyi skyon yang med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des de'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su spong ba'i phyir de la bag chags kyi skyon yang med do zhes pa'o //
translated: Since she is the one who abandons that nature, there is no fault of latent tendencies in her.

original: btsun mo de yang bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: btsun mo de yang bsten par bya ste /
translated: That queen should be served.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa //
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: ji srid khu ba ldan gyur pa //
analyzed: ji srid khu ba ldan gyur pa //
translated: As long as there is semen,

original: de srid phyag rgya bsten par bya //
analyzed: de srid phyag rgya bsten par bya //
translated: the seal should be served.

original: ji srid de la byang chub kyi sems 'byung bar gyur pa de srid phyag rgya de bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid de la byang chub kyi sems 'byung bar gyur pa de srid phyag rgya de bsten par bya'o //
translated: As long as the enlightenment spirit arises in her, the seal should be served.

original: yang na re zhig phyag rgya de bsten zhing goms par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na re zhig phyag rgya de bsten zhing goms par bya ste /
translated: Or else, for the time being, the seal should be served and cultivated.

original: ji srid khu ba ldan pa byang chub kyi sems stong pa nyid dang / snying rje dbyer med pa'i ye shes dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid khu ba ldan pa byang chub kyi sems stong pa nyid dang / snying rje dbyer med pa'i ye shes dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: As long as there is semen, the enlightenment spirit, which is the gnosis of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion.

original: 'dis ci gsungs na /
analyzed: 'dis ci gsungs na /
translated: What is said by this?

original: phyag rgya chen po goms pas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid mngon du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po goms pas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid mngon du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: By cultivating the great seal, the emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations becomes evident.

original: phyag rgya bsten pa de la yang gang 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: phyag rgya bsten pa de la yang gang 'byung zhe na /
translated: What arises from that reliance on the seal?

original: de'i bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavān declares the activity:

original: phyag rgya'i gdong ni bcing ba ste //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i gdong ni bcing ba ste //
translated: The face of the seal is bound,

original: thabs kyi gdong yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: thabs kyi gdong yang de bzhin no //
translated: and likewise the face of the method.

original: bsten pa de las gang byung ba //
analyzed: bsten pa de las gang byung ba //
translated: What arises from that reliance

original: slob ma'i kha ru gzhug par bya //
analyzed: slob ma'i kha ru gzhug par bya //
translated: is placed in the mouth of the disciple.

original: btsun mo dang skyes bu'i gdong pa yang gos kyis bcings te /
analyzed: btsun mo dang skyes bu'i gdong pa yang gos kyis bcings te /
translated: The face of the queen and the face of the man are also bound with cloth.

original: bsten zhing goms pas de las gang byung ba byang chub kyi sems gang zhig byung ba de /
analyzed: bsten zhing goms pas de las gang byung ba byang chub kyi sems gang zhig byung ba de /
translated: By relying on and cultivating that, what arises from that is the bodhicitta.

original: slob ma'i kha ru gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma'i kha ru gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Whatever arises is placed in the mouth of the disciple.

original: yang na / phyag rgya bdag med ma'i gdong dang por stong nyid byang chub bcings te brtan par bya zhing thabs rdo rje 'chang gi gdong snying rje yang bcings te brtan par byas nas stong pa nyid dang snying rje g-yo ba med par byas te /
analyzed: yang na / phyag rgya bdag med ma'i gdong dang por stong nyid byang chub bcings te brtan par bya zhing thabs rdo rje 'chang gi gdong snying rje yang bcings te brtan par byas nas stong pa nyid dang snying rje g-yo ba med par byas te /
translated: Or else, the face of the seal Nairatmya is first bound with the enlightenment of emptiness and made firm, and the face of the means Vajradhara is bound with compassion and made firm.🔽Having generated the enlightenment mind, one should rely on and cultivate it.

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas brten cing goms pas gang byang chub kyi sems gang zhig byung ba de slob ma'i kha ru zhes pa slob ma ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas brten cing goms pas gang byang chub kyi sems gang zhig byung ba de slob ma'i kha ru zhes pa slob ma ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: The enlightenment mind that arises should be placed in the mouth of the disciple. The disciple is the sense faculties.

original: de rnams kyi kha ni yul rnams te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi kha ni yul rnams te /
translated: The mouth of the disciple is the objects.

original: slob ma'i kha yul dang dbang po der gzhug cing bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: slob ma'i kha yul dang dbang po der gzhug cing bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: One should place the enlightenment mind in the mouth of the disciple, the objects and sense faculties, and gather it.

original: de dag dbyer med par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dag dbyer med par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they should be made inseparable.

original: byang chub kyi sems de ni gang zhig yul dang dbang po tha dad med pa kho na'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de ni gang zhig yul dang dbang po tha dad med pa kho na'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The enlightenment mind is that which is not different from the objects and sense faculties.

original: 'di nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pa /
translated: This is made clear.

original: ro mnyam slob ma'i spyod yul ni //
analyzed: ro mnyam slob ma'i spyod yul ni //
translated: The domain of the disciple is the same taste.

original: de nyid la yang bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid la yang bya ba ste /
translated: The action is in that itself.

original: de nyid la zhes pa goms pa na ro mnyam stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems de slob ma'i spyod yul te /
analyzed: de nyid la zhes pa goms pa na ro mnyam stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems de slob ma'i spyod yul te /
translated: The domain of the disciple is the same taste, the emptiness and compassion indivisible, the thought of enlightenment, when one is accustomed to that.

original: 'di la goms rnams spyod pa'i phyir spyod yul ni yul rnams so /
analyzed: 'di la goms rnams spyod pa'i phyir spyod yul ni yul rnams so /
translated: The domain is the objects, because those who are accustomed to this are engaged in the practice.

original: @174a * // slob ma ni dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: @174a * // slob ma ni dbang po rnams te /
translated: The disciple is the senses.

original: slob ma'i spyod yul slob ma dang spyod yul dbang po dang yul te ro mnyam par bya zhing thams cad byang chub kyi sems dbyer med pa kho na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma'i spyod yul slob ma dang spyod yul dbang po dang yul te ro mnyam par bya zhing thams cad byang chub kyi sems dbyer med pa kho na zhes pa'o //
translated: The domain of the disciple is the senses and the objects, which are to be made of the same taste, and all of them are only the indivisible thought of enlightenment.

original: 'di'i kun rdzob kyi don ni phyag rgya de nyid la slob ma'i spyod yul slob ma dang nye bar ro mnyam 'dus par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i kun rdzob kyi don ni phyag rgya de nyid la slob ma'i spyod yul slob ma dang nye bar ro mnyam 'dus par bya'o //
translated: The conventional meaning of this is that the disciple, the domain of the disciple, and the objects are to be brought together in the same taste in the very same seal.

original: byas na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: byas na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens when this is done?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽rang rig ye shes nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / rang rig ye shes nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽It becomes the very intuition of reflexive awareness.

original: rang gzhan yang dag rig pa spangs //
analyzed: rang gzhan yang dag rig pa spangs //
translated: It abandons the correct awareness of self and other.

original: mkha' mnyam rdul bral stong pa nyid //
analyzed: mkha' mnyam rdul bral stong pa nyid //
translated: It is emptiness, equal to space, free from atoms.🔽It is the supreme nature of both entity and non-entity,

original: dngos dang dngos med bdag nyid mchog / thabs dang shes rab shin tu 'dres //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med bdag nyid mchog / thabs dang shes rab shin tu 'dres //
translated: perfectly integrated with method and wisdom,

original: chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres //
analyzed: chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres //
translated: perfectly integrated with attachment and non-attachment.

original: zhes pa de'i tshe rang rig bdag nyid yang dag par rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa de'i tshe rang rig bdag nyid yang dag par rig par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, it becomes the perfect knowledge of the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: de'i phyir rang rig pa ye shes yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rig pa ye shes yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Therefore, reflexive awareness is the perfect wisdom.

original: de khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: de khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is its distinction?

original: rang gzhan yang dag rig pa spangs //
analyzed: rang gzhan yang dag rig pa spangs //
translated: It is free from the perfect knowledge of self and other.

original: bdag dang gzhan du rtog pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du rtog pa spangs pa ste /
translated: It is free from the conception of self and other.

original: de 'di lta bu'o zhes brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir gang zhig ye shes de dpe yis ston pa mkha' mnyam nam mkha' lta bu ste /
analyzed: de 'di lta bu'o zhes brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir gang zhig ye shes de dpe yis ston pa mkha' mnyam nam mkha' lta bu ste /
translated: Since it cannot be said, “It is like this,” the wisdom that is taught through examples is equal to space.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like space because it is without beginning or end.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdul bral dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdul bral dri ma med pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is free from atoms and stainless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid de /
translated: For that very reason, it is emptiness.

original: rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from intrinsic nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,🔽it is the supreme nature of both entity and non-entity.

original: dngos dang dngos med bdag nyid dngos po 'khor ba dang dngos med mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med bdag nyid dngos po 'khor ba dang dngos med mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Reality and unreality are the nature of things, samsara and nirvana.

original: bdag nyid 'khor ba dang rnam par byang ba gnyis dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'khor ba dang rnam par byang ba gnyis dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The nature of things is the inseparability of samsara and nirvana.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog rmad du byung ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog rmad du byung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the supreme marvel,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of the sravakas and so forth.

original: gzhan yang khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is its distinction?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / thabs dang shes rab shin tu 'dres //
analyzed: gsungs pa / thabs dang shes rab shin tu 'dres //
translated: Skillful means and wisdom are well blended.

original: shes rab skyes bu dang thabs btsun mo ste /
analyzed: shes rab skyes bu dang thabs btsun mo ste /
translated: Wisdom is the man, and skillful means is the woman.

original: de dag khyad par du 'dres pa ngo ma dang chu lta bur gnyis su med pa'i ngo bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag khyad par du 'dres pa ngo ma dang chu lta bur gnyis su med pa'i ngo bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are blended in a special way, becoming a nondual essence like water poured into water.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres //
analyzed: chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres //
translated: Attachment and nonattachment are blended.

original: chags pa ni kun du chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chags pa ni kun du chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Attachment is the characteristic of complete attachment.

original: chags bral ni de yongs su spangs pa ste /
analyzed: chags bral ni de yongs su spangs pa ste /
translated: Nonattachment is the complete abandonment of that.

original: spangs pa yang chags pa kho na'o //
analyzed: spangs pa yang chags pa kho na'o //
translated: Abandonment is attachment itself.

original: gnyis ka rim gyis khyad par du 'dres shing 'dres par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka rim gyis khyad par du 'dres shing 'dres par gyur pa ste /
translated: Both gradually merge and become mixed.

original: 'dod chags med cing chags bral med //
analyzed: 'dod chags med cing chags bral med //
translated: There is no passion and no absence of passion.

original: dbu mar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbu mar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not perceived as a middle.

original: rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not realized.

original: 'di nyid lhan cig skyes pa yang dag pa'i de kho na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid lhan cig skyes pa yang dag pa'i de kho na zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the innate, authentic reality.

original: yang na / rang rig pa'i rgyu las ye shes su 'gyur zhing rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na / rang rig pa'i rgyu las ye shes su 'gyur zhing rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, from the cause of self-awareness, there is gnosis and realization.

original: ye shes de yang rang gzhan yang dag rig pa spangs par rang sems so //
analyzed: ye shes de yang rang gzhan yang dag rig pa spangs par rang sems so //
translated: That gnosis is one’s own mind, which is authentic self-awareness, abandoned.

original: gzhan yul dang dbang po'o //
analyzed: gzhan yul dang dbang po'o //
translated: The other is the object and the sense faculty.

original: yang @174b dag rig pa bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yang @174b dag rig pa bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Authentic self-awareness is the experience of pleasure and so on.

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'di rnams kyis bskyed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba spangs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'di rnams kyis bskyed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba spangs par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is abandoned, the experience of pleasure and so on, which is produced by these objects, sense faculties, and consciousnesses.

original: khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: mkha' mnyam mkha' dbang po'o //
analyzed: mkha' mnyam mkha' dbang po'o //
translated: It is equal to space, the lord of space.

original: de dang mnyam pa ni lha'i mig la sogs pa mngon par shes pa'i yon tan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa ni lha'i mig la sogs pa mngon par shes pa'i yon tan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And equal to that is the arising of the qualities of the superknowledges such as the divine eye.

original: de yang rdul bral rim gnyis dri ma med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rdul bral rim gnyis dri ma med par byas pa'o //
translated: And that is made stainless by the two stages free from particles.

original: stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: Emptiness is the nature of suchness.

original: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is beyond all thought and imagination.🔽And that is

original: de yang / dngos po dngos med bdag nyid can //
analyzed: de yang / dngos po dngos med bdag nyid can //
translated: The nature of entity and nonentity.

original: dngos po ni dngos med de /
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos med de /
translated: Entity is nonentity.

original: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po dngos med do //
analyzed: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po dngos med do //
translated: It is entity and nonentity because it is primordially unborn.

original: de'i bdag nyid can de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: The nature of that is its essence.

original: mchog rmad du byung ba ste //
analyzed: mchog rmad du byung ba ste //
translated: It is supreme and marvelous.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of attaining perfect complete enlightenment.

original: yang na gang /
analyzed: yang na gang /
translated: Or else,

original: rang rig las ye shes te /
analyzed: rang rig las ye shes te /
translated: it is the wisdom from self-awareness.

original: dga' ba tsam mo //
analyzed: dga' ba tsam mo //
translated: It is mere joy.

original: rang gzhan yang dag rig pa spangs pa ni mkha' mnyam mchog dga'o //
analyzed: rang gzhan yang dag rig pa spangs pa ni mkha' mnyam mchog dga'o //
translated: Abandoning the correct awareness of self and other is the supreme joy equal to space.

original: rdul bral ni stong ba dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rdul bral ni stong ba dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
translated: The “dust-free” is the joy of the separation from emptiness-joy.

original: dngos dang dngos med bdag nyid ni mchog lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste /
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med bdag nyid ni mchog lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste /
translated: The “nature of entity and non-entity” is the supreme innate joy.

original: bzhi po 'di nyid do //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di nyid do //
translated: These are the four.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gsungs pa / thabs dang shes rab shin tu 'dres pa rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dbyer med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / thabs dang shes rab shin tu 'dres pa rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dbyer med par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is said: “The method and wisdom are thoroughly mixed, becoming the indivisibility of Vajradhara and Nairātmya.”

original: de'i phyir bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhi ste /
translated: Therefore, there are four.

original: chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres //
analyzed: chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres //
translated: Passion and passionlessness are thoroughly mixed.

original: chags pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa byang chub kyi sems khu ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa byang chub kyi sems khu ba'o //
translated: “ Passion” is the bodhicitta of Amitābha, the seminal essence.

original: chags bral ni chags pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa ste /
analyzed: chags bral ni chags pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa ste /
translated: “ Passionlessness” is the complete abandonment of all passion,

original: bde ba lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: the innate joy of bliss.

original: de dag rnam par 'dres pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i ngo bos dbyer med pa ste /🔽de ni bde ba spangs nas min //
analyzed: de dag rnam par 'dres pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i ngo bos dbyer med pa ste / de ni bde ba spangs nas min //
translated: Their “thorough mixing” is their indivisibility by the nature of their superiority.🔽It is said:

original: zhes pa'i gsung las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las so //
translated: “It is not without abandoning bliss.”

original: de'i phyir shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa goms pas dga' ba la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur zhing de las kyang bzhi ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa goms pas dga' ba la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur zhing de las kyang bzhi ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, by cultivating the nonduality of wisdom and means, joy and so forth arise, and from that, the fourth,

original: de nyid bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: which is Vajradhara inseparable from Nairātmya.

original: da ni lta ba thams cad yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi nang du 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni lta ba thams cad yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi nang du 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to teach that all views are included in the inner gnosis of reality, it is said:🔽That is the life of beings.

original: de nyid srog chags rnams kyi srog / rdo rje 'chang de nyid srog chags skye bo rnams kyi srog ste /
analyzed: de nyid srog chags rnams kyi srog / rdo rje 'chang de nyid srog chags skye bo rnams kyi srog ste /
translated: That Vajradhara is the life of beings, of living creatures.

original: de srog gi nang du son pa'i phyir rlung gi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yang de kho na ste /
analyzed: de srog gi nang du son pa'i phyir rlung gi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yang de kho na ste /
translated: Because it is within life, it is also that for yogins of the wind.

original: yang dag par shes pa rnams kyi dngos grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par shes pa rnams kyi dngos grub ces pa'o //
translated: It is the power of those who know reality.

original: yang na rdo rje 'chang de nyid srog chags rnams kyi srog ste /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje 'chang de nyid srog chags rnams kyi srog ste /
translated: Or, that Vajradhara is the life of beings.

original: srog ni sems so //
analyzed: srog ni sems so //
translated: Life is mind.
These

original: rnams la yod pa'i phyir srog chags ni n'a da ste /
analyzed: rnams la yod pa'i phyir srog chags ni n'a da ste /
translated: have it, and so are beings, nāḍīs.

original: 'di rnams kyi srog kyang n'a da dang 'brel pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi srog kyang n'a da dang 'brel pa'i sems so //
translated: The life of these is the mind connected with nāḍī.

original: n'a da yang rlung bcu'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: n'a da yang rlung bcu'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: Nāḍī is of the nature of the ten winds.

original: de las kyang dbang po lnga dang yul lnga rnams so //
analyzed: de las kyang dbang po lnga dang yul lnga rnams so //
translated: From that, the five sense faculties and the five objects.

original: de'i rang bzhin yang rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yang rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: And its nature is Vajradhara.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa kho na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa kho na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Body, speech, and mind, that is, the indivisible three vajras, is indeed Vajradhara.

original: de nyid 'gro ba'i rang bzhin 'di //
analyzed: de nyid 'gro ba'i rang bzhin 'di //
translated: That itself is the nature of the world.

original: zhes pa rang bzhin smra ba rnams kyi snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa cha mnyam par gnas pa ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes pa rang bzhin smra ba rnams kyi snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa cha mnyam par gnas pa ni rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the proponents of primal matter, sattva, rajas, and tamas in equilibrium, is the nature.

original: rang bzhin las rnam 'gyur ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin las rnam 'gyur ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: From that nature, the transformations are the world.

original: zhes pa 'gro ba'i rang bzhin de yang rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa 'gro ba'i rang bzhin de yang rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The nature of the world is also Vajradhara.

original: yang na / 'di zhes pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba gcig pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na / 'di zhes pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba gcig pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Or, this is the nature of the one who is the essence of the animate and inanimate.

original: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin zhes pa 'gro ba gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin zhes pa 'gro ba gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam 'gyur te /
translated: The nature of beings is the transformations of beings, such as the aggregates of form and so on, the elements, the sense bases, and so on.

original: phung po dang khams kyi bdag nyid can 'di ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: phung po dang khams kyi bdag nyid can 'di ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Bhagavān is the nature of the aggregates and elements.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid thams cad khyab pa po //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid thams cad khyab pa po //
translated: Therefore, he is the all-pervading one.

original: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis thams cad khyab pa po ni bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis thams cad khyab pa po ni bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The Bhagavān is the all-pervading one by the nature of beings.

original: khyab 'jug 'gro kun rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khyab 'jug 'gro kun rang bzhin no //
translated: Viṣṇu is the nature of all beings.

original: zhes pa khyab 'jug pa'i lta ba la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zhes pa khyab 'jug pa'i lta ba la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: This is the view of those who abide in the view of Viṣṇu.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad lus la rnam par gnas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad lus la rnam par gnas /
translated: Therefore, he abides in all bodies.

original: thams cad du lus la rnam par gnas shing thams cad kyi'ang lus la rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad du lus la rnam par gnas shing thams cad kyi'ang lus la rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: He abides in all bodies and in the bodies of all.

original: 'di ni / lus gnas ye shes chen po ni ;
analyzed: 'di ni / lus gnas ye shes chen po ni ;
translated: This is the great pristine consciousness that abides in the body,

original: / kun tu rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: / kun tu rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: free from all conceptual thoughts.

original: dngos po thams cad khyab pa po //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad khyab pa po //
translated: He pervades all things.

original: lus la gnas kyang lus skyes min //
analyzed: lus la gnas kyang lus skyes min //
translated: Although he abides in the body, he is not born from the body.

original: zhes pa'o // dngos po dngos med de las byung //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // dngos po dngos med de las byung //
translated: Things and non-things arise from it.🔽The others are whatever they are.

original: gzhan rnams gang rnams de rnams dang // zhes pa dngos po 'khor ba dang dngos med mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams gang rnams de rnams dang // zhes pa dngos po 'khor ba dang dngos med mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Things are cyclic existence and non-things are nirvana.

original: gnyis ka yang de las byung zhing de las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka yang de las byung zhing de las skyes pa ste /
translated: Both arise from it and are born from it.

original: rdo rje 'chang ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vajradhara is the inseparability of the two truths, the conventional and the ultimate.

original: yang na / dngos po thams cad rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: yang na / dngos po thams cad rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Or else, all things are Vajradhara.

original: dngos med mya ngan 'das pa bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: dngos med mya ngan 'das pa bdag med ma ste /
translated: Non-things are nirvana, which is Nairatmya.

original: de gnyis ka yang de las byung zhing de las skyes ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang de las byung zhing de las skyes ba kho na'o //
translated: Both of them arise from it and are born from it.

original: gzhan rnams gang rnams de rnams dang // gzhan rnams zhes pa thams cad kyi sems dang dbyer med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan rnams gang rnams de rnams dang // gzhan rnams zhes pa thams cad kyi sems dang dbyer med pa'i phyir /
translated: The others are whatever they are.

original: gzhan rnams pha rol dbang po drug rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams pha rol dbang po drug rnams so //
translated: The others are the six sense faculties of others.

original: gang rnams de rnams zhes pa /
analyzed: gang rnams de rnams zhes pa /
translated: Whatever they are.

original: gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo //
analyzed: gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo //
translated: Whatever they are, they are the animate and inanimate.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las /
translated: This is from the statement:🔽The animate and inanimate are the six sense faculties.

original: gang rnams zhes pa brtan pa dang // de rnams zhes pa g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: gang rnams zhes pa brtan pa dang // de rnams zhes pa g-yo ba ste /
translated: “Those” refers to the stable, and “those” refers to the unstable.

original: de phyir shes rab dang thabs so //
analyzed: de phyir shes rab dang thabs so //
translated: Therefore, they are wisdom and method.

original: de la @175b dbang po drug go //
analyzed: de la @175b dbang po drug go //
translated: Among them, the six sense faculties.

original: de las brtan pa dang g-yo ba rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las brtan pa dang g-yo ba rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: From that, the stable and unstable are understood.

original: thams cad ye shes kyi nang du 'dus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad ye shes kyi nang du 'dus pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, everything is included in wisdom alone.

original: gzhan yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: sems can rnam shes rab bzhin dang // skyes bu sngon rabs dbang phyug dang // bdag dang gso ba sems can dang // dus dang gang zag nyid dang ni //
analyzed: sems can rnam shes rab bzhin dang // skyes bu sngon rabs dbang phyug dang // bdag dang gso ba sems can dang // dus dang gang zag nyid dang ni //
translated: Consciousness, person, primordial being, Īśvara, self, living being, time, and individual—

original: sems can zhes pa rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: sems can zhes pa rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba rnams kyi ste /
translated: “Sentient being” is for the Vedānta proponents.

original: thams cad kyi tshe 'jig pa dang skye ba rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ye shes de rtag ces pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe 'jig pa dang skye ba rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ye shes de rtag ces pa'o //

original: de yang / de las gzhan ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang / de las gzhan ma yin pa kho na'o //

analyzed: rnam shes rang bzhin zhes pa rnam par shes par smra ba rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi ste /

original: de yang de las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang de las gzhan ma yin no //

original: skyes bu zhes pa snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa cha mnyam par gnas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes pa snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa cha mnyam par gnas pa'i rang bzhin no //

original: rang bzhin las gzhan ni skyes bu ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin las gzhan ni skyes bu ste /
translated: The person is different from the nature.

original: gang rnams kyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi lta ba'o //

original: de yang de'i nang du 'dus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang de'i nang du 'dus pa kho na'o //

original: sngon rabs zhes pa rig byed pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sngon rabs zhes pa rig byed pa rnams kyi'o //

original: dbang phyug ces pa dbang phyug rgyur smra ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ces pa dbang phyug rgyur smra ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The “Lord” is the view of those who say that the Lord is the cause.

original: bdag ces pa tshangs pa'i ye shes smra ba rnams kyi gcig pu dang / rtag pa dang gtso bo dang bdag ces pa gang rnams kyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ces pa tshangs pa'i ye shes smra ba rnams kyi gcig pu dang / rtag pa dang gtso bo dang bdag ces pa gang rnams kyi lta ba'o //
translated: The “self” is the view of those who say that the self is the one, the permanent, the primary, and the self.

analyzed: gso ba zhes pa dngos po thams cad sems dang ldan zhes pa gang rnams kyi lta ba'o //
translated: The “living being” is the view of those who say that all things are endowed with consciousness.

original: sems can zhes pa rgyal po'i lugs kyi bstan bcos rig pa'o //🔽dus zhes pa dus rgyur smra ba rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: sems can zhes pa rgyal po'i lugs kyi bstan bcos rig pa'o // dus zhes pa dus rgyur smra ba rnams kyi ste /
translated: The “sentient being” is the science of the treatises on royal policy.🔽The “time” is the view of those who say that time is the cause.

original: dus ni 'byung po rnams 'tshed cing ;
analyzed: dus ni 'byung po rnams 'tshed cing ;
translated: Time cooks the elements.

original: / dus ni skye dgu sdud par byed /
analyzed: / dus ni skye dgu sdud par byed /
translated: Time is the one that brings beings together.

original: ces pa gang rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: ces pa gang rnams kyi'o //

original: gang zag nyid dang ni zhes pa nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gang zag nyid dang ni zhes pa nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
translated: The person itself is the one of the Śrāvakas.

original: 'dis ni sna tshogs pa'i lta ba la rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi lta ba gang dang gang gi ye shes de thams cad nyi tshe ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni sna tshogs pa'i lta ba la rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi lta ba gang dang gang gi ye shes de thams cad nyi tshe ba ste /
translated: By this, all the wisdoms of the various views of those who abide in various views are limited.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes kyi nang du thams cad 'dus pa kho na'o ;
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes kyi nang du thams cad 'dus pa kho na'o ;
translated: All of them are included only within the wisdom of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: / ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba ni grong khyer gyi rgyal po la sogs pa thams cad kyis bkur zhing mnyes par byed pa de bzhin du yang dag pa'i ye shes de la ye shes thams cad sgro ma btags pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas so zhes pa
analyzed: / ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba ni grong khyer gyi rgyal po la sogs pa thams cad kyis bkur zhing mnyes par byed pa de bzhin du yang dag pa'i ye shes de la ye shes thams cad sgro ma btags pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas so zhes pa
translated: Just as a universal monarch is honored and served by all the kings of the cities, in the same way, all wisdoms abide in that perfect wisdom, without exaggeration.

original: ste / ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams rang nyid mngon du 'ong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid grub pa na /
analyzed: ste / ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams rang nyid mngon du 'ong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid grub pa na /
translated: Just as in the Perfection of Wisdom, giving and so forth are themselves the perfection of wisdom, so here, when the knowledge of all aspects is accomplished,

original: de las gzhan mi 'grub pa ga la yod de /
analyzed: de las gzhan mi 'grub pa ga la yod de /
translated: how could anything else not be accomplished?

original: rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes dang ldan pa ni thams cad grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes dang ldan pa ni thams cad grub pa kho na'o //
translated: One who possesses the exalted wisdom of Vajradhara has accomplished everything.

original: 'on kyang goms pa med par thar pa thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang goms pa med par thar pa thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: However, since liberation is not attained without cultivation,

original: 'di dag goms par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag goms par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: one should cultivate these.

original: @176a * // yang na /
analyzed: @176a * // yang na /

analyzed: sems dpa' zhes pa srid pa gsum dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: “hero” is the exalted wisdom of the indivisibility of the three existences.

original: rnam shes rang bzhin zhes pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam shes rang bzhin zhes pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: “Consciousness by nature” is the nature of exalted wisdom that is especially exalted.

original: skyes bu zhes pa rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin ma ning do //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes pa rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin ma ning do //
translated: “Person” is the nature of Vajradhara, which is neuter.

original: sngon rabs zhes pa thog ma dang tha ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon rabs zhes pa thog ma dang tha ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Ancient” is because beginning and end are not observed.

original: dbang phyug ces pa /
analyzed: dbang phyug ces pa /
translated: “Lord” is

original: rang nyid 'phrog po rang byed po //
analyzed: rang nyid 'phrog po rang byed po //
translated: One is oneself the thief, oneself the murderer.

original: zhes pa bdag nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa bdag nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the self is the principal one.

original: bdag ces pa gzhan dang gzhan 'ga' yang med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag ces pa gzhan dang gzhan 'ga' yang med pa ste /
translated: The so-called self is not anything at all.

original: de med pa'i phyir bdag kyang med do //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir bdag kyang med do //
translated: Since it does not exist, the self does not exist.

original: gso ba zhes pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las rtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //🔽thams cad ces pa 'jig pa dang skye ba spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gso ba zhes pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las rtogs pa'i rnam pa'o // thams cad ces pa 'jig pa dang skye ba spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: The so-called cure is the form of realization that comes from omniscience itself.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: The so-called all is neither permanent nor impermanent, because it is free from destruction and origination.

original: dus zhes pa rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dus zhes pa rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo'o //

analyzed: gang zag ces pa sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid can chos kyi sku kho na'o //

original: thams cad kyi mjug bsdu bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyi mjug bsdu bar gsungs pa /

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'di //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'di //

analyzed: sgyu ma'i gzugs kyis yang dag gnas //

original: zhes pa'o ; / de nyid kyi phyir dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin dang ngo bo srog dang rnam par shes pas rlung gi rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i de kho na'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa'o ; / de nyid kyi phyir dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin dang ngo bo srog dang rnam par shes pas rlung gi rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i de kho na'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature and essence of all things, life, and consciousness, is the nature of reality, such as the yoga of the vital wind.

original: 'di ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gsungs pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar rang bzhin thams cad bden pa ma yin brdzun pa ma yin pa de bzhin du //
translated: Because, just as the nature of all things is neither true nor false,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang bden pa dang mi bden pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad khyab pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: the Bhagavān is also beyond analysis as true or false, permanent or impermanent, and so on. Therefore, he pervades everything, the nature of all things.

analyzed: yang dag gnas zhes pa yang dag pa'i rim pas g-yo ba med pa ste /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes nyid las g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //

analyzed: zhes pa ; rang rig las ni ye shes 'gyur //

original: zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa /

analyzed: chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres //

analyzed: dang por dga' ba tsam nyid de //

original: gnyis pa'i grangs las mchog dga'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i grangs las mchog dga'o //

original: gsum pa la ni dga' bral bshad //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni dga' bral bshad //

original: bzhi pa lhan cig skyes par brjod //
analyzed: bzhi pa lhan cig skyes par brjod //

analyzed: ces pa dang po dga' ba tsam ni ye shes 'ba' zhig kho na'o //
translated: The first, mere joy, is only wisdom.

original: gnyis pa'i grangs las mchog dga' ni //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i grangs las mchog dga' ni //
translated: From the number two, supreme joy

original: de nyid shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: is the nature of wisdom and method.

original: gsum pa la ni dga' bral bshad //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni dga' bral bshad //
translated: The third is explained as the absence of joy

analyzed: ces pa gcig gi phyir skyes pa'i tshe lhan cig pa skyes pa ste /

analyzed: sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa kho na lhan cig skyes pa dang de nyid bzhi pa'o //

original: 'dis ci gsungs na /
analyzed: 'dis ci gsungs na /

analyzed: dang po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes tsam 'ba' zhig go //

original: de nyid mchog dga' ste /
analyzed: de nyid mchog dga' ste /

analyzed: de ni gnyis pa'i grangs zhes pa shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin grangs gnyis kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: gsum pa la ni dga' bral bshad //

analyzed: dga' bral bshad gang gi phyir gnyis ka snyoms par zhugs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' ba nyid kyis so //

analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnams kyi rdzogs pa ste /

analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig skyes pa tha med pa'i ngo bos skyes pa'i phyir lhan cig gcig gi tshe skyes pa'o /

analyzed: de yang / shing dang bong ba la sogs pa lta bu ma yin gyi dran pa ye shes kho na'o //

analyzed: 'dis ni gcig dang gnyis dang gsum ste / rdor je gsum dbyer med pa lhan skyes pa yin gyi /

analyzed: dga' ba gsum las gzhan pa'i bzhi pa med pa kho na'o /
