analyzed: mkhas pa kun zhes pa rtogs pa ste /
translated: The wise, all, means the realization.

original: shes pa dang shes bya'i rtogs pa nyid kyis 'jug pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya'i rtogs pa nyid kyis 'jug pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: The five aggregates of form and so on are engaged by the realization of consciousness and the object of consciousness.

original: 'gyel ba ni lhan cig skyes par thim pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyel ba ni lhan cig skyes par thim pa'o //
translated: The falling is the dissolution into the innate.

original: slar yang gang gi tshe aa ya rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: slar yang gang gi tshe aa ya rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Again, when the a ya is consciousness,

original: lha mo'i padma'i nang du rdo rje snying po las 'dzag pa rdo rje'i lte ba nyid de /
analyzed: lha mo'i padma'i nang du rdo rje snying po las 'dzag pa rdo rje'i lte ba nyid de /
translated: it drips from the vajra essence into the lotus of the goddess, the center of the vajra.

original: de'i tshe mkhas pa thams cad mchog tu ngo mtshar gyur nas ni zhes pa mchog dga' la ngo mtshar sngar med pa nyams su myong bas yid rang gi yul la mi gnas pa nyid rnyed par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe mkhas pa thams cad mchog tu ngo mtshar gyur nas ni zhes pa mchog dga' la ngo mtshar sngar med pa nyams su myong bas yid rang gi yul la mi gnas pa nyid rnyed par gyur to //
translated: This means that supreme joy is experienced as a wonder never before known, and the mind itself finds that it no longer dwells on its own objects.

original: 'dis ni dbang po rnams yul la bde ba'i rnam pa nyams su myong bas 'jug pa ldog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni dbang po rnams yul la bde ba'i rnam pa nyams su myong bas 'jug pa ldog pa'o //
translated: This is the reversal of the engagement of the senses in the experience of the aspect of bliss in the objects.

original: brgyal ba ni dga' bral gyi dga' ba'i dus na rmongs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: brgyal ba ni dga' bral gyi dga' ba'i dus na rmongs par gyur pa ste /
translated: Swoon is the delusion that occurs at the time of the joy of separation from joy.

original: rmongs par gyur pa ni ji ltar rnam par shes pa yod kyang byed pa cung zad kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs par gyur pa ni ji ltar rnam par shes pa yod kyang byed pa cung zad kyang med pa'o //
translated: Delusion is such that, although consciousness is present, there is no activity whatsoever.

original: de bzhin du dbang po rnams kyang 'dod chags chen po'i kun tu chags pas rang gi chags pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po rnams kyang 'dod chags chen po'i kun tu chags pas rang gi chags pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the senses are also liberated from their own attachment through the attachment of great passion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: dang por dga' ba 'gro ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: dang por dga' ba 'gro ba'i gzugs //
translated: first, the form of going of joy

original: 'gro ba zhes pa ye shes lnga dang sku gsum ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes pa ye shes lnga dang sku gsum ste /
translated: The so-called going is the five wisdoms and the three bodies.

original: de'i gzugs ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i gzugs ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Its form is its nature.

original: dang po ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The first is nondual,

original: gang gi phyir dga' ba zhes pa bde ba nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dga' ba zhes pa bde ba nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: because bliss is the characteristic of the experience of pleasure.

original: de bzhin mchog dga' 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin mchog dga' 'gro ba'o //
translated: The supreme pleasure is the movement of the downward-voiding wind.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de bas lhag pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: de bas lhag pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba yod pa'o //
translated: It is the experience of a pleasure that is greater than that.

original: dga' bral dga' ba'ang 'gro ba nyid //
analyzed: dga' bral dga' ba'ang 'gro ba nyid //
translated: The pleasure of the separation from pleasure is also the movement of the downward-voiding wind.🔽What is that?

original: de bas lhag pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: de bas lhag pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba yod pa'o //
translated: It is the experience of a pleasure that is greater than that.

original: dga' ba gsum po rnams la yang lhan cig skyes pa yod mod kyi 'on kyang med pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba gsum po rnams la yang lhan cig skyes pa yod mod kyi 'on kyang med pa ste /
translated: Although there is innate bliss in the three kinds of pleasure, it is not recognized.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa nye bar mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa nye bar mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid de /
translated: The innate is the nature of the movement of the downward-voiding wind, because its nature is not perceived as permanent or impermanent, blissful or not blissful, existent or nonexistent, and so on.

original: khu ba dang bde ba dag las rgyu tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khu ba dang bde ba dag las rgyu tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the innate is a different cause from semen and bliss.

original: rgyu 'di nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: For this very reason, the innate is the Bhagavān,🔽the great bliss.

original: lha mo'i padma'i nang du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha mo'i padma'i nang du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it abides in the lotus of the goddess.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kye'i rdo rje bden pa @177b gnyis kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kye'i rdo rje bden pa @177b gnyis kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: For that very reason, the Bhagavān is the nature of the two truths,

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyal kun gyi sku gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dbyer med pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyal kun gyi sku gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dbyer med pa'i sku'o //
translated: because he is the single body of all buddhas, the body of all tathāgatas inseparable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bka' stsal pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bka' stsal pa gsungs te /
translated: For that very reason, he is said to be the Bhagavān,

original: snang ba mngon par brjod pa /
analyzed: snang ba mngon par brjod pa /
translated: the expression of appearance,

original: yang dag par rig pa /🔽ye shes lnga'i sku nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa / ye shes lnga'i sku nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: the perfect knowledge,

original: mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: the body of the five gnoses, because he is the nature of expression.

original: ci gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci gsungs she na /
translated: What was said?

original: the tshom legs par sel ba ni //
analyzed: the tshom legs par sel ba ni //
translated: The removal of doubts

original: rdo rje snying pos rtogs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos rtogs bya'i phyir //
translated: is for the realization of Vajragarbha.

original: zhes pa rdo rje snying po la sogs pa rnams kyi the tshom ni gang zhig gsum po rnams la'ang lhan cig skyes pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje snying po la sogs pa rnams kyi the tshom ni gang zhig gsum po rnams la'ang lhan cig skyes pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di yin te /
translated: The doubt of Vajragarbha and so on is this: “The three are not connate.”

original: the tshom sel ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom sel ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: The removal of that doubt is stated.

original: rdo rje snying pos rtogs bya'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos rtogs bya'i phyir /
translated: Is for the realization of Vajragarbha.

original: khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: in order to make it understood.

original: rdo rje snying po nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the essence of the vajra is fully enlightened, all the transcendent lords are fully enlightened.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'dod chags med cing chags bral med //
analyzed: 'dod chags med cing chags bral med //
translated: There is no passion and no absence of passion,

original: dbu ma dmigs par mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: dbu ma dmigs par mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: nor is there a middle to be apprehended.

original: / gsum po spangs pa nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: / gsum po spangs pa nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Because of the abandonment of the three,

original: lhan skyes rdzogs pa'i byang chub brjod //
analyzed: lhan skyes rdzogs pa'i byang chub brjod //
translated: the innate is declared to be perfect enlightenment.

original: dga' ba gsum po rnams spangs shing kun nas dkris pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dga' ba gsum po rnams spangs shing kun nas dkris pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the abandonment of the three joys and the complete abandonment of all the entanglements,

original: slar yang lhan cig skyes pa kun du chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: slar yang lhan cig skyes pa kun du chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the innate is again declared to be the characteristic of non-passion.

original: gsum po spangs pa 'dis ni lhan cig skyes pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu brjod de /
analyzed: gsum po spangs pa 'dis ni lhan cig skyes pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu brjod de /
translated: By this abandonment of the three, the innate is declared to be perfect enlightenment.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kye'i rdo rje stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kye'i rdo rje stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'o //
translated: That is the transcendent lord Hevajra, the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gcig pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gcig pa /
translated: The one body of all the Buddhas.

original: thams cad khong du chud pas gnyes su med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad khong du chud pas gnyes su med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is realized as the non-duality of all things, because of the realization of all things.

original: sku ni kun du chags pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sku ni kun du chags pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The body is free from attachment.

original: rdo rje snying po mi phyed pa'i sku'i the tshom sel ba rtog pa yongs su spong ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po mi phyed pa'i sku'i the tshom sel ba rtog pa yongs su spong ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the vajra essence, the body free from doubt, the abandonment of conceptual thought, the nature of non-conceptuality.

original: legs pa ni lha'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: legs pa ni lha'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: The good is the nature of the gods.

original: rtogs bya'i phyir yang dag par rtogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: rtogs bya'i phyir yang dag par rtogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i ched du'o //
translated: For the sake of realization, for the sake of attaining the enlightenment of perfect realization.

original: bka' stsal ba ni dus gsum khyab cing ston par mdzad pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal ba ni dus gsum khyab cing ston par mdzad pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The statement is the pervader and teacher of the three times.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He himself said this:

original: 'dod chags kun tu chags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kun tu chags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: Desire is not characterized by attachment.

original: chags bral de yongs su spangs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chags bral de yongs su spangs pa med pa'o //
translated: Separation from attachment is not abandoned.

original: 'di gnyis ka yang med de /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka yang med de /
translated: These two do not exist.

original: gnyis ka rtogs pa'i phyir dbu ma'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka rtogs pa'i phyir dbu ma'o //
translated: Because of the realization of both, it is the middle way.

original: de yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That also is not an object,

original: dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the nature of non-objectification.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsum po spangs pa'i phyir chags pa dang chags pa med pa dang / @178a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsum po spangs pa'i phyir chags pa dang chags pa med pa dang / @178a * //
translated: Therefore, because of the abandonment of the three, he is beyond attachment and non-attachment,

original: gnyis ka'i chags pa las kyang 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i chags pa las kyang 'das pa ste /
translated: and beyond attachment to both.

original: mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: He is like the son of a barren woman.

original: 'dis ni gsum po yang yongs su spangs pa gang yin pa de nyid lhan skyes rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'dis ni gsum po yang yongs su spangs pa gang yin pa de nyid lhan skyes rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes so //
translated: This shows that the very abandonment of the three is the innate, perfect enlightenment, the intuition of perfect enlightenment.

original: yang na / gang 'dod chags med pa ni 'khor ba med pa'o /
analyzed: yang na / gang 'dod chags med pa ni 'khor ba med pa'o /
translated: Or else, non-attachment is non-samsara;

original: chags bral med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chags bral med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa med pa ste /
translated: non-non-attachment is non-nirvana.

original: gang zhig 'khor ba med cing mya ngan las 'das pa med pa de ni dbu ma'i mthar brjod do //
analyzed: gang zhig 'khor ba med cing mya ngan las 'das pa med pa de ni dbu ma'i mthar brjod do //
translated: He who has no samsara and no nirvana is said to reach the middle way.

original: de yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And that is not an object,

original: dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is essentially non-apprehensible.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsum po spangs par dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsum po spangs par dmigs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, because of the abandonment of the three, he is not an object.

original: rgyu 'di nyid kyi phyir lhan cig skyes pa nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid kyi phyir lhan cig skyes pa nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces brjod do //
translated: For this very reason, co-emergence is called perfect enlightenment.

original: yang na gang /
analyzed: yang na gang /
translated: Or else,

original: 'dod chags med pa ni mchog dga' ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa ni mchog dga' ma yin pa'o //
translated: non-attachment is not the supreme joy.

original: chags bral med pa ni dga' bral gyi dga' ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chags bral med pa ni dga' bral gyi dga' ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-separation is not the joy of separation from joy.🔽Non-middle is just the joy of the middle.

original: dbu ma med pa ni dbu ma dga' ba tsam nyid de zhes pa'i gsung las de thams cad mi dmigs par gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: dbu ma med pa ni dbu ma dga' ba tsam nyid de zhes pa'i gsung las de thams cad mi dmigs par gyur pa'o ;
translated: From the statement, “all of that becomes non-apprehended,”

original: / lhan cig skyes pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: / lhan cig skyes pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin /
translated: the nature of co-emergent perfect enlightenment

original: nges par rtogs pa na gsum po rnams kyang rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa na gsum po rnams kyang rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: is ascertained. When realized, the three are also realized,🔽because the mandala itself is abandoned.

original: dkyil 'khor nyid spangs pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor nyid spangs pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention.

original: de nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir //
translated: For this very reason,🔽it is said:

original: yang na de nyid thams cad bdag //
analyzed: yang na de nyid thams cad bdag //
translated: Or else, it is all of that itself,

original: yang na kun gyis rnam par spangs //
analyzed: yang na kun gyis rnam par spangs //
translated: or else, it is completely abandoned by all.

original: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid las thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid las thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: From the nature of migrating beings, it is the nature of all.

original: thams cad kyis yongs su spangs pa yang 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid las te /
analyzed: thams cad kyis yongs su spangs pa yang 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid las te /
translated: Also, abandoned by all, from the very nature of the migrating beings,

original: ro mnyam par gyur pas tha dad pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro mnyam par gyur pas tha dad pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absence of the realization of difference due to the state of equality.

original: gzhan yang yang na zhes pa dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gzhan yang yang na zhes pa dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, “or” refers to the two inseparable maṇḍalas.

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni /
translated: The nature of all

original: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
translated: is from the very nature of migrating beings.

original: de nyid ces pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin cha dang bral ba nyid la sdud pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin cha dang bral ba nyid la sdud pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “That itself” is the form of the gathering in the nature of wisdom, free from parts.

original: yang na 'gro ba thams cad kyis rnam par spangs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba thams cad kyis rnam par spangs pa ste /
translated: Or, abandoned by all migrating beings,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis rdo rje 'chang dbyer med pas spro ba'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams la de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis rdo rje 'chang dbyer med pas spro ba'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams la de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa'o //
translated: the nature of the emanation of those tathāgatas, who are inseparable from Vajradhara, is the mode of various aspects.

original: de yang / rdo rje 'chang spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang / rdo rje 'chang spangs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, abandoned by Vajradhara,

original: de rnams las kyang tha dad pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams las kyang tha dad pa zhes pa'o //
translated: they are also separate from him.

original: dga' bral dang por mtshon bya ste //
analyzed: dga' bral dang por mtshon bya ste //
translated: The first is illustrated as the separation of joy.

original: de yang dga' ba gsum po spangs //
analyzed: de yang dga' ba gsum po spangs //
translated: Moreover, it is the third joy that is abandoned.

original: lhan cig skyes pa de lta bu'i ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa de lta bu'i ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is that innate joy to be understood?

original: thabs ston pa dga' bral dang / dang po yang dga' bral dang po'o //
analyzed: thabs ston pa dga' bral dang / dang po yang dga' bral dang po'o //
translated: The method is taught: “the first separation from joy is the first separation from joy.”

original: dang po'i sgras @178b dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dang po'i sgras @178b dga' ba'o //
translated: The word “first” refers to joy.

original: dga' bral gyi sgras dga' dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' bral gyi sgras dga' dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
translated: The word “separation from joy” refers to the joy of separation from joy.

original: so sor sdud gzung ba'i phyir dbu mchog dga' yang ste /
analyzed: so sor sdud gzung ba'i phyir dbu mchog dga' yang ste /
translated: Since it is held to be the middle way, it is also supreme joy.

original: de'i tshe lhan cig skyes pa de mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe lhan cig skyes pa de mtshon par bya'o //
translated: At that time, that innate joy is to be illustrated.

original: khyad par ci zhe na dga' ba gsum po spangs pas dga' ba gsum po yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na dga' ba gsum po spangs pas dga' ba gsum po yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: What is the difference? It is the third joy that is abandoned, so it is the complete abandonment of the three joys.

original: yang na dga' bral dang por zhes pa 'di dga' bral dang po yang yin pa'i phyir dga' bral dang po ste mchog dga'o //
analyzed: yang na dga' bral dang por zhes pa 'di dga' bral dang po yang yin pa'i phyir dga' bral dang po ste mchog dga'o //
translated: Or else, “the first separation from joy” is the first separation from joy because it is the first separation from joy, which is supreme joy.

original: dga' bral dang po de'i tshe lhan cig skyes pa de mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' bral dang po de'i tshe lhan cig skyes pa de mtshon par bya'o //
translated: At the time of the first separation from joy, that innate joy is to be illustrated.

original: khyad par ci zhe na dga' ba gsum po spangs /
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na dga' ba gsum po spangs /
translated: What is the difference? It is the third joy that is abandoned.

original: dga' ba gsum las gzhan ma yin pa'i ji ltar spangs zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ba gsum las gzhan ma yin pa'i ji ltar spangs zhe na /
translated: How can it be abandoned if it is not different from the three joys?

original: yongs su spong ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su spong ba ste /
translated: It is completely abandoned.

original: lha mo'i padma'i nang du son par gyur pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lha mo'i padma'i nang du son par gyur pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it enters the lotus of the goddess.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i lhan cig skyes pa //

analyzed: dga' bral gyi dga' bar gyur pa'i skad cig de nyid la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa'i dga' ba la bde gcig pu tsam gyi ngo bor rtogs pa na rmi lam lta bur snang ste rmi lam gyi shes pa
translated: In that instant of the joy of separation from joy, when the joy of clinging to the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses is realized to be the nature of mere bliss alone, it appears like a dream.

analyzed: la yang de nyid dkyil 'khor bsgom par byed cing yang dag par rtogs pa thob par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma ste /

analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /

analyzed: dang po sprin dang 'dra bar snang //

original: glo bur rmi lam lta bur snang //
analyzed: glo bur rmi lam lta bur snang //

original: nyal dang sad pa dbyer med bzhin //
analyzed: nyal dang sad pa dbyer med bzhin //
translated: Like sleeping and waking are inseparable.

translated: When one is first meditating on the mandala, it is like a cloud. Just as clouds in the sky are not at all existent by way of their own nature, which is devoid of reference points, and they are a mere coming together of one thing after another,

analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor yang lha gzhan dang gzhan 'dus pa dmigs pa med pa dmigs shing so sor snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, the mandala is also a mere coming together of one deity after another, which is devoid of reference points, and it appears and is perceived individually.

analyzed: glo bur zhes ba skad cig ste /

analyzed: de rnams kyi sa bon du gyur pa'i phyir me tog des nye bar brgyan pa ste /

analyzed: / gzhan yang khyad par ci zhe na /

original: de khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: de khyad par ci zhe na /

analyzed: bdug pa zhes pa bsreg ba'i bdag nyid kyis rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo'o //

analyzed: sgron ma zhes pa snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid las 'od gsal ba'o //

analyzed: ldan zhes pa zung 'jug ste shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'o ;

analyzed: / bum pa brgyang la sogs pa ni ka la n'a da ste /

analyzed: shya ni phra mor byed pa'i phyir bum pa cha dang bral ba bzhi pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //

analyzed: brgyad kyi sgras mkha' 'gro ma brgyad rnams te brgyad dang bum pa yang bum pa brgyad do //

translated: The mantra beginning with “a” is the very first “a” sound.

original: de sngags dang ye shes gang gi rgyu'i gtso bo yin pa ni aa yig dang po'i sngags so //
analyzed: de sngags dang ye shes gang gi rgyu'i gtso bo yin pa ni aa yig dang po'i sngags so //
translated: That which is the principal cause of the mantra and intuition is the mantra beginning with “a. ”

original: des na aa yig gi sgras bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: des na aa yig gi sgras bdag med ma ste /
translated: Therefore, the term “a” is Nairātmya,

original: ye shes thams cad de'i rang bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: ye shes thams cad de'i rang bzhin kho na'o //
translated: and all intuitions are just her nature.

original: de'i phyir gong sngar sbyin zhing yongs su spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gong sngar sbyin zhing yongs su spang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should give and completely abandon the above.

original: 'dir thog ma nyid med do //
analyzed: 'dir thog ma nyid med do //
translated: Here there is no beginning at all.

original: de med pa'i phyir tham dang dbus kyang med do //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir tham dang dbus kyang med do //
translated: Because of the absence of that, there is no end or middle.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad bdag med ma dang ldan par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad bdag med ma dang ldan par gyur pa ste /
translated: Therefore, all is endowed with Nairātmya,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par mnyes par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par mnyes par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: and all the Tathāgatas are satisfied.

original: srung ba ji ltar gsungs pa nyid //
analyzed: srung ba ji ltar gsungs pa nyid //
translated: As for the protection, it is just as taught.

original: ji ltar bsam gtan de bzhin 'dir //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan de bzhin 'dir //
translated: As for the meditation, it is just like that here.

original: zhes pa 'bad pas h'um las rdo rje can byas te zhes pa gang zhig mdor bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa 'bad pas h'um las rdo rje can byas te zhes pa gang zhig mdor bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the extensive explanation of what was taught in brief by the passage beginning with “the one who, having made the vajra from the syllable hūṃ, with effort . . .”

original: re phas nyi ma sngon du rnam bsgom zhing //
analyzed: re phas nyi ma sngon du rnam bsgom zhing //
translated: One should visualize the sun with the syllable raṃ,

original: nyi der h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje ste /
analyzed: nyi der h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje ste /
translated: and from that sun, the syllable hūṃ becomes a vajra cross.

original: rdo rje de nyid kyi ra ba dang / gur bcing pa yang rnam par bsgom par bya zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje de nyid kyi ra ba dang / gur bcing pa yang rnam par bsgom par bya zhes pa ste /
translated: One should visualize that vajra cross as a fence and a pavilion.

original: bsam gtan la ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba la yang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan la ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba la yang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, just as in the case of the meditation, so it is here in the case of the maṇḍala rite.

original: re phas nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa la nang gi don ni lha'i le'u nyid du bshad zin pa'i phyir 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: re phas nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa la nang gi don ni lha'i le'u nyid du bshad zin pa'i phyir 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: The inner meaning of the verses beginning with “the sun” and so on has already been explained in the chapter on the deity, so it is not mentioned here.

original: dkyil 'khor der dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor der dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that initiation should be given in that maṇḍala.🔽To whom is initiation given?

original: gang zhig dbang ni rab gsal ba //
analyzed: gang zhig dbang ni rab gsal ba //
translated: To whom initiation is clear,

original: rang gi dkyil 'khor cho gas sbyin //
analyzed: rang gi dkyil 'khor cho gas sbyin //
translated: it is given in one’s maṇḍala according to the rite.

original: gang zhig chu la sogs pa'i dbang bskur ba gsungs pa de dang de rnams cho ga bzhin du cho ga'i rim pas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig chu la sogs pa'i dbang bskur ba gsungs pa de dang de rnams cho ga bzhin du cho ga'i rim pas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: To whom the initiation of water and so on is taught, to them that initiation is given according to the rite, by the sequence of the rite.

original: rang gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa lhag par mos pa'i khyad par gyi dkyil 'khor byas te zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa lhag par mos pa'i khyad par gyi dkyil 'khor byas te zhes pa'i don to //
translated: One’s maṇḍala means having made the maṇḍala of special imagination.

original: yang na / gang zhig dbang ni dbang bskur ba ste /
analyzed: yang na / gang zhig dbang ni dbang bskur ba ste /
translated: Or, to whom initiation is initiation,

original: sgrib pa dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: it is the removal of obscurations.

original: khyad par ce zhi na /
analyzed: khyad par ce zhi na /
translated: What is special about it?
